Reviews.Title: “Great location super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Danpengillmer
Reviews.Content: Place had a buzz, best for younger set, staff very service oriented, even room service food was prompt nd good. Restaurant not great

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff & room. Dining experience was relaxing with good food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: handrewn
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, furnished well and big enough for the two occupants. The elevator security was good. We enjoyed the first floor bar/restaurant - good food and drink and friendly staff. Hotel's location was convenient. We go to Chicago every year year for a trade show. The Wit was the 7th hotel we've stayed at, and we'll return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional property and service”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: My note to HHonors regarding this hotel....This is my second stay at theWit and both by far have been the best Hilton experience this HHonors member has ever experienced. The staff, from the bellman, to the front desk, to housekeeping has an exceptionally pleasing attitude which makes you feel completely at home. This will become the only hotel for me and my staff in Chicago. Whomever is managing this team is doing a phenomenal job. It takes true leadership to deliver this consistent level of energetic, customer-centric service. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: ChiHub
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wit on St Patrick's day and received great service I'm a hilton honors diamond member and they treated my family like royalty! The breakfast vouchers were the beat ever received Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to say. Not sure about value though.”
Reviews.Author: workhurts
Reviews.Content: First of all, this trip was paid for by work and was for only a single day. The hotel is located very close to the Metro so getting to it from the airport (although a longish trip) is a cinch and super cheap. The proximity of the hotel to the Theater 'district' is a plus and it's within walking distance to a few restaurants. We had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel and it was good. The rooftop lounge has phenomenal views. The rooms were nice and comfy. Nothing to complain about at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: muethibp
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. The service was good, the common areas are quite nice, the rooftop bar is very cool and modern. There were a few drawbacks but nothing too big: there was a sliding door of sorts to the bathroom, not a full door, so the bathroom got cold; the food in the main lobby restaurant - had both breakfast and dinner over a three-day stay - was good but not great; the business center charges something like $1 a page to print black-and-white pages so printing a 20 page document was $20. That's ridiculous and out of touch with the offerings at most other hotels, particularly a high-end hotel in/near a business district. Still, though, positive experience and I would strongly consider a return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: cmp5314
Reviews.Content: Customer service at its best. Great location. The bed was like being held in someone's arms. I love this place and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “theWit Raises the Bar for Double Tree”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRVA2001
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure how theWit fits into the Double Tree brand because it's unlike any Double Tree I've ever stayed out. The hotel has an honest modern/cool/hip vibe - it doesn't feel overdone and isn't trying too hard like some other hotels. The staff is extremely friendly and well polished and is what you'd expect to find at a 5 star hotel, but without the attitude.. The accommodations are simply fantastic. I was traveling on business and checked-in on Valentine's day - there was a very nice note and a plate of heart shaped cookies waiting for me in my room. It's those small thoughtful details that sets this hotel apart. Unfortunately for Double Tree, theWit sets expectations so high for the Double Tree brand that their other hotels just can't match

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AnneSchmitt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in August. I was alone and I had never been to Chicago before. I was there simply for tourist reasons. The hotel was perfect. The rooms were amazing. Any amenity I needed. I took a bubble bath in a beautiful tub overlooking Chicago and the lake. The location was perfect for everything I wanted to do. I was in walking/biking distance of Navy Pier, miles of walking and bike trails on the lake, the, Symphony park (where I enjoyed champaign and pate while listening to the symphony), boat tours and more. I don' think I got in a cab or on the L once. Though, I did have a bike at my disposal. The club on their roof is awesome if you are young and hip. I am not, but I did enjoy seeing it. Apparently, on Friday and Saturday nights, it is impossible to get in unless you are beautiful or a guest of the hotel. The Spa was a great way to end my trip after I had checked out of the hotel at Noon. I asked the concierge for recommendations for theatre show, etc. and he gave me tickets to Chicago Live for that day.

Reviews.Title: “Our weekend at theWit”
Reviews.Author: CAR50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wit three nights. The front staff was very friendly and helpful. We were on the 10th floor with a good view of the city looking south and west. We were a little concerned about the noise of the El right below us, but it ended up not being a problem. the bed was very comfortable. We loved the bathroom with it being quite large and with a good shower and tub. It was within easy walking distance of all the eating places we wanted to go to and also all of our bus stops and train stations. Our only negative was the service and quality of food at the restaurant the first morning. We thought we had left enough time for breakfast to catch our train to the Auto Show, but with the slow service, we were walking into the train station and buying our tickets just as they were loading the train. The quality of our eggs and bacon that first morning was not very good. However, we ate there three mornings, and the quality of the breakfast and the service kept getting better. Parking is very expensive at $50/night, valet parking only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jonezy
Reviews.Content: The Wit is a great hotel which has many modern styles and touches without being cold or industrial. The staff is very helpful and professional. Rooms are roomy but can be a little noisy if you are facing the L (east side of the hotel). This didnâ€™t bother us too much but others may be more sensitive to the noise. The top floor bar is great and in the summer a great area to sit outside. Location is perfect next to the L and an easy walk to the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: Very smooth flirtly type hotel.. Lots of people watchinmg etc. great for singles. bad for kids. good rooftop and lively restaurant. Barmen up their own trousers a bit but apart from that very cool hotel bang in middle of downtown chicago

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: gfourman
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip for our anniversary and stayed a week. We could not pay for a suite for the entire stayed but booked it for our last two nights. When we arrived the front desk staff was wonderful. The greeted us warmly and were extremely polite. The noticed we booked the suite for the last two nights and gave it to us for the entire stay. The room was absolutely amazing. We had a great view of the Chicago River in our two bedroom suite. The decor was all modern but very comfortable and we even had a kitchen. The bed was so comfortable I did not want to get out of it in the morning. My wife was a huge fan of the giant bathroom and huge soaking tub. I could go on and on about how wonderful the room was but it is only half the story. We were there a week and seemed to have met every person on the staff there. They are all wonderful, polite and helpful. I was always treated like someone special. The bell staff was top notch too. They always held the door open for us no matter how busy they were. The only annoyance was the drunks on the weekend using the elevator to go up to the hip bar on the roof. But the staff always made sure we had an elevator. I would highly recommend this hotel and we liked it so much we are going back again this summer and staying at the Wit.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Some bad and a little ugly”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday night the 10th at the Wit. We arrived at about 730pm and valet was quick and wonderful. The check in process went so easy and friendly. The Concierge on duty was so nice and sweet to our daughter. Bell Person who brought up the luggage was great and the knowledge about our room and features was great. I have to say the room lacks a bit. We had a 2 queen bedded room. There were two wash clothes, 2 hand towels and 3 bath towels. I could have called for more but I should not have to. With 2 queens they should know in Housekeeping that type of room usually has more than 2 people in it. Next was the dust we could write our names on the desk. I do understand with the heat on and this time of year dust does happen and the furniture is condusive to dust. The lamp between the two beds has two bulbs of which one was broke. I wanted to order dinner from in room dining there was no menu in the room I checked the on screen on the phone all I could get it to do was call room service. Yes I can call and ask for this but I do not want to I want it there. The beds were ok not the most comfortable in the city mattress wise but the comforter was great. The heating system was loud in our room and that made it hard to sleep. When taking a shower the hand held kept moving and spraying out to the floor. The only other thing I did not like about the room is the bathroom door is not easy to open and close. Would I stay again? I have to say I enjoy the city North of the river. I felt like unless you were there for business or to party at the Rooftop (which is incredible) this is not for us. If you have theater tickets and want a close hotel great location. This was a hard review to write I really wanted to love the hotel and I have seen other rooms that were much nicer than ours and yes the suites are nice. The staff is all sooooo nice and easy to work with so I really just would suggest pick up on the little things and it could really be above average.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: ben1233
Reviews.Content: I loved the Wit, exceeded expectations on all levels. When I arrived, checkin was speedy yet personable. All the staff was excellent -- I wish I would've taken note of their names. I was recognized as being a Hilton Gold member and given a couple of breakfast vouchers which could even be used for room service. This is uncommon, based on my experience. I stayed in the Paramount Suite which was almost like having my very own condo downtown. The room was spotless and full of nice touches. With floor to ceiling windows in 3 directions, it made for a quite an experience. Room service in the morning was great, and thankfully I had $40 to apply to the bill. I went up to the Roof on a Saturday night and was provided free cover charge. This place is pretty amazing even during the winter -- I can only imagine the crowd during the summer. Despite the noisy atmosphere my room was completely silent, even with the L below and the Roof bar up top. I definitely will stay here again. In certain respects, The Wit has a few legs up on it's "Conrad" sister up north on Michigan Ave. It all depends on what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: UkPeely
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend while in the city. Hotel is very good, beds lovely and comfortable, both bars are worth a visit and on top of that it's in a great location. The only gripe I have is that I was woken up by house keeping 3 times, I had use the device found in the door handle (not a note you hang on the door like in most hotels) to say do not disturb but it seems housekeeping don;t look at this so knock on the door instead. Apart from that I would happily recommend theWit and will be staying there myself again next weekend but before I do I will pinch a 'do not disturb' sign from somewhere else! :)

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's version of the W”
Reviews.Author: Sunbound
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at the W hotel this is very comparable...The hotel is in a great location, has great staff and excellent rooms. The rooms were nicely decorated, very clean with great views! The hotel could use a better fitness facility with weight machines but overall this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and great views”
Reviews.Author: letsgofire
Reviews.Content: TheWit is a stylish hotel right on State Street in Chicago, which is an ideal location to stay as a tourist. You are well positioned for business events in the Loop, museums and other cultural spots, as well as the nightlife and restaurants of River North. I ate at the ground level restaurant for breakfast and really liked it. We also went to the rooftop, which is really neat and definitely worth a visit. It costs more than typical Chicago rates, but it is a nice spot. Our room was great and faced West / Northwest. The views therefore were excellent. We had part of that green/yellow stripe thing on the hotel, so part of our view ended up having a colored lens on it, which is certainly the first time I've experienced something like this. The furnishings and bed of the room were also great. Overall I highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Winter Oasis in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: salseradanzcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at theWit in January and it was the absolute perfect location for everything I planned into my visit. I went ice skating at Millennium Park, which was just a short walk away; I saw a musical at the gorgeous Oriental Theatre and had a delightful dinner and drinks in the hotel using their restaurant and bar. It was very safe walking around Michigan Avenue. The room I had overlooked the river up Michigan Avenue - beautiful at night. The staff were most friendly and helpful. The ROOF was very sexy - I can only imagine going outside in the summer. State and Lake was great for some small plates and conversation. I also worked out and the facility was clean and bright. I would definitely stay at the Wit again:)

Reviews.Title: “RIP-OFF!”
Reviews.Author: obamatravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel as we were planning on seeing a concert at the Chicago Theater. We prepaid for the room via their website. The concert was postponed and we contacted the hotel to inquire into changing our reservation to the new date only to find that the hotel REFUSED to allow us to change the date and informed us that the $196.00 we had spent on the room would be lost. The customer service employees with Hilton were rude and were not accommodating at all. We will definitely stay at a different hotel for the rescheduled date of the show and would not recommend booking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Impressive Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfam61873
Reviews.Content: We booked theWit by Doubletree, a Hilton hotel last weekend (Jan 28, 2012) for an event at the United Center. We travel quite a bit and primarly use Hilton hotels. We LOVE theWit! It is contemporary and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We typically ask for upgrades but didn't do so this time, however the "average" room was definately upscale and fabulous. The halls had a very soft nature sound and our room greeted us with soft music playing and a light on. The turn down service was a plate of fruit and warm cookies with 2 bottles of water. The bed and pillows are very comfortable. The bathroom did not have a tub (no big deal to us). The sink was unique and definately could not accomodiate washing your hair but no the less neat! Love this hotel and will definately stay again when in Chicago. The only negative we have to say is the resturant (within the hotel) for breakfast was NOT enjoyable. The waiter didn't bring our drinks, didn't refill them, 3 out of 4 of us had burnt food, the order was wrong for one of us and the bill was an outrageous amount. The waiter didn't even bring a pen to sign the bill. He never offered an apology either. The hotel location is within the theater district and a short way from downtown but the cab ride to the United Center was only $12, so downtown would not be too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - But Watch Out for Charges”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel0914
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to give theWit a totally positive review, as I recently enjoyed a nice 2 night stay there for business. I have stayed at many other places in Chicago, and I will add theWit as a hotel to consider when coming to the city. The hotel is modern and clean, and the rooms are a nice size with comfortable beds, modern bathrooms, and a fairly updated look. The restaurant - State and Lake - was great, both at breakfast and lunch. As a Hilton Diamond member, I received breakfast vouchers (for a set $$ amount) that could be used at State and Lake toward any items on the breakfast menu - which was much nicer than the typical continental breakfast offering at other hotels. The hotel location is nice as well - right by the L and within walking distance to the State Street shopping and restaurants. The only real disappointment, for me, came after I checked out and had been home for a few days. As a Diamond member, I received 2 small bottles of Fiji water in my room (along with oranges and a granola bar - very nice!). There was also a $6 bottle of Fiji water in my room (in addition to mini-bar offerings - which, it is important to note - the mini-bar is sensored, so if you move something, you are charged for it). I never touched the $6 bottle of water, but did drink one of my complimentary bottles of water during my stay. At check-out, my hotel folio showed no charges outside of room and tax... but when I checked my credit card statement, I was charged - TWICE - for the $6 bottle of water. I called the hotel and they have credited my card... but since this was a business trip, it will now create additional expense reporting hassles and delays me in completing my paperwork. Compared to the good things about my stay, this is not a major issue - but I felt it necessary to warn other travelers to beware of extra charges following the stay (a co-worker of mine experienced a similar issue). I don't usually have these types of issues within the Hilton hotel family, so this is a bit of a disappointment after an enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice change of pace”
Reviews.Author: rpalmer
Reviews.Content: You know it's a Doubletree from the cookie at check-in, but very little else resembles the brand. Animal sounds replace music in the elevators and hallways, the rooms are nicely furnished with confortable beds and spacious desks, and the bathrooms are spacious and well-appointed. I had a spa room, which included a large soaking tub and separate shower in the bathroom (no jets in the tub). Diamond and Gold members receive free breakfast in the lobby restaurant (note that 18% gratuity will be added to your check automatically) Overall, staff seems eager to please. The central location means all of the State Street and other area attractions are within comfortable walking distance and everything else is convenient by EL or cab.

Reviews.Title: “Boring spot that is overhyped.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas A
Reviews.Content: I could'nt even get the Bulls game on Friday night on in my room. How is that possible? Don't bother with "Roof" unless you're from somewhere that doenst have a building over 25 stories tall. Tiny, and I mean TINY club with not so impressive views and ridculous prices on alcohol. Just another overhyped downtown Hotel. Doesnt apppear as new as it is, the location really is not all that great given how many other places there are to stay downtown. Someone on tripasvors stated yiou should stay on the state side for the view, I was on the 24th floor and asked for state street side, and that is NOT the side to be on. If you are on that side and have a floor below 22 you'll see nothing but the building across the street. Go top floors and Lake side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice spot!”
Reviews.Author: cndngirls
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Sean, the concierge, I will return to this hotel. The reception staff was initially incredible - but we soon realized that a lack of follow up and/or communication resulted in some disappointment. Thankfully, we struck up some great conversations with Sean - who was not only very knowledgeable of the area, but very friendly and helpful, and went out of his way to make sure we had a positive experience at the Wit. The hotel is modern and central and I will be returning. Thanks again, Sean - you are great at your job!

Reviews.Title: “A truly enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Aworldofwander
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, comfortable and spacious rooms and some of the best service I've experienced in a Chicago hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive and we couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely and we loved the vibe of this hotel -- think zen meets trendy. The nature sounds piped into the hallways are a brilliant concept; very unique & relaxing. Above all, the service was amazing. The front desk was alert to anyone waiting to check in or out, and the chef at the restaurant handily (and enthusiastically) accommodated the two people in our party who had food intolerances or allergies. Having a very busy chef come to your table to ask questions and then check on your meal satisfaction is remarkable! Every hotel staff person who assisted us was genuine and interested in making our experience there wonderful. We've all experienced hotel staffers who are 'just doing their job' and you know they could really care less about you or your comfort. Definitely Not the case at theWit. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “theWit is an excellent luxury hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Deacon83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at theWit on our Staycation. The hotel screams trendy and luxury. The attention to detail is amazing. We stayed in one of the spa rooms with a king sized bed. The room was beautiful. Every item in the room felt like it was apart of a well thought out plan. There was nothing but top-notch finishes. The spa tub was enormous, and the bath had a separate show with a removable shower head. I could probably right all night about the hotel, the room, and the service, but I will sum it up in one word. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “NICE”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: great place, plus location-loved the room and view. How can you not like a place where they greet you with warm cookies!

Reviews.Title: “the Wit - Great EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Drounds1
Reviews.Content: the Wit by Doubletree was an excellent hotel, I would recommend to any traveller in Chicago area. Great accomendations. bathroom sink was a little shallow for my taste but classic. Very centrally located, subway was right outside front door. Staff was very helpful and accommendating. Rooftop Bar was very crowded and loud we couldn't even hear ourselves talk, but very lively and festive.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AndAmy
Reviews.Content: Quirky decor, excellent service, prime location and the comfiest bed that I've possibly ever slept in. TheWit is right in the loop, close to prime shopping, dining and entertainment. Check out the rooftop bar. Great in the summer, but also cozy with fireplaces in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern, relaxing and efficient!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan R
Reviews.Content: Great bathroom for two and a spacious, relaxing room with a modern look and a decent floor to ceiling view of downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL, Trendy and Service Based Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wkollman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Wit to celebrate New Years and have a Mini-Moon. I will say that I did a lot of home work before selecting the hotel I wanted. I wanted a hotel great for couples, a great bathroom and and a great view! I found The Wit provided the best opportunity for our needs and price range. We had a King River view Spa room. Upon arrival, I noticed the room we had did not have a shower as I was told it did. I wasn't very happy however I was moved to the same type of a room but with a shower and tub within 5 minutes and it was no problem. We were on the 15th floor facing the river so we were not anywhere near the train. You have your fair sounds of the city though. The beds were not bad. I would probably say a 7. I did not get the feeling this hotel had any attitude as others have mentioned on TripAdvisor. I was very VERY impressed with the service and how very friendly everyone was. The Wit even went out of their way and gave us Champagne and strawberries on the house as we were celebrating our Mini-Moon. Two people stuck out in my mind as Joe and Alex who I mostly worked with. They were wonderful and very helpful. The Wit offers complimentary mini refrigerators. If you move anything from the one you have that is stocked... you will get charged. Those prices are standard as you will see. Elevators I had no issue getting one and I was there for New Years Eve. I used the parking deck right around the corner which was safe and probably $60.00 less after 3 nights and 4 days. NOTE: No in and out privileges in that deck. THE ROOF was very trendy and did have an amazing view as said. A Coors Light is 7 dollars. That is what you need to expect from The Roof. STATE AND LAKE (the restaurant downstairs) is also a little pricey but I thought VERY VERY GOOD! Getting breakfast? You are probably going to pay for two people around $25-30. However, it is not your in and out type breakfast. It was gourmet and sooo delicious. Get the Red Velvet Pancakes! We also had dinner at State and Lake and found the dinner to be just as good. Very well done if you don't mind spending a little extra, but I recommend trying! LOCATION: Perfect Central Location to both sides of Chicago! WOULD STAY AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “The Paramount Suite of this Hotel is spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: Martha D
Reviews.Content: The wit Hotel was a fantastic experience. From the warm cookies upon check- in and check - out to the fantastic views of the Paramount suite to one of the most comfortable sleeps ever! I have only stayed in the one bedroom suite so I can't offer opinions on the average room..but if you are looking for a suite...this is definitely the hotel to check out.

Reviews.Title: “theWit--great location in theater district”
Reviews.Author: 24Carpediem7
Reviews.Content: We had a King Spa Suite for our family (mom/dad and teenagers) and it worked out perfect. We had a sitting area with a pull-out , small refrigerator, micro, coffee maker, huge bathroom (soft towels!), a king bed, and a roll-away. The receptionist was our first hotel representative that we encountered and she was wonderful. We were on the 24th floor and our view was fun! The room was very clean and very comfortable. I am all about a good nights sleep and I found the king bed to be great (not too firm!). We asked for a roll-away and it was delivered soon after we arrived to our room. He needed to get us a pillow and sheets as we were using the pillow and sheets supplied in the room for the pull-out couch. He practically ran down the hall to return with the pillow and sheets. We gave him a tip for his very prompt service! We have waited in other hotels for requests, so we really appreciated his service! We loved the location because of it being within walking distance of shopping and in the theater district. We shopped during the day and ran our packages up to the room before going out for pizza. Macy's was a must see all decorated for Christmas. We saw a show at the Goodman Theater and I was thankful to just walk back to our room at 10:30pm in a matter of 5 minutes. We would definitely stay here again. On a side note, we arrived at the Museum of Science and Industry around 11:30am on a weekday between Christmas and New Years. We love to see their Christmas Around the World (Museumâ€™s 45-foot Grand Tree with more than 30,000 lights and ornaments and 50 smaller trees decorated by volunteers from Chicagoâ€™s ethnic communities to represent their cultures and holiday traditions.) It was absolutely packed! Most special exhibits and omnimax movies were sold out. We opted to just become members of the museum because the line was much shorter. If we go one other time during the year then we will come out even. We really just wanted to see the Christmas trees and decorations, so lines weren't an issue with us. My one daughter wanted to see the coal mine exhibit, but the wait was 1 hour. (thought we might be at Disney for a minute!) I was a little disappointed not to see an omnimax, but we will know better next time! Actually, I was glad to see the Museum so busy and supported!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Islanddiamond
Reviews.Content: Awesome medium sized hotel. Large enough not to be a boutique but not a monster sized hotel. Felt like a home. Not overly busy and could come and go easily. The location is awesome. Walking distance to so many great things and the rooms (2508) have a good city view and a small view of the river. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was large enough to feel like a condo or apartment. Full kitchen complete with plates and silverware. An oven, small refrigerator, sink (no microwave). Closest space was amazing...3 separate closets. The bathroom was very large and contemporary...large glass shower and a tub big enough for two. Living room is nice size with it's own tv...table for 4 near kitchen. Overall a great hotel room. Service was outstanding! Room service was fast and friendly! Front desk, valet, concierge all very helpful! Room service food was delicious!! :) Never ate at the restaurant on ground floor. Rooftop bar is super groovy. Drinks are pricey $14 starting. Ambiance is what makes it....great electric fire pits....yummie drinks....service was aweful....but we were patient because it was so pretty and cozy. This is a great hotel which will save you money and yet feel as good as if you spent the extra to stay at Trump or Conrad etc!

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree The Wit worth double look”
Reviews.Author: BillyTeddy
Reviews.Content: No way this falls into a classic Double Tree style. The Wit is upscale fun without the stuffiness of other similarly styled hotels. In fairness I a am a Diamond Hilton traveler and get nice upgrades when available. The Wit is no exception. Spa rooms are awesome and offer the best views. I have stayed here at least 6+ times to date. But, start from the easy Midway airport access for $2 on the orange line. Killer location and no luggage lugging as you get off at State and Lake street stop and boom. There! The Wit is always well staffed and you can tell the Hilton training is followed to the "T". Lots of smiles and attention. The food at the State & Lake restaurant has always been great quality and worth consideration for any meal while in Chicago where there are tons of options. The Roof Top bar is perhaps the hotel highlight especially in summer months. Killer views, expensive drinks and plenty of active young adults going til all hours. Or older folk wanting to be young! Next time you don't click on this hotel because it is assumed to be a boring Double Tree I suggest you take a Double Take as it is really, really fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nellaaa
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable time at The Wit Hotel. Friendly staff and knowledgeable "experience architect" concierge Sean Patrick Wagner who was very helpful. We had breakfast included in The Wit Package at the State and Lake Restaurant that was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “The weekend is yours -- choose to make it perfect.”
Reviews.Author: FredChi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, perfectly located for romantic weekend downtown for us, city-born couple in our 30's who now live in the burbs. Service was spot on, restaurant State/Lake was wonderful for breakfast and dinner, the Roof was superb if you are not up there during primo club hours (I'm getting old) because then it does get packed. HOWEVER, staying at theWit allows you to bypass the suckers waiting downstairs. We plan on staying at least once per year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom, worn room and inconsistent (and unprofessional) staff”
Reviews.Author: michael30309
Reviews.Content: I was truly looking forward to my stay at theWit, but was left dissatisfied, particularly because of a subpar staff. The good: i stayed in a king suite-1202 (intrinsically tied to the bad described below). the room was nice (nothing spectacular) and the bathroom was beautiful and moder-nice tub, great shower, awesome view, large, etc. The toiletries were beyond the quality of other Hilton brand toiletries. The tv was large and (thankfully!) wasn't controlled using lodge net (those who travel know how annoying/slow lodge net is). The iPod doc would have been great had it been functional (missing electrical plug). Unlike other reviewers, I found the elevators very fast and efficient. Finally, the fitness center was large (for a boutique-like hotel) and had good, new equipment. The bad/ugly: There are better hotels in Chicago for a lower price, and all that I've stayed in have a more professional staff. The staff was inconsistent, inattentive and unprofessional. Examples: 1. I had numerous large holes in my fitted bed sheet (thereby exposing the mattress) and had pillows that smelled like feces. In spite of notifying the hotel concierge and housekeeping, the bedding wasn't changed and neither were the pillows. I woke up with a terrible rash on my face and need to see a doctor (on Chritmas, no less!). 2. The staff was particularly crass late at night...cursing in the lobby, discussing inappropriate and insulting topics, not greeting guests, etc. 3. I was yelled at by staff for trying to use the side lobby door at night. 4 Check in was annoying and slightly degrading. Although the hotel was rather empty, I had to practically beg to get an upgrade to a nicer room (as a Hilton gold member, this was disappoingting considering Marriott and Starwood readily upgrade me based on my gold statuses, and theWit had plenty of upgrades available for the night). The manager (I'm assuming) came to the front desk and allowed for the upgrade, but it was like pulling teeth with them (at one point I had to mention the it is Hilton policy to upgrade if available...concierge floor or not). So much for hhonors!!! I'm 2 stays away from diamond..this solidified my decision to focus on other chains that actually care about loyalty). Overall, I wanted to love this hotel, but didn't because of the staff (and i NEVER have complained about the staff in any of my other reviews). If you're looking for simply a nice bathroom and hip bar, this is a great hotel. But the rooms are "worn" in spite of this being a new property. The staff is mediocre at best and from my experience, doesn't care about the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Unlike any other Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: JJFigs
Reviews.Content: My first reaction when I walked into the lobby was a pleasant surprise. Unlike most Doubletree's that I've stayed at, theWit is trendy, clean, fresh and kind of has a bit of a W-esque vibe (be ready for this). Rooms: My husband and I were upgraded to a suite. The room was huge! It was actually 2 rooms, living space/kitchen and then the bedroom. The rooms were incredibly clean and hip. Every night at turn down, they left you a little fun quote with a trinket to match the quote. Our bathroom was huge with a soaking tub that for $25 you could have the spa staff draw you a bath with special bath soaps, suds and oils. Service: The staff was great. Very accommodating, knowledgeable about the area and friendly. The attention detail is excellent. Location: It's at State and Lake, which if you know Chicago, is in a heavy business district and right on the brown line. It may not be the best location for a tourist new to Chicago, but it is a GREAT location for business travel and if you don't mind walking 8-10 minutes to Michigan Ave. And of course since this is a Doubletree property you always get your unlimited supply of warm chocolate cookies. : ) The hotel has a great restaurant attached to it. Great food- we ate breakfast and lunch one of the days there. There is also a great bar on the top floor- very cool, hip vibe. Nice spot for a drink. Overall, great property, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “the Wit”
Reviews.Author: RAddis0n
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, a little pricey - but would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice... Great Service, breakfast needs big help.”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay again this year. Heads up if you get a handicapped room, the shower and the tub are combined and a mistake. The architect did not have a clue as to what they were doing. It's pretty and works well as a stand alone spa tub. The tub is a drop in and has a 4inch rim around it which quickly fills with water when showering and then freely drains on to the bathroom floor. Five towels and a soaking bathmat later I was ready to head to breakfast. The State and Lake Restaurant was not available during my stay and breakfast was moved to the second floor eatery. It did nothing to improve the breakfast experience or quality. Hot items in lukewarm steam tables. Stiff bread for toast, the oatmeal glued as a lump the ladle all three mornings and a solid block of rock hard brown sugar in a bowl to chisel for your enjoyment. All this for $19.00. I would like address the voucher for HHonors diamond, it didn't cover the base amount of breakfast buffet (the only option). The server made it clear the balance and gratuity would be billed to the room. Why would management put this on the server who is just trying to kept up with the rush and then have to beg for the $2.00 short fall in the price? I'm used to covering the server's gratuity separately and this is not the issue. Rethink it. This aside the staff were delightful and cheerful always had a smile and made eye contact easily. I will be back, and Dunkin Donuts across the street gets my vote for breakfast for now.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay...”
Reviews.Author: MichellePs
Reviews.Content: Upon entering our room, we booked a junior executive suite, we realized our room was handicap accessible (not per our request). We called the front desk to see if another room was available, mainly due to the shower in this room. We were told no, all junior suites are handicap accessible. Ok. We unpacked, went downstairs where, Sean, the conceirge, asked how everything was. Also asked him about the junior suites, not true, they are not all handicap accessible. He offered to have our stuff moved, but we chose to do it ourselves. Upstairs, repack, move, back downstairs. All of this could have been avoided if the front desk person would have be more properly informed. The rooms have taken some abuse in the last year. Furniture rather beat up, stained fabric, etc. The couch in the room is not comfortable at all. We had dual TV's, which proved to be interesting. Turn on one, the other one came on, manually turn one off, try to turn the other off while in bed, the other on turns on. The bathrooms are very cold and the shower caddy is useless as the amenities fall out through the slots. Sean, the conceirge, was very helpful as was Jonah, our bellhop. The front desk staff seemed to be otherwise busy whenever we came or went. The staff at State and Lake is hit or miss. Personally, I'd like to see them offer free WiFi, in your room, especially if you pay for an upgraded room. The hotel is okay, but unfortunately, nothing special. I feel like with a little tweaking they could be great.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair telephone rates - paid almost USD 500 for 2 international calls!”
Reviews.Author: Fabiane M
Reviews.Content: I was charged almost USD 500 for two tel calls abroad which did not take 30 min together!!!! absolutely unfair charges! The phone calls were to Germany (aprox. 16 min) and to Brazil (aprox 10 min). I asked the very unfriendly manager about them, but he was unflexible and told me he could do nothing about it, the rates are that expensive at that time of the day! Bad experience - I would never come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy -- not your standard Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: SarahP1118
Reviews.Content: The Wit Chicago is a trendy boutique hotel right in the heart of Chicago's Theater District, and just a block away from the famous Chicago theater. The rooms are comfortable and clean, with nice views of the city. Guests have easy access to all major L lines, and you can walk to many nearby attractions. Got a great night's sleep each night, and the shower always had good heat and water pressure. We stayed on the L side and could hear some of the streetside noise, but it was not an issue for us. If you want a quieter room, you may want to request accommodations not on the L side. Overall a nice experience -- we'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tries too hard to be hip”
Reviews.Author: jonjon97
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that's quite modern and comfy. However, it tries a little too hard to be hip. I would classify this hotel as a nice business hotel, rather than a fashionable boutique. My room was quite spacious with a decent view. Make sure you request a room away from the L! Otherwise you will be hearing the trains at all hours.... For an expensive room rate (US $400), they don't provide much extras. No complimentary WIFI nor water. Service was okay but impersonal. The gym was on the small side but has floor-to-ceiling windows. If you're running on the treadmill, you directly overlook the L which is kinda cool. If you're into coffee, Intellegentsia is only 2 blocks away. Amazing coffee. Definitely stop by.

Reviews.Title: “The Wit is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Nassermkaplan
Reviews.Content: We (me and my wife) stayed for 9 consecutive nights from 25 Nov to 4 Dec 2011 to attend a conference. The general atmosphere was so relaxing with Birdsâ€™ voices in the hotelâ€™s corridors. Staff everywhere in the hotel was friendly and ready to help. During check-in, we had been offered a welcoming smile and warm chocolate chip cookies. We had initially room # 801 that had been changed to another room # 1711 with nicer view. Rooms were clean and beds comfy. Bathroom had a NOT-to be locked sliding door and shallow wide wash-basin. There was an in-room safe that fitted a laptop. There was a complimentary NET in both the first floorâ€™s Lobby and the second floorâ€™s open sitting area and we borrowed an electric adaptor from the reception. We had also a daily gift as part of the turn down service. The items of the MiniBar, that contained sensors, were charged when moved. The Gym was located in the fifth floor and open 24hrs with complimentary water, towels & newspapers. Breakfast in the first floor main dining room at State and Lake Restaurant was good. There was free luggage storage and we were offered a complimentary late check-out. The central location is just perfect along the Loop in the heart of Chicago. We visited the Art Institute of Chicago and its Modern Wing, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Willis Tower and its Sky Deck, Merchandise Mart and others. The musical show (Memphis) in Cadillac Palace theatre was fantastic. We enjoyed shopping in the Magnificent mile: 900 Shops mall, Water Tower Place, Macy's, Niketown and Disney & Apple stores. We had great breakfasts in Eggsperience and EATT and excellent dinners in Catch 35, Mortonâ€™s, Joeâ€™s, Royâ€™s, Brosecco and McCormick & Schmick restaurants. In our next visit to Chicago, we will definitely stay in the Wit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: CMacD_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful rooms, perfect location! You do have to wait for an elevator when the bars are busy which can be frustrating. However, the excellent service and ammenities far outweighed this minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & rate”
Reviews.Author: OakParker98
Reviews.Content: The Wit is in a wonderful location for tourists and business travelers. The property is fairly new an kept up well. The room was definitely one of the cleanest I've stayed in. Modern feel to the hotel and the rooms. Nice bathrooms and generous amenities. My only complaint is that there was no coffee maker in the room. When I asked about coffee I was told "we serve breakfast on the second floor" in a condensing manner. There is a Dunkin' about a block an a half away. Also, I asked to borrow an iPhone charger and they wanted me to leave my phone with them at the front desk to charge. I thought the coffee and charger factors were rather petty for such a nice hotel. In any case, the $120 rate was, I felt, a great deal and the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip”
Reviews.Author: Janell V
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Wit for a quick business trip. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were very clean and the beds ultra comfortable. I used the first floor restaurant for one meeting and it was a perfect meeting place then I met one of my clients at the roof top which was extremely loud and annoying (hipster hang). The hotel has some attitude that could be dialed back about 10% to make it an excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: This is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. I am one picky SOB, that checks mattresses for bugs and stains, linens for stains and wear, leaking pipes, mold, etc. By far, this is the cleanest, freshest and most modern hotel I've stayed at in a long time. Very quiet. Good service. Close to Old Navy, Michigan Ave., and theater district. Extremely helpful and friendly staff in all areas of the hotel. Of all the Hiltons in Chicago, this is my new first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Old Faithful!”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I stay here nearly overtime I go to chicago...if I am on a business trip and have to stay more than three days this is where I go. The staff is always accommodating, the rooms are always clean and I can always find sanctuary at the Spa at theWit!! The treatments are catered to your needs and you leave feeling decadent every single time! The location is top notch too and if you need anything the concierge service is quick on the draw...they are also great about being up to speed on any new little hotspots around town or to let you know where to go if you just want to grab a late night nosh...will be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BED”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: I had been in great hotels in Chicago and around the world, THIS BED WAS EXCELLENT, I had like 8 pillows to choose from at the end used all of them nice view from the city , the lake it is not in the michigan, just 3 blocks from there, but it is nice, also have a nice bagels place and restaurants in the lobby, free wifi in the lobby they give you a fresh baked cookie upon arrival

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: I work as a Front Office Supervisor at an unaffiliated major-brand hotel property near Philadelphia. As such, my standards for guest service and quality are probably higher than many other people who do not work in hospitality. My stay at this hotel over Thanksgiving 2011 was nothing short of ideal. Every member of the front desk staff, rooftop bar, and restaurant were completely outstanding and friendly, as well as the staff flagging taxis and greeting guests out front who were all very pleasant and friendly. Alex Savory, Michelle, and Andrea at the front desk; as well as Beatrice in the rooftop bar were all exceptional and deserve to be recognized for making the trip particularly memorable. For my family (there were ten of us ranging in age from 4 months to 60yrs) the service and accomodation made everything extremely easy. The restaurant had no problem accomodating our group, which was somewhat "special needs" with a 4-month old baby, and his 2 year old sister. There was never a wait for any of our groups many requests. Sherri and Matthew, as well as a man with dark hair in a suit who was probably the restaurant manager were particularly attentive, patient, and responsive (as well as good with the children). The decor of the hotel is very hip and vibrant. The rooftop bar was especially fun, has great views of Chigao, fantastic drinks (I'd reccomend the CG2-a cucumber mojito) as well as a very fun atmosphere with glass fire pits and outside roofdecks with plasma televisions that is probably great during warmer weather. The room should also not be overlooked as it was very comfortable with impressive views. The suite I stayed in was particularly clean and well appointed. My only complaint is with the design of the bathroom doors, which as far as I can tell do not lock? The door is also on a slider, which is a nice concept. The handle on my bathroom door was a bit loose, and the door in my uncle's room was slightly off of its track, but neither of these very minor issues were reported to any staff. If they had been I am sure that the issues would have been promptly fixed. Lastly, the location could not be more ideal as it is literally steps from the El, and a very short walk to Millenium Park. The staff and GM of this property clearly have the right idea of how hopitality should be done. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Good Location, Okay”
Reviews.Author: travellover3868
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring downtown Chicago. As a woman, I felt very safe staying here and walking around the neighborhood. We went in November on a "girls weekend" to see the lighting of Michigan Avenue and participate in the festivities. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was plenty of hot water and water pressure. The decor is on the masculine side - which made it feel rather "cold" to me, and it was all very modern. I do wonder about the artwork in the bathroom that was a replica of a cover of Esquire magazine. All that aside, it was an okay place to stay - but for a Doubletree, I was surprised that there were no bathrobes in the room, no turn-down service, etc. Perhaps I was considered a "sub customer" due to the fact that I booked my room through a popular on-line travel service? Even the cookie that I was offered at check-in was not warmed. Come on, Doubletree - I know you can do better than this. I've stayed at other Doubletrees that offered all the above and more. Would I stay here again? Probably not - there are too many other choices in downtown Chicago that would probably be a bit more attentive to me as a customer, even on a busy weekend. But, it's not a horrible place to stay, either. I came away from this trip feeling just "meh" about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and fun!”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a safe, wonderful area. I have stayed here 6 times this last year and will continue to go back. Clean, well maintained property. Employees seem to love their property.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with Exceptional Service.”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a large majority of the Hilton brand hotels in downtown Chicago. The Wit has, by far, the friendliest and most attentive staff of any hotel. The rooms are clean and innovative, the restaurant stylish and delicious, (although the music is a bit loud), and the valet service was speedy and professional. Each night we received a gift as part of the turn down service and our room was spotless. Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is N ot Your Father's Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Bowdoin1
Reviews.Content: TheWit is not your typical Doubletree--it is a stylish, modern, boutique hotel that happens to be part of the Doubletree chain. Overall, I was impressed with the hotel. The service was very good from check-in until check-out with only two minor issues. First, I had two FedEx packaged delviered to the hotel from my office and it was not until I went down to the concierge desk to pick them up that I was able to get there. While not a big deal, had I not known these packages were coming, I am not sure if and when I would have received them. As it turns out, when I asked for them they were delivered right away and so it is not that big deal. The second concern is the high price of the internet. The hotel offers three pricing tiers based on how much bandwidth you intend to use-the rates start at $10/day and go up to about $20/day. Hotels of this quality and costing in excess of $300/night should include free WiFi service--TheWit is certainly not alone in chargiung for WiFi service but I hope all hotels will realize that that this should be included. Another minor irritation was the fact that room service stops at 6:30 in the evening for everything but omlettes and eggs. While the hotel has a few restaurants, it would be nice to have a room service option for those who do not want to eat in the restaurant--especially since there are not too many casual choices in the immediate neighborhood. These quibbles did not detract from the fact that everyone I encountered was very friendly and professional. The staff are clearly well trained and take pride in their hotel and the service they provide. The room itself is quite large and is very comfortable. The room had a full sofa, desk, king bed, and a large tv with very nice views down State St. The bathroom was very nice with Gilchrist & Soames toiletries, nice robes, decent towels and very good water pressure--again, not your typical Doubletree. The location of the hotel is good if you have plans to be in the Loop or plan to spend time in Millenium Park. If your goal is to shop and dine, I think there are better located hotels north of the river. Overall, however, I was very impressed with TheWit and enjoyed my stay. I should add that there is a very popular rooftop bar at the hotel which residents have priority access to which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy place, friendly staff, but they miss too many marks when it comes to attentive service.”
Reviews.Author: Nicolino s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location...you are right in downtown Chicago, a.k.a. the "Loop". The staff is friendly, yet they miss too many marks when it comes to paying attention to details and/or the lack of service awareness towards the guest. We found interruptions by maids as soon as we checked into our room, but I think this is how the protocol is with this kind of hotel. Their version of knock on the door routine is very poor as they practically walked into our room not once but twice, unanswered! We also had someone scratching at our door early in the morning, but it definitely wasn't preventive maintenance as a "No" sign was outside our door alerting them to keep quite. Again, the "No" sign is the hotel's version of "Do Not Disturb". Funny! Room service is prompt, yet missing silverware items for appropriate food groups was common. The restaurant had descent food, the server was friendly and knowledgeable, yet dirty silverware was obvious. As for the 27th Floor Rooftop, the bartenders would handle and give you the incorrect money back and some went as far as keeping your change. The dropping of the hotel room charge(s) underneath the door of our room at around 4am and a knock on our door was totally inappropriate and inconsiderate as well. As good as the valet was in getting your car they were not as good as giving you your keys back! All of this for 2 small complimentary waters I would rather they take a little bit more pride in their job, but I imagine this would have to start with the people at the top who dismiss teaching their staff a certain level of attentive service. I don't want to come off too harsh, but I feel these are positive criticisms that can help.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and modern - noise from the "l"”
Reviews.Author: egallo
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, with super large room, the suite 2506 was with a super view. the hotel is very new and confortable, but as in a lot of other place in Chicago the noise of the "L" can disturb your dreams... the bathroom was very large. also the bed was very confortable. on the Roof there is a very nice bar, with also party on friday.

Reviews.Title: “The WIT has excellent service, in every department.”
Reviews.Author: ericamcarr
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stayed at the WIT and I can't wait to stay here again. The check in/check out process if very smooth and the staff couldn't be nicer. I stay in a lot of hotels and usually the service is spotty, if not lame. I utilized the front desk, both restaurants, valet and the gym/spa and can't fault much about the place. The rooms are spacious and modernly decorated. The tub is huge! The only thing I didn't like was my shower head kept slipping down (it detached) and I had to do a hand held shower vs. the regular kind. Not a big deal and I was too busy to call maintenance. Breakfast in the main dining room each day was quick and delicious. Prices were extremely reasonable for hotel food. The roof top bar was great. We got lucky and sat by the fire, ordered 3 apps and cocktails. The London Lemonade was killer! Service there was a bit slow, but they were super slammed and I don't fault anyone except management for under staffing. When my key cards kept failing (my fault for putting it by my cell), the replaced, no problem. My room was very clean, very very quiet and perfect for me. If you have ATT for phone, you won't get great service. I think the WIFI prices are a bit steep - but whatever. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree gets style...”
Reviews.Author: smh212
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned - this isn't your typical Doubletree property. As a Hilton Honors member, I typically prefer the Doubletree line among their choices. That said, this one is a cut above the rest. Located conveniently along the Loop in the heart of Chicago, a short walk from Millenium Park, the Theatre District, and lots of great dining and attractions, The Wit has an ultra-modern feel throughout. Although the Rooftop Bar was pushing the Techno Beat a little too hard for my taste on a Friday late afternoon, and was charging ridiculous prices for small drinks served ONLY in plastic cups - the heaters, views, and combination of seating and socializing spaces would be great for the younger crowd. The roooms were nicely appointed, again in a contemporary style, and the first floor dining at State and Lake was very good - especially the breakfast choices... Some of the reviews mention the noise, which is significant because you are sandwiched between a dance club and the elevated railway - but if you avoid the top and bottom floors, I'd expect the typcical city sounds... Which I enjoy... A great stay in a fun city...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, walking distance to theater and more”
Reviews.Author: Vamanos4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December with our daughters while in Chicago to see Wicked. We got a great deal on Hotwire and were very pleased with our stay. Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms were a good size and very clean, even a decent view (sometimes hard to find in Chicago). We were walking distance not only from the theater but also just a mile or so from the Michigan Mile shopping district and an easy walk to Millennium park. We even walked right to the hotel from the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Doubletake”
Reviews.Author: CMcK1
Reviews.Content: Even though you can still get the awesome, warm Doubletree cookies when you check-in; this is not your typical Doubletree hotel! Rooms are spacious, very contemporary and technology-friendly. Of course, the downtown location makes it easy to get to many great restaurants and attractions on foot or by cab. I ordered room service for dinner (I recommend the baked chicken - yum) and breakfast and must say that the food is really good. I didn't get a chance to use the workout facilities, but the equipment available was up to date and clean and offered nice city views. The only drawback is that elevator traffic (I only saw 2) can get extremely busy during certain times of the day - I opted to take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Don't call it "a DoubleTree" - even though it is...”
Reviews.Author: ZMyers
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The guest rooms are what you would expect from a Hilton...Clean, comfortable and very nice. What you may not expect is the attention to detail on every little thing in the building. From the second you walk in, you are treated like someone special. Everyone has a smile on their face and attend to you...no matter what question you have. State&Lake on the first floor is outstanding. The Roof is amazing. I usually never give a place 5 out of 5...and with the price of this place compared to others around it, the only thing I can say is "save up and stay here!" We will be guests again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Pristine property, personal service”
Reviews.Author: BuckyBadger123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at theWit 3 times now and decided it was finally time for a review. Although I have been satisfied with each stay, I will base my review on my last stay. The location is great, as it's 3 blocks off the Magnificient Mile and right on the CTA Red line. Upon arrival, you are greated by a friendly front desk staff and warm chocolate chip cookies. You will notice the property is modern and contemporary. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. I had a corner king on my last stay. It had some extra space and lots of windows. I could see the lake and Milennium Park. I even had a window in the bathroom! Beds are very comfortable with great linens. I have visited Roof a couple times. I never thought it was crowded and always received prompt service. On a nice day, the bar cannot be beat! All in all, great choice for something unique in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel for royal treatment”
Reviews.Author: kibbykai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Wit in Chicago, what a pleasure and treat. The doors were opened for us when we arrived into a beautiful lobby. We checked in to big smiles, friendly tones to the voices AND warm, chocolate chip cookies. Our room was clean, really decorated nicely and what a view. The bathroom was one of the nicest and biggest bathrooms I have seen in a hotel and clean, one of my biggest pet peeves when not. Rainy weather while you are there? No problem, large umbrellas at the front door to borrow. One thing I noticed was every time we walked in the smiles were already on the faces of the staff and they didn't know we stayed there or we're just getting out of the rain. You can tell customer service is their top priority, which is nice in this day and age where you feel at some businesses you are imposing on them. Only way unto a floor was with your room key so you felt secure knowing only guests were on your floor. My husband and I would and will stay there again on our next Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: kris L
Reviews.Content: We have never been to a hotel where we felt like family. But everyone at the Wit was wonderful, helpful and made our stay pleasurable. The guys at the front desk (ask for Alex or Sean) were the best, so helpful, they kept us going in the right direction all the time! They also greet thiei guest upon arrival, with a warm cookie YUM!

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-night stay at the Wit and absolutely loved it!! My husband and I have traveled quite a lot this summer, but have had some pretty indifferent stays at other Hilton properties. This was the one exception. From the moment we arrived and were met by a member of staff with an umbrella as we got out of our taxi, till we were checked out by the very professional-yet-friendly Andrea, our stay was almost flawless. We were upgraded to a King Spa corner room (#1702) which had one of the best bathtubs I have ever had to privilege of soaking in! What made the bathroom even more appealing were the floor-to-ceiling windows, offering some fantastic views of the city. Certainly, it might not be appropriate to leave the shades up whilst bathing, but it is sooo nice to be in a bathroom that has so much natural light. Bliss!! The bedroom was nicely appointed and also had floor-to-ceiling windows from which we could see the lake, the city and the river. Housekeeping were impressively quick, but thorough. They attended to our requests for extra coffee and pillows immediately and were thoughtful enough to bring extra cups too. The only problem we had was with the noise from the 'L'. Actually, I should clarify that the noise did not bother me at all, but it did wake up my husband, so if you are a light sleeper then you might consider requesting a room on a higher floor, or one that is on the other side of the hotel. I was so happy to see the 'Wolfgang Puck' coffee and coffee maker in the room, especially since it seems to be a growing trend in other hotels to no longer provide them unless specifically requested. There was also a great selection of 'Gilchrist and Soames' bathroom amenities, including those extremely handy little vanity kits (cotton balls, emery board, q-tips). It is thoughtful little details like these that, as a female traveler, I truly appreciate. We ate breakfast each morning at 'State and Lake' . On the first day I had the Red Velvet pancakes, which I thought were just okay, but the next day I had the banana stuffed french toast and those were excellent. We had the same waiter each morning who was great (sorry, I didn't get his name). He even remembered us from the previous day, which seldom happens at a hotel of this size. We also went to 'Roof', the bar which, perhaps unsurprisingly, is on the roof of the hotel. The view was great, the food was actually pretty good and was reasonably priced, but the drinks were kind of pricey. Oh, and as far as we could tell, there were about 5 busboys working, but only one waitress, so service was a bit slow. There is no doubt in my mind that I will stay at the Wit again. From now on, this will be my first choice for hotels in Chicago. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub on wheels”
Reviews.Author: jonworld
Reviews.Content: I'm visiting from the UK so don't know what the Wit chain/concept was; the tripadvisor rating at time of booking was way up. The rooms are clean and well appointed look very nice but still Have coperate feel.. Roomservice excellent And front desk too. The main problem with this hotel is that it feels like a giant nightclub with bouncers on the door and roped lines forming in the small foyer at night. You can come in late afternoon and find a DJ spinning decks. The whole raisin d'Ãªtre of this hotel seems to be this theme. As a hotel guest you feel you are there as a supporting activity! On the first night with Jet lag they assigned me a studio suite below the roof night club. I might as well have been in the club! The front desk was very sweet and gave me a free nights stay for that night and I got moved. Another dissapointment is the breakfast arrangement in the bar which has a fixed very heavy menu with no buffet in a dark dingy atmosphere, again clubby. It also Lacks any substantial quiet lounge area for guests I have stayed in cool hotels before but I really didn't like the concept here Having said that once inside my room I was happy

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFabrycki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right near Michigan Avenue and easy access to business or sightseeing events. The hotel is just plain and offers nothing special. It was clean, small lobby, not much going on. The room was a good size, but the price was a little high. The people working there were pleasant enough, helping with cabs, the airport shuttle and how far certain venues were. The halls were a bit noisy and I was awakened several times by loud voices and yelling in the halls. I was there on business so had to be up early and found this to be annoying at best. I stayed over until Sat and wanted to sleep in a little, but the maid or someone knocked on the door at 8:30 AM and woke me up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, a few faults though”
Reviews.Author: ClareB75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located for exploring Chicago being less than half a mile from the Magnificent Mile and Millenium Park. We stayed in a King Spa Room on the 10th floor which overlooked the river and didn't suffer from the noise issues other people have mentioned. The room was a good size with a huge bath tub and separate shower. The staff were really friendly and helpful. There are some negatives though. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss with basic things like toilet rolls not replaced and one day the room didn't get cleaned at all. You shouldnt have to phone up and remind them to do these things when you're paying over $300 a night. The room is pretty pricey so you would expect it to have everything you need. However, toiletries in the bathroom weren't enough for 2 people and there was no bath gel provided which, given the bath is the main reason why you'd book the spa room, this seemed a bit tight. The hotel seemed to charge a lot for things other comparable hotels would provide for free such as web access and bottles of water. Also, there's a $25 restocking charge for the mini bar even if you just take one item out of it. We ate in the hotel restaurant and the first time our waiter was brilliant, very accommodating and helpful. The second time however the service was poor with the waitress bringing out our main courses 5 mins after bringing out our starters and trying to cram them on the table, and forgot to pick up our drinks order from the bar so we had to fetch them ourselves. Didnt eat there again after that. It's a great hotel but for the price there probably are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: EEJJQQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed this last weekend & were so very disappointed. We were quoted a different rate at the desk (had this reservation since June) & it was $100 more/ night. I told her the rate I booked the room for, back in June & she said if I could "prove it", they would give me the original price. The elevator, hallways + our room were hotter than hades, despite having the AC on 65 or below. The king size bed is no such thing (had to be a queen size) & was uncomfortable. Internet is $10/ day for the lowest bandwidth. There were always four valet "boys" on duty yet they only said hello & didn't do anything else. We had one great concierge & 2 snotty ones. Every one at the front desk was rude except for one lovely guy that gave us terrific recommendations. One of the managers told me to "think positive, it will be ok" when I complained that my key didn't work in the elevator, leaving me floating from one floor to another. For being a rather new hotel, it was nothing short of trendy, cheap stuff that already looks years old. There are wayyyyy too many other cool places to stay for wayyyyy less money. It put a damper on our weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Stanley S
Reviews.Content: I ended up at theWit by chance after my convention hotel was sold out. I'm so glad! I love boutique hotels, and theWit certainly qualifies. First plus is the convenience - just across from the State/Lake train station and a block from the river. The service was outstanding, from the front desk, to the concierge (especially Kym who was super!), and everyone I encountered. My room had a great view of the river and was very comfortable. The rooftop lounge on a Friday night was a little intimidating with the bouncers at the door and very loud, but it's a trendy place so I understand - just not my cup of tea. I ordered room service and the seared salmon was excellent! All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAKA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the theWit from Octber 4-9, 2011. I love, love, love this hotel. The staff was so helpful and professional. The location is perfect and the rooftop bar was unbelievable. I would recommend this hotel whether you are staying for business or pleasure. GREAT JOB!!! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I've stayed at in awhile”
Reviews.Author: TicTaco
Reviews.Content: Really just a lovely corner room with a great staff. Housekeeping really went out of their way for us - very friendly and proactive. We were having some trouble getting our down comforters and quilts replaced with hypo-allergenic ones, but a housekeeper in the hall saw us struggling through the half-open door and insisted on making the bed right away for us. Was a bit pricey, yes, but good, especially if you can expense it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic downtown Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trueohioplaya
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at theWit with my wife to celebrate my birthday. This was actually a return stay for me as my wife and I stayed here for our anniversary a few months previously. I made sure to let the hotel know that I was there celebrating. Each time I had complimentary fruits and wine waiting for me in the room. This is the type of great service that I receive when I stay at theWit. The rooftop bar on Friday nights is fantastic! I was a little disappointed that the outside part of the bar is shut down at midnight. At that time everything moves inside. Breakfast at State and Lake is pretty good. The egg white wrap is decent. I need to make sure to check out the red velvet pancakes next! I would definitely recommend this hotel and I plan to continue to stay at theWit especially for special occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yam42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheWit over labor day weekend for a wedding - so do note that we paid a group rate which is who-knows-how-much-less than a normal rate. The location of this hotel is superb. Really easy to get everywhere, L stations nearby, you can walk practically anywhere. The service was also quite good - we arrived super early (around 10:30am) expecting to be told we needed to just leave our bags and check in later. Nope, got checked right in, given delicious cookies, and brought up to our room. The room was great - comfy bed, everything you need. The only thing lacking was a fan/vent in the bathroom so it got quite steamy when you showered. The concierge was also very helpful - gave us quick and easy directions to Wrigley Field. For anyone doing their wedding here, thought I'd briefly mention my experience with this hotel as a guest at the wedding. We were told that the wedding cocktail hour would be on the roof - and based on the website, that seemed really exciting. Unfortunately, it was only a partial section of the roof and it was indoors, which I thought was somewhat disappointing. It was also much too loud and too crowded. The rest of the wedding - ceremony and reception in one of the ballrooms - was great, we had a blast. The crowds going up to the Roof in the evenings were a bit of a turn-off. Really scene-y and totally not where I'd want to hang out. But you only really interact with them in the lobby and potentially the elevator. I just ignored them and was fine. We specifically asked for a floor away from the roof - we preferred to risk train noise (of which we heard nothing) to bar/party noise. I'd definitely stay here again. It's hip, great location, good amenities and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ben S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hip and beautiful in the heart of downtown Chicago. Service was amazing. My wife and I were there for our 10th anniversary and were treated amazingly. Champagne and strawberries were waiting for us in an absolutely beautiful room on the 24th floor. Incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbiu
Reviews.Content: While in town for a weekend wedding at Navy Pier we enjoyed our stay at theWit. Was very surprised at check in when asked how many chocolate chip cookies we'd like - yum-o they were delicious! The rooftop bar was fun, but glad we went early when the crowd was more our age. Fun seeing the younger generation waiting to get up to the bar as the evening went on. The beds are so comfy. We walked to Navy Pier, walked to dinner Friday night at q, and thought the location was perfect for where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience at the Wit”
Reviews.Author: lunagirl65
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am very surprised by any negative reviews of this hotel. Everyone, and I mean everyone, that we encountered here were friendly and professional. We arrived many hours before check in and both rooms I had booked were ready. I think it was Alex who checked us in? He was very nice and had us checked in quickly. I asked about fridges and they were sent right up after we got to our rooms. We were given rooms on the 15th floor facing State St. The rooms are a good size and updated. I love modern decor so the bathrooms made me especially happy, the trough sink and glass shower I would put in my house if I had the space.... the amenities are also very nice. There was no bathtub which I thought would bug me but the shower was so nice I didn't even notice.... We headed out for brunch and to explore a bit and when we returned to relax for a while the onslaught of sirens from the nearby fire station began... this may not be an issue at all for many people but I am a light sleeper in hotels. I always sleep with earplugs when I travel anyway but this was clearly not going to help. I had been worried about the trains below being noisy but they were not even remotely an issue. They sound like a gust of wind when they go by. I went down to front desk to ask about wifi and things to do in the area and in the course of conversation I mentioned to Brittany my concerns about the sirens... She was extremely helpful with all of my questions and when I mentioned the siren noise she immediately offered to move our rooms. I was so grateful to be dealing with someone who obviously cares about customer service. I thought I might just see how the first night went, but she said that the hotel was sold out the next night and they would not have rooms available to move the next day. We ended up moving rooms to the 17th floor on the back of the hotel and had a view of some of the beautiful Chicago architecture. I slept like a baby every night.... the beds are soooo comfy!!! Some observations... I know everyone complains about not having free wifi here, but most people have phones nowadays that have wifi built in so just use it in the lobby where it is free.
