Or go to the business center where you get the first ten minutes free. Really, how much time do you need on a computer when you are on vacation? And if you are on business does your company not pay for you? Another complaint everyone has is how busy it is because of the rooftop bar. The only night I even noticed anything was the Wednesday there were people lined up outside to go up. But inside they had a separate elevator designated to go straight up to the roof so it didnâ€™t even affect us. We had to laugh at all the â€œcoolâ€� peopleâ€¦ Been a long time since I have seen a man in a tight blazer with no shirt underneath lol!!! The Wit is in a fantastic location, we walked or jumped on the subway to get everywhere we wanted to go. Tons of shopping, dining, and the riverfront are steps away. The only problem I had was the sirens and this is not the fault of the hotel, nonetheless, they rectified this immediately for me. I was very happy with this hotel, the staff, service, and location, and will definitely recommend to others and return one day myself.

Reviews.Title: “"W" lite”
Reviews.Author: RagTopRon
Reviews.Content: We prefer funky hotels to mainstream mega-chains. Granted, the Wit is Hilton's cousin, but it distances itself enough from conventional lodging to warrant the "funky" designation. Location: Tough to beat. Lobby: Funky enough...(small, hip, very courteous doormen) Receptionists: Professional but in no way "warm" or terribly welcoming. (Then again, we're southerners and probably harbor a "folksy" bias. Room: We stayed in a KiNG Jr and it was frankly more room than we needed. (Probably should've just reserved a normal King.) Clean, nice view, large sitting area, quiet...very nice amenities. Bathroom: Large, contemporary, shower and tub. Some have complained about the sink being too shallow, but it would only be an issue if you had to clean it every day...and that's what housekeeping is for. Concierge: Excellent The ROOF: Pretty damn cool. Can be difficult snaring your initial drink, but once you're served, you're not forgotten. Food is upscale bar food...also excellent. Place rocks pretty hard, loud and late...but we were only 3 floors down and had no qualms with the low rumble. State/Lake: We only ordered aptzers at this restaurant. As stated, bellmen/doormen were professional, friendly...taxis are always nearby. Overall...a buzzing little hotel in a terrific location. I knocked it down a notch only because its check-in staff could use a shot of Cortisone in the personality department AND this place is a tad pricey for its offerings. Nonetheless... we were thoroughly pleased to find it well-maintained and managed.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential - still a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: fussylady001
Reviews.Content: Lcoated in the north end of The Loop, The Wit has a great location, walkable to most of Chicago's star attractions and close to the center of the transit lines. It is a "trendy" hotel with contemporary artwork. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The modern-designed rooms are very comfortable with great reading lights by the bed. There are several pillows with varying degrees of softness to guarantee a good night's rest. And, the windows open so you can have fresh air. That's good because the air conditioning was quite noisy and we could never seem to get it to work adequately. The only downside of opening the windows: street noise. (We were on the 10th floor.) Also, there is only one large chair for sitting. If there are two of you, the other person has to use the desk chair or sit on the bed. There are no closets here - just large armoires. While the rooms were clean, we had some issues, such as the shower head wasn't stable and flopped over, It was fixed quickly, but it isn't something you want to find out as you step into the shower. The bathroom sinks are large shallow squares with the faucet against the wall. If you're short, it 's an awkward reach. However, there is more than adequate space for toiletries. One niggle: the shower amenities kept falling through the grates of the holders in the shower. The bathrooms are good but I wouldn't call them "luxurious". For some reason, the maid never changed our drinking glasses. Despite leaving it out, clearly used, it remained in the same spot for four days. There is a charge for wi-fi, but there are so many Starbucks and other places nearby, you can go cybersquat on the sidewalk. And don't open the refrigerator. It has a sensor on it that will charge you if you open it and take out something just to look at it. Moreover, there seems to be a $25 "restocking" charge, which I find objectionable since the mark-up on the whatever isin the fridge is probably adequate to cover the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: hjb4971
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Witt the last weekend in July and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Though a bit pricey, the Witt is a quality hotel with very nice and spacious rooms, and a fantastic roof-top bar. Young adults were lined up around the corner on Saturday night just to get into the bar! The hotel is conveniently located only a block off Wacker Drive on State Street with an El station on the side street so it was an easy walk to a number of Chicago attractions including the very interesting architectual tour on a Chicago riverboat, The Wrigley Building, Tribune Tower, the Merchandise Mart, etc. I especially like the litle niceties such as the wake-up call available with the voices of Chicago celebrities. I chose Harry Carry.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in the loop”
Reviews.Author: OutkastBCN
Reviews.Content: TheWit is a stylish hotel located in the loop area very close to lake and clark/lake train stations. The location is very central since it is close to most Chicago attractions. Rooms are big and nicely decorated, most of the rooms offer great views over the river, millenium park or chigago theater. Bathroom are luxurious. There are two different restaurants and a urban spa. There is also a rooftop bar which is pretty cool. Service is very friendly and effective. We stayed in a junior suite wich we found excellent value for money. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “SNL Parody?”
Reviews.Author: MBFW
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I felt like we starred in a parody of poor customer service. We had 2 rooms. At 10:30 pm our son went back to his room only to find the door lock no longer worked. I called the front desk and was told I needed a picture ID. Out of PJ's into street clothes down I went, only to be told I didn't need a picture ID and could have just called. An hour later, now 11:30 after 3 phone calls and tedious discussions with the front desk in which I was told repeatedly what I had done wrong we finally had an engineer to his door. He was unable to open it. At midnight we gave up and our son moved to our room for the night. The engineer said he would send someone right away for sheets, etc for the sofa-sleeper. At 12:15 the night manager showed up with....food certificates. By 12:30 we finally had bedding. The worst of this was the evening manager's attitude.... I seemed to by a pesky guest who just didn't understand that they were providing great service. The icing on the cake? When he offered that they wouldn't charge us for the room that no one could enter.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday getaway”
Reviews.Author: 3jstravel
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay, booked through Hotwire. The hotel was wonderful, from the helpful attendants who greeted us at the curb when we arrived, to the front desk staff to housekeeping. The bellman even retrieved a pair of mittens from our car in the parking garage when we forgot them. The front desk has a magic drawer with hot, fresh chocolate chip pecan cookies, 24/7...yum! They go nicely with your Starbucks or DunkinDonuts coffee, both a few doors from the hotel. The Wit Hotel is in a superb location for museums and Michigan Avenue shopping. Room was very new, clean and comfortable, with stylish modern fixtures and artwork. We spent 2 nights in mid December, my husband, myself, and teenage daughter. It was typical freezing, snowing Chicago, and The Wit was a wonderful warm escape from the cold. We had plenty of space for the 3 of us in a standard room, and loved the view from our window, State Street and Lake, and it was magical watching the snow fall over the Chicago skyline. We could see the Christmas lights on Marina City, and other landmarks from our window.

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy, Fun, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: jwrichte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and really liked the hotel. I stayed here for two nights for free because of my Hilton honors points but otherwise it would have been a very expensive weekend. I realize that this is downtown Chicago but our room was priced at over $300 a night, our drinks on the rooftop were between $12-$15 (for nothing special) and breakfast was also very pricey. I don't mind paying extra for being in the city, but all of the food and drinks were cheaper everywhere else we went in the city. Having said all of that this is a very nice hotel. The staff was good, the rooms were really fun and well decorated, and the beds were comfortable. Great weekend get away overall!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pam-859
Reviews.Content: I love being a visitor in my own city! My husband and I like to take "stay-cations " when we don't have the time or money to actually get away. Recently, we had a wedding in the city and figured it would be a good opportunity for us to stay downtown. I was really looking forward to theWit, so I guess I was disappointed when it was average, at best. My impression started and ended at check-in. When I booked my reservation through them directly, I was told I would get the wedding rate since the block of rooms was full, and they are usually very flexible with honoring the group rate. I didn't think twice about it- I booked the room and figured it would be settled upon our arrival. When we got there, the receptionist saw the note regarding the wedding block on the computer that the reservationist had left and went to seek a manager. Not only did the manager never come to talk to us him/herself, the receptionist plainly said the manager could not honor it. I'm sure I could have made a big deal at that point, but it was probably a $40 difference and I didn't want to make a scene in a crowded lobby. At the end of the day, it wasn't about the money as much as the overall customer service. Bottom line: the best part of the hotel is the rooftop deck and you can get there without the overnight stay. Personally, poor customer service leaves a negative memory, and when I am spending $300 a night, am I wrong to expect it?

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton property that I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Marla T
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in August 2011 for the Rock n Roll Marathon. We did not have washcloths, or a hairdryer. We were told they were sending us a fridge, which never came. In the meantime, I went out to buy groceries for the fridge and then found out (after I had to inquire about the fridge again) that they were all out. So the housekeeper supposedly talked to her manager and said she could remove the contents of the mini-bar and we could use that refridgerator. Sunday, I get a bill for over $250 for every item in the fridge. They did take care of the fridge bill, but now today, a month later, I also see a $38.42 bill on my credit card posted 2 days after I checked out. I called and had these charges removed too. What a pain!!! I travel for work and stay in Hilton properties every week. It cost me 100,000 points (I've stayed in Hawaii for less points) and it was the worst Hilton hotel I've been in. Just thought you should know!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly L
Reviews.Content: Honestly, theWit made our trip to Chicago amazing!! My best friend and I went there for my birthday last year. As you walk through the doors you instantly feel as though you've arrived somewhere you can truly relax. The decor was modern and fresh. When we first arrived our room was not quite ready as we were a few hours early. They graciously stored our bags and then helped us plan our day. After a day of sightseeing, we headed back to the hotel to check in! They had a bottle of wine in our room for my birthday with a sweet note! The room was spacious and clean! The rooftop bar was simply stunning. Although it was freezing when we went, we still enjoyed the view and a cocktail! It is simply a place you can not miss! Thank you for a great experience! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed staying at the Wit!”
Reviews.Author: aj8821
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wit in August -- we had planned to go to the Air and Water Show that weekend, but it rained, so we changed our plans. However, we had a great weekend getaway here... we enjoyed eating at State & Lake Friday night, shopping on State Street and down at Water Tower, and walking along the River... the front desk was so helpful and friendly with every request or question we had... the location of the hotel was wonderful, as we were in walking distance of lots of things, and we enjoyed going to the Roof for drinks after supper, especially as there was a line to get in clear down the block, but because we were hotel patrons, we got to go right up a separate elevator. Our room was large, modern, comfortable and clean. I definitely look forward to returning to the Wit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: fuertea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. The staff is extremely friendly and the valets are very caring with your vehicle which is always a concern for me. It was completely unexpected to receive a soft a delicious cookie once check-in was complete. But this little touch just made the trip so much better! The rooftop lounge is amazing, everyone was dressed in the best fashion and it was more fun than I could imagine(expensive drinks though!) Our room on the 15th floor had a view of the chicago theatre, and was a corner room so it was flooded with windows! Fantastic! The bathroom was HUGE, seperate huge spa tub and shower and everything was super modern. The only negative thing I could notice about this entire room was that the door to the room slams extremely hard without any force, but thats nothing horrible. All in all I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable and hip place! Will come back here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LindaABQ
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the Wit for five days in August 2011 and were very pleased. The room was a nice size, the queen sized beds quite comfortable with nice linens. The room was very clean. The only issue we had was that the maids kept leaving us just 2 sets of towels, but when we could't find the maid cart in the hall, the staff was quick to bring us extras. This hotel is very well situated if you are doing things downtown. There is an "El" stop right on this corner, with a main"El" stop just a couple of blocks away. If you are looking for nightlife, the bar that is on the rooftop seems to be the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Aimeyah
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location of this hotel, right on State Street in the loop! We had a wonderful stay over the weekend. Our room was very nice, with the decor being modern. The room was decent size for being in the city. We stayed on the 10th floor and had a view of State Street and the river. Overall, I gave this hotel a "very good" rating instead of a "excellent" review for two reasons: 1.) The elevator became very crowded, and a line formed usually reaching the entrance door nightly. The did have front desk person move over to help "facilitate" the elevator, but you would still wait 10 minutes to get on the elevator. There were two lines...one for people going to the restaurant/bar and the other for guests going to their room. The people going to the restaurant/bar seemed to have priority to the elevator. Several guests in line trying to get to their rooms, were commenting that apparently the hotel values restaurant patrons over hotel patrons. 2.) Check in was at 4 PM and check out was at noon. We asked if we could have late checkout, at 1 instead of noon, and we received a heavy 'sigggggggggh' from the front desk clerk and she even demanded a reason why we needed an extra hour! Overall, I would stay here again...it was a great value and a spectacular location!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: KWMSeattle
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and stayed at theWit with a handful of other people from my team. I already knew we had selected a modern, swanky hotel and I ended up being more impressed than I imagined. My room (queen bed) was very clean and pretty large. The tile shower was a nice touch. I even had a good experience with the iron in the room! (I want to replace the one I have at home with one of them.) I spent some time at Roof and State and Lake and had a great time at each. The view from Roof is fantastic. Even though my room looked out over the el train the noise level was very low. I slept well each night I was there. I think the only minor complaint from my trip was the high cost of the wifi: $20 per day! As this was a business trip this was expensed but still feels very overpriced. I recommend theWit and would stay there again next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Wit and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: KathBri
Reviews.Content: - impeccable customer service - loved the room and the view - excellent location to many attractions - able to catch the train or bus nearby - we recommend this hotel and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “W better watch out, the Wit is here.”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Check-in/out Staff at front desk were courteous and efficient. All of my loyalty card info requests were correctly noted. Room/Facility/Lobby The lobby was hip/trendy without being pretentious. The room design was very modern. Very tech friendly. The NEC phones seem a bit too futuristic and complicated to use at times. The toilet fixtures exemplified real quality and attention to details. One draw back was the shallow square sink, while I appreciate its modern and clean look, but it's not practical, water splashed everywhere. I also enjoyed the wall art in my room as well. Very nice touch. Restaurants I had breakfast at the lobby restaurant State & Lake, very attentive service and they put a refreshing twist to boring American hotel breakfast. Transport: Close enough to Clark&Lake Blue Line CTA station (walkable), good alternative to Taxi to O'Hare. Train Noise: The property is situated next to the Blue Line tracks. So lower floors may be bothered by the occasional train noise. Roof Top Bar The hotel has a very cool roof top bar. All my Chicago friends told me that this is one of Chicago's best roof top bars. Final Thought What a great addition to the Hilton property collection. Finally! a Hilton property that's catered to the younger design conscious crowd. And they've done so in such a great balance between comfort, style, substance and service. Great job! and SPG's W Hotel better watch out!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: libby10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wit 08-24-11 until 08-26-11 in a large spa suite. Location: First off, we thought it was a very good location. We took the blue line from O'Hare and had little trouble finding the hotel. (The train station it's self was a little confusing, but the hotel was easy to find from the Clark/Lake station.) It was an easy walk to Michigan Avenue, the Art Institute, Trader Joes (home of cheap snacks and wine), etc. Check in and out: We arrived about 2:00 only to be told the room wasn't yet ready, but the receptionist completed the check in process for us and they stored our luggage while we went and had some lunch. I liked the overall look of the hotel; it was very clean, modern and more than a little "hip". The front desk called us within the hour to notify us that the room was ready. Halls and Elevators: The sound piped into the hallways of birds chirping during daytime was very nice. We like the sounds of crickets at night too. Such a small thing, it was a very nice touch. As others have stated, the bar on the top floor (the "Roof") has lots of activity and seems to draw a lot of young people to the hotel. Although we did note that the elevators were a little slow at times, we didn't notice it so much at night and therefore we didn't attribute it to activity on the Roof. We didn't have any issues with the Roof party goers, but I see how, if it was a different group, it could be a little trying. Room: The room was equally hip and a little retro in its furnishings. The best features were the comfy bed and pillows, very comfortable. The televisions located in the bedroom and living room were also very good. The bathtub, large enough to lay down in, great. The kitchenette was well equipped and the few bowls, glasses, etc we used were clean and a step up from what you might expect. Toiletries were Gilchrist and Soames, all very nice. Our view from the room was spectacular, I could not have hoped for better view. View, bed, pillows, bathtub and shower, all great. I'd read where some people complained of room noise from the Roof. We were on the 25th floor and my husband's a really light sleeper, we didn't have any complaints. There was some street noise, sirens and such; we chalked that up to it being in the center of a large city. Some is to be expected. Granted, it was a little worn. (My husband said it's to be expected of any hotel.) The bedroom door scraped up, a couple of the chairs at the dining room table a little dirty, the bed skirt looked dingy and a little beat. (I'd suspect the cleaning staff the culprit in 2 of the 3 of those issues.) Yet, the room the space offered was good for the price, the location, etc and I was happy with it for just under $300 a night considering that it included breakfast. But, if I'd paid much more than that, I would not have been happy about the little flaws. The only other issues I noted with the room, and I think it's been mentioned here before, was the lack of hooks in the bathroom. We had one hook in the bathroom for towels. A little odd, even with just two people in the room, we had to resort to draping towels over the shower door. It was a huge, clean, stylish bathroom; I'd rather not spoiled the look of the room by draping towels over the shower door. Too, the furniture in the living room seemed very uncomfortable (or maybe the comfy bed slanted my perspective?). I tried the sofa and the wing backed chair with and without pillows, but still felt a little like the Princess and the Pea. Could not seem to get comfortable for some reason. The front desk staff and the wait staff we encountered at the State and Lake Restaurant were very good. They were attentive, helpful and prompt with service and help as needed. We had to check out a day early due to the impending hurricane (thanks, Irene!) and the clerk at the front desk really encouraged us to contact Travelocity about having the hotel rate refunded. Much to our surprise, she was right. Travelocity refunded the last night r/t the travel problems. We appreciated her help and guidance; the concierge's help in securing phone numbers to the airline, all their assistance was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGalCda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TheWit in late August for 4 nights. The one thing I will give this hotel is location. My boyfriend and I were able to walk everywhere, even to the aquarium which is a good 40 minute walk. Its very centrally located close to restaurants, the magnificent mile and the subway if you choose to take it. Here were some of the challenges we faced with this hotel. First off concierge was terrible, the girl we dealt with was extremely rude not only to us but to people around us as well. Her directions to various places were awful and wrong. My boyfriend and i ended up getting better directions from a stranger on the street who saw us with a map out, including a description of the restaurant we were headed too of how the food was and very specific location. Also, in order to access your floor you must use your keycard in the elevator. I understand this from a security point of view, great idea as there is a bar on the 27th floor. However, when people check in please tell them this, its just a courtesy. We found that many guests had the same issues that we did that they could not access their floor. This should be told to people upon check -in. Also, I ordered up room service for breakfast one morning as a treat and charged it to the credit card which I gave for incidentals to get my keys. On the Friday i went downstairs to ask concierge to check us in for our flight my boyfriend stayed in the room. The concierge did check us in however, when i went back to the room i was locked out and our keys were void. When I had to go back downstairs i was told i did not pay the room service bill and therefore was not able to have access to my room. I explained that I had already given my credit card so i did not feel it was acceptable to be locked out. The morning we were checking out our fire alarm went off in our room although inconvenient I can understand that this was not at the fault of the hotel, it happens. The front desk called our room and said that she would send someone up to check on things. The fire alarm stopped and they came up to check said things were fine. My boyfriend and I continued packing and the alarm went off again, this time for about 15 solid minutes (its loud and extremely annoying to say the least) I received a second call from the front and here is my issue, the girl was extremely rude to me on the phone. She asked "what i was doing to cause this"? not once but twice. I'm not sure what one does to cause a fire alarm (neither my boyfriend or myself smoke) but a quick apology for the inconvenience would have been appreciated not a blame for something i have NO control over. This hotel overall is fine. I would not be paying top dollar by any means for this hotel. I would rate it as average but nothing more and in terms of customer service, not so great. We loved the city and look forward to returning however, not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the room and felt right at home.”
Reviews.Author: sexycee
Reviews.Content: I recieved excellent service from Sylvia will in room 611. She was friendly, and extremely accomodating. The service she provided was extremely exceptional and done with pride. I rate the room well above a five star. Most importanly, Sylvia's personality made me feel most confortable and welcome during my stay in the room. I recieved a refrigerator during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Say Yes to theWit”
Reviews.Author: glamtrav
Reviews.Content: As I was going to be in town for 6 days, I asked for a comfortable room with a view and I was originally given a room on the 18th floor that didnâ€™t have a view at all and it was kind of small. Then I went to the front desk and I was switched to the 26th floorâ€¦.and what an upgrade! Although I was hesitant due to the possible noise of the The Roof. I never heard the music. I was on the other side of the stairs and away from the elevator. The room was like a mini size apartment, from the full size bathroom, work desk, to the mini kitchen. I loved the view of the city and Lake Michigan from the floor to ceiling windows. I watched the sunset and sunrise from my room. The bed was so comfortable I could hardly get out of bed in the morning. The amenities in the room are top notch: the touch screen phone, the silver ware in the drawers, the stainless steel refrigerator and microwave. I also had a sink to wash dishes, if needed. It was cool. The bathroom was huge as well and very comfortable. The bathroom door was heavy, but closed so you could have a full length mirror to view yourself before you leave out every dayâ€¦good thinking Wit! Also, not sure what room others had, but 2611 has two closets. One with shelves and the other to hang items with a safe and put a suitcase. My television also sat on a fancy compartment with drawers. I did hear the subway, but it was very minorâ€¦almost faint like when an air conditioning unit first comes on. The hotel offered coupons for breakfast during my stay so I took advantage of that every morning and it provided coffee, a muffin or croissant and a fruit. They also put it in a bag if you are taking it to go. Nice addition! The hotel close to so many restaurants, shopping (Macyâ€™s, Old Navy, H & M) and North Chicago River. I love to walk so itâ€™s a short walk to Magnificent Mile which has very high end shopping. I did visit theRoof a few times and itâ€™s a very nice touch to the hotel and I didnâ€™t have any problems on the elevator nor getting access. There was never a line nor a long to time to get a drink. There were some celebrity guests in attendance; so this place is on Chicagoâ€™s top list to hang out. I had an amazing time, while enjoying an amazing view! The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. I had a fedex package delivered with some Bears pre-season tickets and I didnâ€™t encounter any problems. My room was always clean, replenished with amenities(shower cap, sewing kit, gromming kit, mouth wash, body/hair cleaing essentials, hair dryer, bath robe) and if I has any requests or questions, the staff went above and beyond to provide quality service. I would definitely stay again. Go Wit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Critical_But_Fair
Reviews.Content: It has been a long time since I experienced such poor and unprofessional service as I just did at the Wit. The hotel itself looks good - hip, modern and clean. However, the service I received ruined my stay. Had I had a reservation for more than 1 night, I would have immediately moved to a different hotel. The line at the front desk was always long because of too few staff. When I asked the concierge for restaurant and lounge recommendations, the only thing he could think of was what was offered at his hotel (waste of time even talking to him). However, the worst service was found in the hotel's restaurant and roof top bar -- incredibly slow service, no graciousness, and attitudes from the servers, bouncers and bartenders as if I should be happy just to be at the Wit. I travel to Chicago routinely for work and pleasure, and I will never even think of staying or dining at the Wit again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern cheap chic hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, this new brand of Doubletree hotel had a hip cool looking exterior and lobby. It was well located between Blue Line and Red line/Orange line trains. That made it pretty convenient from the blue line train coming in from O'Hare. At check in (late morning), they already didn't have any of their warm chocolate chip cookies. Ok, no huge deal. Checked into the room which was a two room suite. It included a kitchen area with basic plates, flatwae, glasses, refrigerator, sink and microwave, so if you want to make food in the room over an extended period of days, this is a great thing. I booked a lake view suite. The lake view, if you can call it that, was a sliver of lakefront between two buildings you could see about a mile or so away if you turned your head to the right and looked out the window. Don't count on much for a lake view at this property - not worth paying extra for. The Internet wifi signal was very weak and kept coming and going; and again,the wifi access price was expensive. When will hotels like this get with the program and free Internet access? The bed was comfortable. Pillows were down or foam - I kept only the down. Had an LCD TV, an in room safe, and nice bathroom. The furniture and decor was a bit cheesy and lower quality, hence my "cheap chic" comment in the title of my review. Doormen never offered any help with my bags. Concierge seemed real bother when I asked for some subway directions and dinner ideas. This hotel has a popular rooftop bar - be warned. Lots of drunk, loud partiers were in the lobby in line waiting for that elevator, as well as in other elevators. Even had people trying to sneak in using the other elevators asking me to let them onto the roof floor with my room key (I said no). Overall, it wasn't my favorite hotel. For similar types of hotels, I would go to a W or Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury at a good price”
Reviews.Author: TruthfulCritic85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, right on Street St. and one block off Michigan Ave. The exterior and interior of the hotel is very modern. All staff that I encountered was very friendly and willing to help. We only stayed at this hotel for one night and reserved a normal king room. The room was a decent size with nice modern accents, plus the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The only downside was that our view wasn't the greatest...we were overlooking the train tracks. On the other hand, my Brother and his girlfriend booked a King Spa Tub room. Now their room was awesome. The room was a great, corner room with floor-to-ceiling windows that had views of the lake and the river. For the extra $60 I would say upgrade to get great views and a nice size room. Oh, and the bathroom was gorgeous with views of the lake and also have a nice large window. We wound up going up to TheRoof bar but were unable to stay due to how crowded it was. From the looks of it, that place is pretty popular with awesome views. If we weren't so tired, we probably would have stayed for some drinks. I saw some reviews that talked about the crowds of people at the hotel for TheRoof...from what we saw, the hotel staff did a good job at lining the bar-goers up on the side of the hotel and ushered them in to a dedicated elevator. We never experienced any problems with this. Overall, I would say that this hotel lives up to it's 4-star rating, and for the low price I paid, how could one go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pepito506
Reviews.Content: This hotel, right at the Lake/state El station, 3 blocks away from the park and the river walk, makes it on the best locations to stay in town. When I stayed the price was unbeatable, very nice, clean, new and chic hotel. I could see from my window the river and the Chicago Theater sign. I loved it! Also 2 blocks away from the blue line (open 24/7). Multiple dinning options around, not even one block away. Also you have malls with Old navy, last call, Puma, borders.... great stores just minutes away. This is the place where I'm staying at from now on when I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay we ever had!”
Reviews.Author: laura2000mi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at theWit for our honeymoon, and we were blown away. Everything was simply wonderful. We received a great rate from a special on travelzoo.com ($150/night), and stayed Wed - Fri night. We were worried that the hotel would be too "trendy" (snobby) or we would feel out of place, but that never happened, the staff was incredibly polite and wonderful. Some of the highlights: ~Excellent location, there is an L stop right at the entrance to the hotel, and many attractions are walking distance. View was wonderful. We arrive at 10:30am, and although official check-in was not until 4:00pm, they called our cell phone to tell us they had a room ready around noon. ~We had no noise problems like others mentioned, we were on the 25th floor, so we were high enough from the L stop to not hear train noise, but we were 2 floors below the ROOF bar, so couldn't hear noise from there either. ~ROOF bar was fun, but a bit trendy for our taste. We enjoyed the view and two drinks and then called it a night. We went on a Thursday night, and it was crowded, so it would probably be insane on a weekend night. We didn't have issues with crowds waiting for the elevators, but again, we were at the hotel during the week. ~We started out in the regular king room, which was very nice. We loved how the room was decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable, as were the pillows (sometimes I have a hard time sleeping on pillows I am not used to, did not have that problem). Great bed clothes as well. ~On the second day, we came back to our room to find a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries with a very thoughtful card congratulating us on our marriage. What a very nice touch! ~For our last night, a king spa suite was available, so we asked to be upgraded. They told us it would cost an additional $40 for the upgrade which we were fine with, but when we got our final bill, they did not change us any additional. We double checked to make sure everything was as it should be, and they told us to that the upgrade was complimentary. We thought that was very kind of them. ~The king spa suite blew us away! There was a kitchenette, living room area, and additional bedroom (that was the size of our original room). The bathroom was HUGE, and had a large tub and glass enclosed shower. Also two very nice robes to use. We loved that room, and was very happy that we were able to enjoy it for the last night. Definitely book a king spa suite if you can! ~The clock radio also had an iphone dock, and a USB port to change an additional iphone, very handy. In our first room, there was also a special "bedtime beats" button, which played soothing quiet piano music. My husband loved that feature, and used it all night. The radio in the king spa suite did not have the button though. ~There is a wonderful fast food type asian restaurant right across the street called Wow Bao. Baos are small meat filled steamed buns. We ate there several times, it was so good! They have breakfast ones with egg, cheese, and bacon. For $1.59 each, the price could not be beat for a quick breakfast. Overall, the hotel was absolutely outstanding and we are definitely going to try to stay here again the next time we visit Chicago. Location, view, style, and comfort amenities were all excellent. The staff was very kind and made our honeymoon very special for us. We can't say enough good things about the Wit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Experience”
Reviews.Author: lzw2v7
Reviews.Content: Positives - -Great Location -Great Room. Very modern. Awesome view! -Spa option is great! -Good live music. Negatives - -Room was not ready when I arrived. Hotel gave me a 30$ cedit at the roof top bar where 2 drinks cost 34$. Although I gave them my cell # they never called me. After 2 hours I inquired again where they found me a room. Total inconveince after a long day of traveling. -You have to wait forever for an elevator. 20 min some cases. One night it took me 25 min get a bucket of ice! Overall feedback - Disappointing for the money. At the price I paid and the competition of 5 star hotels in Chicago I expected more. The last thing I want to be doing after a long day of traveling is wait for my 5 star room. Vacation is short.....Time is important.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Helpful Management”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham64
Reviews.Content: WHen we arrived at theWit Hotel in Chicago we were helped to the front desk to receive our room, upon giving the lady at the desk our conformation number she left to go to the back. The manager came out and told us he had some bad news, they had had a problem with their cleaning service and could not give us a room. We were shocked by this news and were wondering what we were going to do, but the manger kindly told us that he would give us our first night free along with a taxi ride to the new JW Marriot for a free nights stay there. We had a great stay at the JW and the next day we were transferred to theWit. At theWit they upgraded us to a suite for free and sent us a free bottle of champagne and strawberries. Our stay at theWit was fantastic and worry-free for the rest of the trip. We loved the beautiful room , the spectacular views, and the kind/helpful staff. The hotel is also at a key location, walking distance from Millennium Park and steps away from the Chicago theatre. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Doubletree Hotels”
Reviews.Author: LiftingIron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location just south of the mile. The room was clean, the staff was nice, and the drinks at the ROOF were mixed right (should be at $14 a mixed drink....but that is the way it goes in the big city). During the day at the ROOF, the dress is casual to dressy, but at night, everyone dresses to impress! If you plan to go to the ROOF, you should just get there early to avoid the line or stay at the hotel to get priority access when possible. Here I am reviewing the hotel but mostly talking about one of the hotel bars. It is just that the bar is such a focal point of the place; at least for those who like such atmosphere. If you don't like all the activity, you can easily steer away from it and relax in your room. The hotel seems to be very active all the time which we liked. Our guest room was quiet, but when we wanted some action, we just took the elevator up or down. Breakfast was very good with attentive service staff. We will, without a doubt, return to theWit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Don't Book ANYWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: Karenna_11
Reviews.Content: I originally had booked this hotel and then cancelled it but my partner begged me to rebook it because it looked so amazing. WE ARE SO GLAD WE DID! theWit is an incredible hotel. We were worried about noise but we heard nothing, ever! We were also worried about it being 'too hip' for us thirty somethings (it wasn't! )and it wasn't 'too young' as some other reviews. Highlights, - The in-room views are incredible, especially the ones of Marina City - You are located between all of the best stuff to do in the city! Other hotels claim to be in the loop but they are really far away - We walked all over Chicago from this location - The Bed and Breakfast package is worth event cent! $20 per person per day for breakfast. The breakfast is amazing, well priced and the restaurant service is incredible. Stay here if... - You like prompt, amazing service - You like contemporary surroundings and clutter-free, non-tacky decor - Style, grace, class

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay at theWit”
Reviews.Author: chalouisduletz
Reviews.Content: Things are happening at theWit, no question about it. The hotel has a hip and elegant feel about it, including a lively scene at the rooftop bar. Prepaid Internet rates can be $180 a night for an ideal location, three blocks from the direct subway line to O'Hare, just inside the northern edge of the Loop near the beginning of the Magnificent Mile but convenient to the Art Institute and all the outstanding architectural sights that are the glory of this city. Rooms are elegant and spacious. Lots of pillows, really good, high quality sheets. Stylish designer bathrooms, although mine only had a shower if you're intent upon a soak after pounding the pavement. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Minor quibbles only: the key card access device in the elevator, required for all guest floors, is difficult to find, being approximately at mid-calf level. Guests ride up to the roof garden and back to the lobby trying desperately to figure out how to get to their rooms. Second, how can luxury hotels continue to charge $10 and up per day for Internet access when it's free at places like Days Inn and Motel 6? This is like charging for the air-conditioning and the lights these days. Let it go, guys.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent, mainly good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: MDDCFlyer
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you this is not your typical DoubleTree. Why it is branded as one is really beyond me, as it is much more upscale than your run-of-the-mill DoubleTree. The staff is probably the youngest I have ever seen in an Hilton chain and there are plenty of them everywhere. Do not confuse young with bad service - they were attentive, present, and very helpful when needed. The hotel has a different vibe, from the music piping at the entrance, through the restaurant to the rood top lounge (more on that latter). It had reminded me some hip hotels, and that is probably my main problem with it. It is centrally located. Yes, you can hear the L, but it did not bother me, as it was more of a white noise. The rooms are large and well appointed. HD TV (which took about 5 minutes to come to live every time, but once it did, it worked great), nice big bathroom (yes, the sliding door is very heavy, but workable). As HHnonor I've received my free Internet which worked without a problem. What did not work very well was the reception on my ATT 3G phone which seems to lose the network every couple of minutes. As HHnonor you'll get breakfast voucher worth 17$. It will not go very far and if you go for anything above continental (which is what they are suppose to provide to elites) it would not cover the charges. The infamous roof top lounge is a very nice space indeed, but when you have to wait in line for an elevator every afternoon because everyone (non-guests) are going to the lounge it is kind of bothersome. At least at the weekends they block one elevator just for the lounge. It is also annoying when a guest goes up there the chances of finding a place to sit are slim to none as it is packed. One wonders what is the connection of the lounge to the hotel. So in summary, I'm ambivalent. Will I return? I do not know. The hotel is hip, but probably too hip for me. That said, the good outweighs the bad.

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnychristine
Reviews.Content: The staff of The Wit is the best.From the front desk to managers to the cleaning people they are all friendly,welcoming and professional. The food for our meetings was outstanding. I am truly impressed by the attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Once we got to the room, it was just okay”
Reviews.Author: scotthardycrna
Reviews.Content: I arrivied with a friend early in the day, knowing that we were too early to check in. So, we left our bags with bell services and went to the Cubs game. When we arrived back at the hotel, I finished our check-in. The front desk was unable to find my room keys, so she printed another set. When opened our room door, we discovered that it was already occupied. Fortunately, only their luggage was in the room at the time. So, after rummaging through their belongings (just kidding), we went back to the desk and got the keys to our own room. I had booked a room with two queen beds, but the front desk informed me that I had been "upgraded" to a room with one king bed and a sleeper sofa. After requesting to be downgraded back to my original room, the rest of our stay was uneventful. As for the hotel itself, it is clean, and the rooms are nice enough. The location is great, just off the chicago river. If you are looking to be in the heart of the magnificent mile, this isn't the place for you. But, it has very easy access to all the trains (less than a block), and it is very near the famous Chicago Theater and more restaurants that you could try in a year. Personally, I would choose the Omni, especially if I was there for shopping or sightseeing. But for our one-night stay, it was great. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Christophe2307
Reviews.Content: The plus: Great location; beautiful design of the room which was quite big; Nice view over marina city from the 12th floor; silent (for Chicago!) room. Excellent valet service (expensive but difficult to do without if you have a car). To improve: Unbelievable that an hotel of this category does not offer free wifi whereas every basic motel does! You have to be on a high floor to avoid noise from the El but not to high to avoid the huge noise from the skybar on 27th floor (12th is perfect) The skybar is a great disapointement: overcrowded at all times; presence in the lobby and elevators of screaming crowd of overdressed and ridiculous girls wearing high shoes they don t know to walk with:-) funny to see but rapidly annoying for hotel guests

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype; not likely to try again”
Reviews.Author: swim_coach61
Reviews.Content: It was a hefty chunk of change for a hotel that wasn't really worth it. i have the money, I don't mind spending the money when I stay someplace that's worth it -- I don't think this was. It's nice, well-placed, and comfortable; however, maybe we weren't the clientele they wish to cater to. If you are young, if you are hip, if you have money to toss -- it's a perfectly good hotel. Oh, and you must have good upper body strength -- more than average. I go to Chicago semi-regularly to see my BF; I'm still looking for a "regular" hotel to make mine. theWit will not be that hotel. Don't get me wrong, it's a perfect location, the staff was generally friendly, and the room was large; unfortunately, the door to the bathroom was so stiff as to require both hands to slide it open and closed (I am very in-shape, this was ridiculous). A problem exacerbated by the lack of an actual handle, it was a slider with only a finger alcove. Water bottles in the room -- $6 for Figi? Yeah, so not gonna happen. The mini bar/snacks/etc -- thank goodness I saw the little placard which told me that simply picking something up would cost me the price of the item. Who knew that Rooftop bar was so popular, and so loud? Obviously a place for the young and hip to go, the young and hip also blocked elevators and lobby... We did want to go, but at 6:30 it was so crowded and so loud that we didn't stay -- the bar within State and Lake wasn't bad. Apparently, it was a wedding weekend, not just there, but everywhere. Timing... In short, I don't really recommend it, unless trendy is important to you and you are young, or hip, or well-off, or combination of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: John_Gregory
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, bathroom was especially great and spacious. Reception staff very welcoming & concierge helpful. Housekeeping not that great at getting the room serviced at a decent time & no way communicating with them - couldn't even establish what language they spoke & couldn't get them to tell someone to sevie the room. Didn't eat at the hotel, but roof bar not as exciting as everyone makes out and very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique type hotel, amazing rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: mbal924
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary and opted to stay local to celebrate. We have one of the best cities in the world at our finger tips and people travel to Chicago all the time for their vacations â€“ why not take advantage of it. We opted to spend the night at The Wit hotel. A Doubletree hotel, it has a lot of the staples of all Doubletrees: comfy bed, spacious room, delicious chocolate chip cookie. But the Wit is decorated BEAUTIFULLY. You walk in and you are hit with vibrant colors and dÃ©cor. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was not ready yet, but we wanted to hit the city right away so they took our bags and would call us when our room was available. We left and headed to our first destination and to my surprise 30 minutes later they called to tell us it was ready for us. After a long day of visiting museums and Millennium Park, we headed back to the Wit to relax and get ready for dinner. AS soon as we got back, our bags were brought up in a flash. The room was beautifully designed with great views of the city. As I said, the bed was very comfortable, there was a IPod doc, and the bathroom was very contemporary with a large sink and a glass shower (typical of what Iâ€™ve seen in Europe). But one of the best features of the hotel is the ROOF. Itâ€™s the Witâ€™s rooftop bar. Even more beautifully designed than the hotel, the ROOF has an indoor and outdoor area that you must try. Drinks are on the pricier side, but nothing different from other bars/lounges in Chicago. The bartenders were so friendly and they had a ton of TVs you could watch on the outdoor patio area. It was Game 6 of the NBA finals so we sat at the bar and watched on their TV there while soaking in the amazing views of the city. If youâ€™re looking for a fantastic boutique type hotel in the city, you cannot go wrong with The Wit. If weâ€™re planning to stay in the City overnight again, this will be at the top of my list. Also for tourists visiting, the WIT is a less than $10 cab ride to the museums, aquarium, Millennium park and also in the middle of the Theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof-top bar with amazing views of Chicago skyline”
Reviews.Author: OlgaGrigoreva
Reviews.Content: A must-see for anyone in town. Great selection of signature cocktails, awsome people-watching spot, and simply a great lounge bar to spend an evening in. The only con is that the smoking area is all the way down at the entrance to the Hotel. We were in during a free-seating night, but I've heard they make you pay for tables on certain nights. TBD. Try it, if you make it in you will certainly have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Pick the Wit”
Reviews.Author: JRTheChief
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently spent three nights at the Wit (Sun-Wed). We had nothing but a great experience. (It does sound like the rooftop bar crowds on weekends can present a challenge for hotel guests.) Check in at the reception desk was smooth and friendly. The hotel has a nice boutique feel about it. The rooms are nicely appointed and have a great shower. The only downside of our stay was the room charge for the internet service. (I believe that free WiFi is available in the lobby area.) If you plan on using the "L" to get around, it would hard to find a better location than this. boarding points for all the lines, expect for the blue line are right out the door. The blue line is thee short block away. The location of the hotel allows for great walking access to downtown and the Miracle Mile on Michigan Avenue.We did not have a whole lot of interaction with the staff, but they were quite friendly and competent. During our next stay in Chicago we will certainly explore the possibility of returning to this great property.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for fun and friendly, LOOK ELSEWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: jamiefrahm
Reviews.Content: I recently planned a girls trip in Chicago and was so excited about staying at the Wit, unfortunately, it did not live up to expectations. My check in welcoming was less than gracious, I had to pay to get to the roof top bar, my room was not cleaned on Saturday afternoon, my wake up call never called and they charged the room to the wrong credit card. All in all it was a really bad experience which was really disappointing after all the work I had put into planning the trip. If you're looking for a fun and FRIENDLY environment, look else where! The Wit is not the place to stay, it was definitely not worth the money at all. In addition, the staff seemed to go out of their way to treat me and my friends like second class citizens. Very bad experience at the Wit all together.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but is it a hotel or nightclub?”
Reviews.Author: Vinniesyd
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great walking diastance to everything worth seeing and the train directly to O'Hare airport. Nice rooms and friendly staff. My only issue with this hotel is on thursday,Friday & Saturday nights they have a night club on the 25th floor and preference to the lifts are given to the non guests going up to the club. I along with other guest waiting to get back up to their rooms had to 10 mins before I questioned the priority with the security. The other was being stopped each time I re-entered the hotel as security were preoccupied with stopping persons from entering the the hotel via the wrong entrance for the club. Would I stay there again yes probably.

Reviews.Title: “Thought this was a hip/trendy place to stay???”
Reviews.Author: ihearttravels77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for my bachelorette party...its in such a fabulous part of the city, we figured The Wit would be our perfect homebase-we were wrong! The staff was not helpful from the moment we arrived. Security came to our room at 3am-4 large men...not necessary!- we were not even disturbing any of the other guests because we talked to every one of our surrounding neighbors the next day. The rooms were small and our showerhead was broken. To top it all off, they charged a credit card they SPECIFICALLY were told was just being used to hold the room. The only thing The Wit has going for them is the location. If you're looking for a fun and fabulous place to stay in this area, DO NOT STAY at the Wit! They are NOT fun and fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julia45
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel...so stylish, so beautiful. The decor is modern, clean, comfortable. The soft sound of birds (day) or crickets (night) chirping in the hallways creates great ambience. The rooms are spacious; we had 4 people staying in a room with 2 queen beds and there was still plenty of room for suitcases on the floor. The rooftop bar provides incredible views of the city. Drinks are pricey, but you kind of expect that for the location. Upon arrival I forgot my cell phone in my car just after the valet had parked it. He was so kind and didn't hesitate to run to the ramp/lot to retrieve it for me. Great service. Breakfast in StateLake restaurant was delicious. Too bad Cibomatto was closed on Sunday night or we would have dined there. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: daisyfae
Reviews.Content: The staff was spectacular, the view from my room on the 24th floor was breath-taking, and the location was perfect for a long weekend in Chicago! Upgraded to a junior suite, and it was absolutely wonderful to have a galley kitchen, lounge area and spa-style bathroom. But my favorite feature, by far, was the floor to ceiling windows, overlooking State Street. The restaurant (State and Lake) was fine for breakfast - but with typical hotel restaurant pricing, there are better food values to be had just steps from the front door. Rooftop bar? Great view, friendly staff - and requisite over-priced drinks. Did the Sunday brunch on the rooftop upon arrival, while waiting for my room to be prepared, and was a little underwhelmed... Did i mention the great view? Parking on-site = vehicular rape. $46/day. But there seem to be no other reasonably priced options, so this is likely the going rate for parking in the neighborhood. Transportation options abound! Park outside the city and take the train! Convenient bus stops just outside the hotel take you to all the museums - again, no need to have a car! The Blue line train is two blocks away (Clark/Lake) and can get you to/from O'Hare Airport for $2.25! A taxi will cost you $45! Had a blast! Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Clean”
Reviews.Author: setter3
Reviews.Content: This is a a great location for theatre trips. The hotel itself is done in a contemporary decor and is clean and sleek. The staff is professional and very attentive to their guests. We wanted to see the rooftop bar but we're "older folks" and didn't really want to be part of the young people's bar scene. A staff member unlocked it for us during the day and let us look around and see the view. Beware that the rooftop is PACKED on weekends and that tends to jam the elevators. We've stayed here three times and will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: ctina225
Reviews.Content: I was delighted my firm picked theWit for my weeklong stay in Chi-town. CHECK-IN -- Hot cookie upon check-in! Sweet (if I liked sweet stuff, but nice gesture nonethless). THE ROOM -- The rooms are spacious and the decor is trendy. My room was located directly off the elevator and on the side facting N. State street with the metro line to the left. I thought that might be a problem with all the noises, but it didn't bother me at all. Then again, my home is near an airport, so perhaps I'm used to that kind of background noise. The strange part was I could hear people showering and flushing toilets and stuff. I think they have good insulated windows and doors, but the walls are thin. I'm should thank my lucky stars that my neighbors weren't boisterous :) They have wireless internet, but it's not complimentary. The desk setup was comfortable, so I could get work done in between meetings. Plus, if you don't want to pay $1/page, you can upload docs to Kinko's and pick up across the street in the basement of the Reneissance. DINNERS AND OTHER NIGHT DISTRACTIONS I was with a large group and we didn't make reservations for dinner. With the help of the nice concierge lady, we were able to snag very last minute rezzies at Hoyt's nearby. One night we decided to try Cibo Matto in theWit, since we got a coupon for a free bottle of wine upon check-in. That was not such a great idea. The weight was horrendous, and the food was only so-so. Here's my Yelp review for those that want more details: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cibo-matto-chicago The rooftop bar was snazzy, but pricey. It was fun seeing the different streams of people coming in and out of the elevators to and from the roof. Ultimately though, it was too noisy, so we made our way down to the lounge bar/restaurant, which was much better for a large group that wanted to talk. All in all, I'd stay at theWit again. Aside from the inside amenities, it was within walking distance to everything you could imagine, include shopping, delicious food, and booze.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Room, Excellent Service"”
Reviews.Author: deaconridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the July 4th weekend. Room was very quiet and the service from the hotel was excellent. Requested a refrigertor and room service promptly delivered. The bathroom sink is elegant to look at but impractical. Shallow basin causes water to splash out. Roof Top bar is apparently "the place" as it was very popular day and night. Outstanding views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel..Very few concerns, would def. return”
Reviews.Author: SunsetInStyle
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely critical in all my reviews as trip advisor has served me abounds over the past 10 years so I try to pay it forward. I really enjoyed my stay in chicago, I would like to add though it was sunny and nearly 80 each day in october which was apparently nearly unheard of weather so I might be overly excited about the trip in its entirety. I stayed a long weekend with my girl and really enjoyed the hotel overall. I paid a little extra for a corner room, had a great decent size bathroom with seperate shower/tub and the view down state st. was priceless especially the chicago theater sign.. I enjoyed being able to open the window and hear the elevated trains/sounds of the city and close it to complete calm. Bed was super comfy, TV was great and hotel could not have been in a better location, always easy to catch the train or a cab. One morning I had the pleasure of seeing 40,000 people run by for the chicago marathon and it was always easy to find breakfast in walking distance. Had a drink at the rooftop but couldnt stay long as we ventured to different restaurants and clubs every night. Concerns: Only a few first of course being the $12 for internet for 24hrs, its 2011 lets go with the charging for internet it just makes your hotel look stingy alot of us need web access for business. I travel alot and so many higher end hotels do this its just not right, especially in the US. Second I left a neck pillow in the room I used for the plane, had my girl run in literally an hour after we checkout and they were unable to find the pillow or the maid who might have taken it as the room had been cleaned, my girl seemed to feel they were genuinely unconcerned with it at the front desk. Not a big deal but enough to say something about. Finally the door opening issue. I travel alot and have stayed in decent hotels to top rated hotels all over the world. Wit has literally 2-3 "doormen" at all times (at least during my stay) and all weekend they hadn't opened a door more than once and we were in and out all day/night. If you are paying people to stand outside in a shirt with your hotel name on it, make them open the cab door, and the hotel entrance door, its simple enough and I tip when they do so!! Easy to make a great first impression... Overall staff seemed genuinely nice, with the exception of an extremely sarcastic valet who checked my baggage on the last day, and after I somehow misplaced my ticket for it an hour later proceeded to poke fun at the situation and then had trouble "locating the bags" even though it was an hour duration inbetween. Just nitpicking at this point though, I would definetely return in a minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the rip off internet”
Reviews.Author: AD72
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip to Chicago. The hotel is in an excellent location, metres from an El station and a short walk from the river and North Michigan Avenue. Rooms are stylish and large, usual Hilton style bathrooms. The bar on the roof has an excellent view. I do doubt the need for heavy hard core dance music on a Sunday afternoon, I'd have thought that some chilled out tracks might have fitted the ambience better. My major complaint however is the cost of internet access. $12 in a room for 24 hours is more than I pay at home for one month! There are no free areas and the business centre charges $5 for 10 minutes access. This seems to be a Hilton group policy to charge as much as possible. If lots of hotels can offer this service for free why can't all of them?

Reviews.Title: “indulge”
Reviews.Author: DomingoA
Reviews.Content: pricey and worth it. Definitely check out The Roof, the view is good and the cocktails and bar tenders are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a hotel! Stay here, play here.”
Reviews.Author: TreeMd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Chicago and this is my new favorite. Hip, clean, fun, beautiful, Eco-friendly. Great location, close to Millennium Park, Michigan Ave and the River. Awesome ambient nature sounds in the halls. Service was outstanding and made us feel special. ROOF is the best rooftop bar in the city and it is on top of this hotel! This IS a trendy hotel but friendly and a great value. Stay here, play here!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, chic hotel in the theatre district”
Reviews.Author: trip_AJD
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in a Junior Spa Suite for our honeymoon and it didn't disappoint. The room was crazy spacious and the views over downtown were top notch. We didn't use the kitchen area at all but it was well layed out and had all the basic amenities you'd need to dine in. **Attention inquisitive mini-bar people (like us) - be aware that removing anything from the mini-bar will automatically charge to your room, even if not consumed. We only realised after reading the notice AFTER checking out the bottles of wine on offer. The front desk however were great and they removed the charged items, no questions asked. I know this is now standard in most higher end hotels, which is a great system, but just a warning to anyone who's not come across this before. Everything was excellent during our stay, except for our rooftop bar experience, hence the 4 star rating. The rooftop bar is amazing and the views are to die for, but we found it very pretentious, even for a Wednesday evening. The waitress couldn't have been less interested, bordering on rude, until we wanted to put the bill on our room, which she then had to bring a separate bill for. Having said that, we enjoyed some late afternoon drinks in the Phoenix Lounge and their service was fantastic. The hotel is within walking distance of most of Chicago's touristy sights which is a big plus and if you're looking for a special stay, then this is one I'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous stay at The Wit.”
Reviews.Author: Mal7673
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed around the 4th of July and could not have had a much better experience with The Wit. First and foremost is the staff. Without exception, the staff was friendly, considerate and eager to help (the concierge even arranged for a treat to be delievered to our room for my wife's birthday). From the valet to the bellman to the front desk to the concierge...everyone was top notch. Even when out in the city and had a question, we could call and they would give us useful information about where to eat or what to do. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious (especially for downtown Chicago standards). While we didn't spend much time in the room, a cramped room would have been a real negative considering my wife and I were travelling with our 17-year old and 12-year old sons. The decor is interesting but still functional (with one exception I'll mention below). A small touch was the nature sounds piped into the hallways (which you could not hear from the rooms) that changed depending on the time of day - very clever. The location is outstanding as well. At the corner of State and Lake and right at an L station, you can't ask for much more for getting around the city. We always felt safe around the hotel even late at night. Two areas to improve for the hotel: (1) The bathroom doors in the rooms are completely impractical. They use a sliding door that basically blocks the doorway to the bathroom. It doesn't really provide much privacy and came off the tracks for us a couple of times during our stay. (2) Wireless internet should be free in the rooms. It is free in the lobby, but staggering fees apply if you need wireless in your guest room. Other than those two things - which did not detract from the enjoyment of our trip - The Wit really has their act together and can be a ideal place to stay whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a girls' weekend!”
Reviews.Author: meghna1850
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went in June 2011. Definitely a hip and happening place. Great decor, great rooms, great service. The spa treatment was okay; it was overly priced, the person 1 of my friends and I had was okay; but the other girls said their treatment was nice. The free cookies were so yummy! Perfect location in downtown, walking distance to a lot of the tourist spots. The Roof has a great bar/club atmosphere! We ate at 2 of 3 restaurants: The Roof and Cibo Mato, both great food! Okay for a family if you just want to stay here to come and sleep. Perfect for a girls' weekend!

Reviews.Title: “They thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: long4travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, right next to an EL station. The front staff was so friendly and helpful, allowing us to check in early. When we brought a cheesecake back from Eli's, they sent a refrigerator to our room within minutes. The beds were comfortable, and the decor was funky-modern. The restaurant was a bit pricy, but not out of line with other hotel restaurants; breakfast was quite good. The Roof (rooftop bar) was very popular with the yuppie crowd, though not really conducive to a quiet conversation. Very nice view, though. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Its about the rooftop....not much else!”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob28970
Reviews.Content: First let me say I am a hotel snob! With that said I booked this hotel for the weekend and part of the week while in town for a house hunting weekend /work week. My realtor highly recommended the hotel noting I am single and would be in town with my sister and probably "enjoy the rooftop bar". And enjoy the roof top we did! HOWEVER the room left alot to be desired! In fact in reading the reviews I wondered if I got put in the worst room in the hotel. First the room was booked automatically through my company. They booked a standard king. When we got to the hotel we requested a change to a double and the staff gladly accommodated, however apparently we missed out. The room was clean, but trendy or chic it was not. I agree with the comment that it was a "poor manâ€™s W". The room was small and had no closet, instead a wardrobe. A wardrobe!?! Perhaps itâ€™s me but it had been sometime since I'd seen a wardrobe in a â€œchicâ€� city hotel room! Our bathroom was small. At check out I asked the front desk staff how my room compared to others in order to have an accurate view of the hotel for possible future visits, and they remarked it was a pretty "standard size" . They did share that the spa king included an upgraded bathroom. (Needless to say I wasnâ€™t upgraded and after reading the reviews apparently was the only one.) Bottom line - If the hotel bar is most important item, you've got the right place. If chic/trendy rooms and bathrooms matter most you can get more for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “In The Heart of Town - a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheKoettels
Reviews.Content: Been here for about 4 days - and had a pretty great experience. I highly recommend this property for your next trip here... you'll find the hotel to be clean, friendly, accommodating, and the service to be excellent. Everything I needed was handled exceptionally. The only complaint - the coffee stinks. Their espresso was awesome... but pass on the Joe. Also - don't stay on the upper floors unless you plan on going to the party on 27. It can get a little loud. it's right by the train lines and within waling distance to the shore. enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: asw111eh
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Great service. Jessica and Brittany did a great job helping with directions, places to shop and eat. Loved this hotel. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Small boutique hotel/Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: Isabellelivia
Reviews.Content: We loved the modern ammenities and the location. Close to the Red Line we took to Wrigley field. Close to theatre district and State st shopping. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great food at restaurant. (Great french toast for breakfast) Beds very comfy! Hotel nice and new

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Hiway18
Reviews.Content: theWit went above and beyond for my anniversary celebration. We received an upgraded corner room with cake and strawberries waiting for us. Shortly after our arrival a bottle of champagne and candy was delivered courtesy Michele one of the very fine staff of theWit. The hotel is great and allot of fun. Rooms are large for the city and the restaurants were excellent. The main attraction is the Roof bar. It is a hot spot in the city to see and be seen. As a guest of the hotel there is no cover charge and you bypass the lines of people waiting to get in. On a beautiful summer night the Roof was a great time. Over all an excellent stay and we will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: mlelikeshotels
Reviews.Content: Wow! Beautiful property! Excellent service! The staff gives the impression that they WANT to help you and strive to make your experience perfect, that they did. Clean, comfortable and great location! The Restaurants however, have terrible, rude servers. Granted - we've only had two, the other might be nicer. The food was soooooo good, though. This is what happened. We got our food and check at the same time. Our check had an added gratuity (for two people) and she never came back, no more water, no more coffee. I guess when they add gratuity they don't have to work for it. At dinner, we had a coupon for a free bottle of wine and she was such a snot about it. She made us feel like cheap skates for not upgrading. I've worked in food service for many years. I know when and why to add gratuity. I'm very offended. It is a shame, too, because the food was soooooo good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MikeDGuatemala
Reviews.Content: We came from 10 different countries for a world wide meeting. The hotel is very centric, great atmosphere, nice rooftop bar. I would definitively stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very fun stay”
Reviews.Author: WillB1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. We went for a Chicago overnight, and the service and experience were wonderful. The bar on the top floor is very fun, great views, good vibe. The staff treated us as valued guests. Good location in central downtown area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel far and away exceeded my expectations. You should know I am very hard to please so this is a royal endorsement. I booked a King spa room (1802) directly through the hotel and got a significantly better rate than Priceline. I got a corner room with floor to ceiling windows all the way around â€¦.the views were nothing short of spectacular!!!! I even had a view of the lake. It was tastefully decorated in bright but soothing colors; It was modern without being tacky. The room was spotless without a speck of dust anywhere and the bathroom was literally surgical cleanâ€¦I was blown away. It had a massive deep soaking tub with a separate shower overlooking the Chicago Theater. There was more than enough room in this tub for two people to soak up to your necks and we definitely took advantage of it. I loved the tub so much I want one for my house. This hotel thought of everything, we even found a lovers kit under the flat screen tv by the mini bar with lube and condoms in it. Really???? I just couldnâ€™t believe it. My kind bed was divine with super luxurious linens and lots of feather pillowsâ€¦..just amazing. When I made the reservation I requested two robes that were delivered as soon as I got in my room. Later I called down to room service because I couldnâ€™t find the ice machine and to get some cream for my drink. They told me where the ice machine was but offered to just bring me a bucket so I didnâ€™t have to leave my room againâ€¦â€¦ service, wow!! I read another review about the train noise. I was on the 18th floor and the train was not a problem. You can hear it but it wasnâ€™t any louder than the windâ€¦.you are downtown Chicago so no matter where you stay you will hear some street noise. At around 11:30 pm we went up to the Roof top lounge, it turns into an ubber nightclub full of â€œthe young beautiful peopleâ€� crowd. Dress to impress because you have to get past a doorman who was turning people away . They were nice enough not to charge us a cover because we were guest in the hotel but it was standing room only so we didnâ€™t say very long. Next time I will go to the Roof for happy hour instead. I will stay at the Wit again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Chicago right now!”
Reviews.Author: ashnwrig
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Wit twice in a Spa King room. The corner rooms in this category are awesome, especially if you can get a deal for around $200. Love the State & Lake restaurant!! And the spa is great- especially the bath cocktails that you can order up to your room. The Wit is by far better than the two W Hotels in this city.
