The W on Lakeshore is tired and passe, and the City Center W has extreeeemely small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Poor Mans "W"”
Reviews.Author: Roboverde
Reviews.Content: Don't misunderstand the title of my review. I think this is a fantastic hotel for your stay in Chicago. But it has the feel of a "W" but lacks some of the finer details that makes the "W" the "W." We drove in from the burbs, arrived at the hotel and valeted or car for $45 a night. Which by Chicago standards is actually no a bad price. Not great, but not terrible. The lobby was small but clean, upbeat with clean-line modern decor. The staff greeted us with smiles and a "can do" attitude. The overall staff appeared to be young and ready to serve it's guests. Which quite honestly is not always the case in Chicago (and I'm a 41yr Chgo native). Once we checked in to our upgraded 2 room suite on the 25th floor, we headed up on one of 6 speedy elevators. I would recommend asking for a "higher floor" when checking in. The hotel is situated just inside the NE end of the "L" loop and has the potential for being noisy at lower floors. Our room was clean, spacious and with the same clean line modern decor. Two 55" Flat panels in both rooms, a small kitchenette, large bath with soaker tub and stand up shower (a finer detail upgrade would be a large Rain-can showerhead). The views from the State Street side are not great. Rooms that face east are sure to feature a view of the lake or Millennium Park. My overall review of the room was very good. Spacious, comfortable bed, upscale accoutrements, quiet. The Roof Bar is definitely a draw for this hotel. Both roof top decks have fabulous views with a vibrant night life scene. Upgrade opportunity: Glass drink ware instead of plastic. Kind of juvenile in my opinion, but maybe I'm just old. Finally, the location of this hotel is superb! You are on State across the street from the Chicago Theatre and Channel 7 street side studio. You have the best of both worlds by being situated at the North end of the loop close to river taxis, Millennium Park, Michigan Ave, Chicago Theatre, State Street Shopping and a short taxi to any of the Museums and Water Tower. Not to mention the endless cuisine choices right out your door step. Great location!! My overall opinion is Great hotel, great location, great staff, great value. Don't pass this one up if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “What Hotel becomes a Legend Most? Enter The Wit (A Global Idol :)”
Reviews.Author: frequentstaydude
Reviews.Content: Of my approx 200 nights in a hotel last year the Wit remains one of my favorite hotels in the world No itâ€™s not the most luxurious or the absolute best experience imaginable. However it is about an exceptional experience in where Hilton finally gets some cool factor! Shaking off much of its once stodgy image. What can be said about the Wit that hasnâ€™t already passionately be said by others? It is part W meets Andaz perhaps somewhere in the middle. Itâ€™s a Doubletree brand but probably more an experiment at this point with the brand name as itâ€™s too special of property to really be considered a Doubletree. The Wit is more than just an exceptional unique boutique hotel that will certainly not appeal to all guests. It is so popular its can get crowded especially on weekends. Yet for many of us thatâ€™s part of the excitement being where everybody wants to be. Perhaps for some pure torture. But thatâ€™s the whole point the Wit isnâ€™t for everybody nor should it try to be! However what most guests might not realize is the Wit is the future of all hotels going forward.Itâ€™s a game changer of whatâ€™s now and whatâ€™s next. The prototype of what hotels want to be when they grow up for the next generation. Itâ€™s the start of great out of the box thinking that may have no boundaries. The Wit has to its credit â€¢ Enormously comfortable beds pillow top style)subjective â€¢ LED Lighting on dimmers for task lighting & various function and creating a romantic ambiance for those so inclined â€¢ Many heartfelt inspired team members â€¢ Wonderful playful welcome amenities in room that appeal playfully even to jaded guests â€¢ Incredible in house made chocolates that compare with some of the best in France â€¢ Inspired Management under the leadership of Mark Shouger â€¢ High caliber Door men (one in particular who remembered my name months later on my second short stay of 4 nights(folks you could be comfortable having a beer with) They are incredibly professional on a rainy day checking me into my room I was offered a huge Wit umbrella for use during my stay it was very much appreciated! â€¢ Home to the Roof Night Club one of the top hot spots in Chicago (try Monday nights for a less frenetic experience thatâ€™s truly civilized with a date or go on the weekend when its jam packed! â€¢ A place where attractive folks go to stay and older folks go to feel young and cool â€¢ The legendary Doubletree cookie (I admit to being a fan of this brilliant cookie) â€¢ Participation in the Hilton HHonors program for elite recognition and point redemption â€¢ Kitchen Aid refrigerators in the Jr suites â€¢ Fun whimsical dÃ©cor â€¢ Architect standard fixtures throughout guest rooms and suites not typically found â€¢ A hotel meets contemporary residential feel The Hotel understands the concerns that some may have with the train proximity(self included) the in house team members (front office included)have always done everything possible to accommodate based on availability . Over the years I have learned as a premium traveler that lifestyle hotels will tend to have quirks. The Wit is no exceptionWhat some see as different and breaking tradition others see as exciting .In a nut shell just like with W Hotels and Andaz not everyone will capture the magic here and instead choose to pick on the areas of needed improvement of which there is a 10 to 15 per cent factor. Having said that the positive way overshadows the negative and the 90% score here on Trip Advisor easily demonstrates its percentage of highly satisfied customers Having just written a terribly negative review on another hotel it is an honor and pleasure to sing the praises of the Wit and its passionate management Mr.Shouger who personally responds to guest comments. In house most of the team in house goes even further with numerous random acts of kindness. It was the responding to those reviews that brought me to the hotel as a customer. I applaud this hotels dedication to listening and responding to their customers praise as well as their concerns. The Hilton folks couldnâ€™t have picked a more fantastic visionary manager for a great new hotel concept. It was one of those rare moments in all my years of travel where I picked up the phone after check out and thanked them for letting me be a guest in their hotel. I left inspired refreshed in good spirits wanting to come back again in the future even though I have a number of other luxury favorites in the Chicago area In closing the Wit was a game changer for me personally and it made me want to be a Hilton customer all over again. If this is what we can expect from Hilton and the brand I def want to be their customer. I can only hope there are many more of these properties to look forward to in other cities and rumors are there will be. Itâ€™s no longer the Doubletree your mom and dad stayed in its Doubletree gets totally/really cool!!! Love it or hate it donâ€™t miss the experience!~ Congratulations to all at the Wit well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beyond Comfortable Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: kkgoblue
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in loop. Close to park, river, business, theaters. Very nice stay made even better by a caring staff. Every person said hi. Check in/out was quick and easy. All lobby staff were very helpful when asked (and even volunteered to help when not asked). Best part was when I had a very loud group of people in room next door at 3am, hotel staff came up and quieted them within 3 minutes of my call to the front desk. Very professional and showed they valued me. Rooms are excellent. Good size, contemporary, clean. Nice views. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Besides the noisy neighbor at 3am next door, I found the hotel very quiet from hallway and street noisy. Something you don't find in many city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed ...”
Reviews.Author: Sam666m
Reviews.Content: theWit was simply great. We were welcomed by the front desk, were immediately given an upgraded room even before check-in time. The room was fantastic. The concierge provided excellent sightseeing and dining advice. The hotel is very modern and very clean and comfortable. A great stay. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Hip Hotel - But BEWARE of SUBWAY NOISES....”
Reviews.Author: BMIGamingDotCom
Reviews.Content: Just completed my first 'recon' stay at theWit, and here are my perceptions... 1) Staff - Excellent, efficient, professional, courteous.. Smiles and hello's all around. At checkout, asked that a charge be taken off, due to quality of the service provided, and this was done immediately, and without hesitation or questioning - Kudos to the front desk staff. But at check-in, was grilled as to "if the address on my license was current" for no immediate reason, and felt as if I were back in a TSA line at the airport. (deduct points) 2) Room - Booked a 'Classic' room online, politely asked for an upgrade (as a HHonors member), but was denied, even though upgrades were available. Room I was assigned to was decent, but was in the middle of being cleaned with sheets all over the floor, so went back down to desk to point this out, and again asked for an upgrade for this error, and was given a 'Spa' room on the 11th floor. Spa room had sweeping views of the river and awesome wrap around glass walls. Average sized, but very nicely appointed and impressive room none the less. One cool feature was the automated drape controls, but they only operated on one side of the glass wall - You had to manually close the other side, which was twice as long as the controlled side, and that killed the novelty of this feature rather quickly. They should motorized both sides to make this work. The TV had many HD channels (more than most rooms have) and the picture quality and remote was excellent. A cool hi-tech phone was also provided en-suite, with a Touchscreen LCD display listing the various services that are yours with the touch of the finger, along with the ability to automatically program your wake-up calls with the 'celebrity voice' of your choosing. Room also came with a iPod/iPhone clock alarm with charger, which is fast becoming a standard amenity in boutique hotels. Bathroom was stocked with good toiletries (and a note saying that anything else you need or are missing could be provided), and was of good modern design - But did not care for the shower curtains (odd looking, considering the modern design - they should have gone with a glass enclosure instead) The problem encountered here was not the room, but the elevated railway station and underground subway lines situated *directly* below the hotel. Although the rail lines near the hotel makes this a very convenient hotel to stay in if traveling by rail, the one thing not clearly pointed out in handful of the reviews I read on TheWit on TripAdvisor was the *extremely* constant and annoying sounds of trains running throughout the night, and the numerous railcar and station / railcar announcements that can be CLEARLY heard on the 11th floor, and I suspect, on much higher floors as well, for rooms facing the streets surrounding the hotel. For the record, I am not a person who normally complaints about minor issues, and I only write reviews when experiencing either very excellent or sub-par stays - And all things considered, my stay at TheWit was a good one - But be warned that it will be practically IMPOSSIBLE for almost all travelers to get a good nights sleep without the use of earplugs for rooms facing the river or State Street (And for the record, I am a very sound sleeper who also enjoys high-decibel rock music on occasion). Be warned. 3) Restaurants / Bars - Had dinner at CiboMatto at TheWit - Again, excellent, friendly and professional service. Room was spacious with good ambiance and nice street views from the windows, but the food (tried a few of their 'signature' dishes) was passable at best. Too many other choices near the hotel to eat here unless you are pressed for time. Did not have a chance to eat at their casual restaurant, State & Lake, but it look inviting for a quick bite. Room service menu also looked good, but again, did not have time to sample. After dinner, met with friends for drinks at 'Roof', their cool and popular rooftop bar with nice views of nearby buildings, and both a indoor and spacious outdoor section to party in. Music in the outside section was a bit loud for 'normal' conversation, at least at night. Cigar and cigarette smokers should be aware that unlike most other rooftop bars, this one does not allow smoking outside. Service was just ok. Also, on this night, the Roof was closed until 10:30pm, due to a private party being held there, which I believe might be standard due to the many conventions and corporate functions held in Chicago, so if you are staying or going because of the rooftop bar, it would be good to check in advance if it will be open the night you will be attending to avoid sudden surprises. 4) Other Services / Technology - Internet access was a bit weird; they offer 3 'tiers' of paid service, tied to the bandwidth you might be using, which for all but the most techie of us, might be a bit unclear to most; they should do away with this confusing practice and offer one price for service, like almost every other hotel in North America does. A/V connections in the room were awesome, with a jack panel offering HDMI, composite, video, audio, Ethernet and power outlets all contained in a convenient wall plate next to the large 42" HDTV screen. Did not have time to checkout their on-site Spa, but did glance at the in-room Spa menu, with many services for both men and women offered, and the prices listed seemed very reasonable. Gym was modern and functional, and as a bonus, open 24/7. Also offers a very cool and state-of-the-art 40 seat media room/theater ('Screen') available to rent for business events and private viewing parties. Elevators were generally quick, efficient and quiet, but room keycards needed to be inserted everytime you went back to your room, which is fine for security reasons, but was really a pain in the butt, due to the card reader slots being very small and situated very low on the elevator control panel, which required most people observed (including me) to insert their cards several times to get it in correctly â€“ New, more ergonomically designed and higher-placed keycard readers should be installed in the elevators ASAP. 5) Conclusion - Fun and hip boutique hotel overall, that offers friendly service, attractive rooms, great rooftop bar, a variety of services and features, busy lobby with lots of hipsters and young professionals hanging about, and of course, one awesome location which is situated next door to the Chicago Theater (especially good if you will be using mass transit while in town), but certainly not for those who have issues with louder-than-normal city noises or those needing a good nights sleep - if noise will be a issue for you, better to look at the Hotel Monaco or Hotel 71 (both of which I have stayed in) which are both a couple blocks away with better views and a much quieter environment, compared to theWit. ps : Also received an unsolicited phone call on my cell from the hotel management after checkout to inquire about my stay, and if I had any issues they might correct (Which was refreshing to say the least, since I did not register a formal complaint at all, except to politely mention to the front desk in passing at checkout that I was a bit surprised with the noise level of trains running throughout the night) - At the least, this shows they care...

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Service, Great Location - Couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: luvs_trvl_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: The Wit is a great hotel with a wonderful location and a top notch staff. We came for slightly less than a week to visit friends, see the sights, and just relax and the hotel was an excellent choice for all of these activities. All of the sights of downtown Chicago are within an easy walk from the front door, and if comming in from O'Hare you couldn't ask for an easier, or cheaper, commute into the city. Beside the cookie given to you at check in is the only clue that this is a Doubletree - otherwise, you would think you were in a trendy botique hotel and not one that was part of the Hilton chain. The package we booked was for a Spa Room with Internet and Breakfast, all of which was included in the rate and clearly explained by helpful check in staff. The room was amazing - we had a corner room with windows on two sides, affording a small view of the lake, but amazing views of the city. The bathroom was incredible with floor to ceiling windows, a stand alone shower, and a deep, luxurious soaking tub. Breakfast was a credit for $20 per person at State and Lake. The first day or so of our staff, State and Lake was closed for kitchen remodling and the breakfast was buffet style in Cibo Mato. Once State and Lake reopened, you could order off the menu that you can see on the Wit's web site. Everything was very good. Staff was extremely helpful and always willing to make recommendations, provide directions. And there were always staff available in the lobby. My one minor beef about the hotel - the Roof bar is extremely popular. In the late afternoon/early evening you had to fight for elevators with people who were not guests of the hotel, but going up to the Roof. It would be nice to have two of the elevators for guests (maybe with no access to the Roof?) and two that could take bar patrons on up. Overall, a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone - you can stay in a big chain, but feel like you're staying in a unique botique. I hope Hilton opens more hotels like this.

Reviews.Title: “So Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 247vaca
Reviews.Content: So amazing that I am coming back in May simply to propose to my Girlfriend on the roof over looking the amazing cityscape! Great staff great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CarrotTopTwins
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Great service. The minibar in the room has sensors so don't remove anything unless you're planning on paying for it. You can request a fridge if you need it. We didn't read the warnings and got charged. Front desk was nice enough to reverse charges. Staying at the hotel gets you to the front of the line for the Roof which is nice. Really cool bar/nightclub but drinks are expensive. $14 for 1 mixed drink and beer was around $6. Cookies at check in are delicious. Location is perfect. All theaters and State street shopping are a few steps away. Potbelly's and Wow Bao are just across the street. Didn't try restaurant so I can't comment. I did order fries from room service and they came on a very nice tray.and tasted great. Had a great time and overall I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What Great Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Giggles3237
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip going to The Wit and thought I would take my family along so they could experience Chicago while I was in meetings. The facility was fantastic. Clean, very trendy and hip. Great view from the room. All of the food we had for the business meeting (Breakfast, 2 Lunches and Dinner.) was spectacular. The Roof was a great place to have cocktails, especially watching Chicago light up. But the most impressive part was the service we received from the staff. Sean at the front desk was fantastic, remembering both my name and my wife's, always with a smile. Brittany was also a pleasure to deal with. There was also have a female bellhop whose name I did not catch who engaged us in conversation and gave us a great recommendation while the concierge was otherwise engaged. Having been involved with the service industry for decades, it was a pleasant reminder of how much af an impact that good service has. I would expect to have to pay much much more for the level of service we received.

Reviews.Title: “The Wit? No Not for me.”
Reviews.Author: jinksie1998
Reviews.Content: The Wit was everything it said it would be: trendy, great location, and that's about it. The room was a good size with moderately nice furnishings. The bathroom had no tub, which would have been fine, but there was no divider between the shower area and the sink, except for a short shower curtain. So the floor in front of the mirror and sink got soaked. My room had no clocks, not on the wall, on the phone, nothing, a small annoyance, but annoying nonetheless. There were 4 slow elevators. And I mean slow. The longest instance I waited for the elevator, I pushed the button, got impatient, put on my earphones, listened to 2 complete songs, and finally the elevator appeared. At night, there were a small crowds in the lobby waiting to go up to the Roof. Which meant one of the elevators was set aside specifically for that purpose. So be prepared to walk through that, and then to wait for the slow elevators -one less elevator at that. The valet was expensive @ $46/night, but it does have in & out privileges and parking in the public garages was $34/overnight with NO in & out. The location, however, was great. In the heart of downtown and very convenient to restaurants, museums, parks, train stations, etc. Additionally I arrived on an early flight and they were very accommodating with early check-in. I will, however, NOT be staying at The Wit again for one BIG reason. I slept completely covered, sweats, long sleeve shirt, socks, the first couple of nights. But the last night, I slept with a short sleeve and the next morning I immediately noticed a rash on my arm from the sheets. I used hydrocortisone and it was gone a couple of days later. This was the deal breaker for me, I smiled through everything else, but no no no, not a rash.

Reviews.Title: “The Wit is it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pkmusic
Reviews.Content: The Wit experience is truly awesome and just what I was looking for in a great value boutique hotel in a great location in Chicago. From a simple check-in to the upgraded King suite with an amazing view to the genuinely friendly staff. I give. It 5 stars and when I am in Chicago, I will stay at The Wit. Great job, everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trede212
Reviews.Content: When you first walk into the hotel you realize this is not a standard hotel. The service is great and the details are what puts it over the top. Very modern and very clean. The "Roof" bar is a good time if you go early before it gets to crowded. The hotel is so close to the theater district and Michigan Ave that you are in walking distance to so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: srwats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a last minute stay due to some construction on our home. They gave us a great rate and put us in a great room that worked for us with our 7 month old. The rooms are clean with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: Bowhunter82
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for a bachelor party, and it was awesome. The room had a great view of Lake Michigan, and was surprisingly quiet with all of the other parties that seemed to be going on down the hall. Staff was friendly, and very helpful. The rooftop bar is a great place to get a drink if it's a nice evening. It's pricey, but every bar in Chicago is. When you are in the suite, you get to go to the front of the line for the bar, when it's busy, and believe me, it gets busy! I would definitely stay here again, it's walking distance to most things downtown, just be ready to pay a decent amount to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay - Great Location - Helpful and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: skarikari
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend at TheWit and truly loved it. The hotel is modern and trendy, but not snobby or pretentious. The room was modern and clean. We chose a corner room with floor to ceiling windows - which provided nice views. The room was very quiet and we never heard any outside or hotel noise. Another nice feature - rare these days, one window opens a bit - for fresh air. The location of the hotel simply could not be better. We parked the car and took public transportation to Michigan Ave, Museums, Willis Tower and restaurants. The hotel is located one block off of the river and a few blocks from Millennium park and is near the best coffee shop ever, Intelligentsia. The Gilchrist and Soames bathroom amenities were a nice surprise and we opted for the Spa Bathroom with the extra large modern tub. It was so worth it and the most unexpected detail. The beds were very comfortable and we both slept well. As an extra bonus, hotel guests receive free cover to the exclusive club, ROOF - located, yes, on the roof of the hotel. It provided spectacular views and even though it was a little young and showy, but the view makes it worth a visit, even if you are under-dressed! In the warmer months, they have a outdoor area that looked stunning. The restaurant in the hotel was okay - breakfast was the better of the meals. The staff, in all areas, were stellar. Each person we encountered was kind, courteous, and seemed genuinely interested in making our stay terrific. We felt like we were king and queen for the weekend at this hotel - something I have never said or felt anywhere else, including a few 5 star hotels. The only possible complaint would be the parking, which was expensive, but not out of line for downtown Chicago. And there are inexpensive parking alternatives if you are willing to walk a few blocks. We will definitely return to TheWit for the staff, quality, location, and gemÃ¼tlichkeit, if you know what that means. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mikemomaha
Reviews.Content: We are loyal Hilton members and we have really enjoyed every visit at the Wit Hotel. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. Our stay this past weekend was for my birthday and our front desk host "Jessica" found a perfect room to view the St. Patty's day "Green River" tradition; fantastic view. The location is perfect for everything and the rooftop bar during the warmer months is buzzing! The only downside to note is that the Hotel does not have On Demand movies for those Room Service Lazy Days...

Reviews.Title: “OMG Staff Rocks theWit!!”
Reviews.Author: MightyMax75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set in the perfect location and they must have spent months hiring all the staff. They are all so friendly and polite. The food at state and lake is amazing! Bacon Burger....MmmmmmMmMMMm! From arriving with Rudy in Valet, then Matt the best bellman I have ever seen in my 20+ years of constant travel and hotel stays to Annie at the desk that checked me in with a smile and a warm cookie! Everyone else I ran into was so approachable and friendly. But anything we had a question about or needed help with we went back to Matt. He was so knowledgeable about Chicago(and the world for that matter) and made us feel like more than just guests of a hotel. I believe we made a true friend. Checkout was a breeze with Onni. And we will definately make theWit a permenant Chicago based home whenever we visit. Rooms are very clean and so modern. Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST hotel in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Madi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wit for the first time the weekend before Christmas as we wanted to be in the Theatre District for Wicked. We enoyed the hotel so much that we came back in February to see Les Miserables. We wouldn't stay anywhere else as the Wit is in a great location and we have always been treated like they were so glad we were there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Yes this hotel IS ALL THAT !”
Reviews.Author: Sellersdwellers
Reviews.Content: You can believe the hype when it comes to this hotel. Modern, clean, friendly staff, good food and the little details that made this place all that. My husband and I stayed for my 40th birthday. We were greeted at curb side by the valet. It was pouring out and they walked me to the door under their umbrella, very nice touch. We received our warm cookies at check in.Waiting in our room were chocolate covered strawberries, champagne and a "happy birthday " note. Very sweet !! We ordered room service that night. Very tastey food and very reasonable price. The next day we had lunch at State+Lake. We enjoyed it so much that we had dinner there too. Would recommend stopping in to grab a bite there any time of the day. They do make the best pancakes. * Note if you are planning on going to the ROOF (lounge+bar) stop at the front desk. On Friday and Saturday night you must get a wrist band and be escorted up on the elevator. You feel VIP treatment. Also worth it. We had no issues with check out the next day or any issues with valet. We will stay here again and I will recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time.”
Reviews.Author: DawnD57
Reviews.Content: I have read other reviews. Some fabulous, some good and some pretty bad. Our experience for our 20th wedding anniversary was lovely. We booked the bed and breakfast package online. It was pricey, but we wanted a nice place. The location is truly great. We had a request for an upgrade for a certain price and it was granted. So we had a suite. It was nice. A living room with big screen TV and nice decor. However, I will say the furniture seemed a little cheap, like it came from IKEA or something. The kitchen was equipped with dining necessities, but only a microwave, toaster and coffee maker. (They used "MIghty Leaf Tea", which is one of my favorite tea that comes in bags). It was quiet (we were on the 23rd floor, right above the EL and it was only a dull noise in the city, I can imagine it would be loud if you were lower down. I thought the bed and bedding was lovely but my husband said it was too soft. And it really is a stupid sink in the bathroom, even though it looks cool. My husband enjoyed the robe, and there were lots of towels and more than the usual amenities. Very limited cable on TV, in my opinion. No Bravo, no HI, no lots of things. No rentable videos on TV. DIdn't mess with mini-bar when we finally found it in the bedroom. Weird. Young staff, very friendly. We called for an extra blanket and got it in less than 5 minutes. I swear. Pricey valet parking..but for Chicago, not too bad. Both my husband and I were bothered by panhandlers when we stepped for a smoke. I truly try to be sympathetic, but it really got annoying after awhile. Four people one time and 3 the next. We had breakfast at State and Lake. Meh. I ordered the Irish Cut Oatmeal. It was NOT good. I sent it back after I tasted it. The waiter hadn't even left our table yet. We were charged for it. Our B&B was an extra $98.00, Our tab at breakfast came to $30.00 (plus tip). So they made well over $60.00 on that deal. How stupid was that. Also, that was for a bagel, some bacon, tea, coffee, a "sunrise quesadilla" with beans and potatoes for $30.00. Oh yes, and oatmeal. Valet parking attendants were nice and efficient. So was all the staff. The cookies were a nice touch (and they were good). All in all. I liked the hotel, but would not spend the money again. I would, if it wasn't for the complete rip-off of the breakfast part. DO NOT BOOK THAT PACKAGE. It is cheaper to stay over night and eat there in the morning. Also, the little card they gave me for the breakfast part said we could only spend up to $20.00 a person, so it's not like we could have gone and drank ourselves silly on Bloody Marys or something. Not that we would. I would definitely go back if not for that. Don't get me wrong. It is cute, trendy (but cheap trendy, I think) and we had a lovely night, but that breakfast thing left me with a bad taste in my mouth,,,literally and figuratively. I forgot one thing. When I read my bill, it didn't come up to as much as was charged from my account (or is pending). I called them and they said they always charge $50.00 for incidentals and that the amount set to go through would be adjusted. I guess I have to wait and see. It isn't a $50.00 difference,,,it's more. I will wait and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: momof4inEauClaire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a family trip with 3 teenagers and a 7 year old. They arranged adjoining rooms and allowed an early check-in. Front desk was welcoming, enthusiastic, and energetic. I called for an extra blanket and within 5 minutes it was there, still warm from the dryer (comfy!) Housekeeping came late at night to change the entire bedding when one of my kids got sick and were very pleasant and sympathetic. Concierge very approachable and helpful with just general information. Every phone call to the desk, etc. was answered politely and pleasantly. Liked: Great location -- walked to theater, jazz club, restaurants easily Staff act like they enjoy their jobs Excellent service from housekeeping, concierge, front desk Exceptionally clean rooms Fitness area very attractive and nice Disliked: Having to pay for valet parking ($46 per night--ouch) even though it's common in downtown Chicago No free internet (again, common but ridiculous when cheap motel chains offer it free)

Reviews.Title: “Bryan and Carlos (night auditors) were terrific....very customer focused.”
Reviews.Author: Nelle9
Reviews.Content: After a long day, I needed to check in. Carlos quickly handled everything. I also needed help with printing materials for a client. Bryan cheerfully handled it for me, double-checking that I had exactly what I needed. I appreciate their help! Nelle, February 23, 2011

Reviews.Title: “Nice Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: MichellePs
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay was great. The rooms are nice and clean, staff is friendly, the breakfast at State and Lake was really good! My only complaint is that our bathroom was always cold!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: TropicalParadiseGOOO
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at this hotel we didn't even need to leave. We tried all the restaurants & absolutely LOVED the roof top. We got really lucky & it was a beautiful night when we went. The gym is nice & the hotel staff were very personable & provided us with great customer service. We travel a lot & my girls still say this was their favorite place. A definite must!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Place for Fun and Rest”
Reviews.Author: EVGlassing
Reviews.Content: My sisters, mom and myself just spent a beautiful weekend at theWit in Chicago and it was positively the best experience I have ever had with a Hotel. The staff is exceptional - from the front desk to the valet to bellhops to the restaurant server - across the board the best hospitality service I have ever come across. Not only were the kind and effecient, but they were truly Nice! and friendly and went out of their way to provide a one-of-a-kind experience. The food is also excellent - we ate a delicious breakfast downstairs in State and Lake, and had an incredible Italian meal in the upstairs restaurant (I heard the Chef had just one some prestigious award for his culinary skills - and it was definitely self-evident!) Thank you Wit for a memorable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to finish: Service, accommodations, food, friendliness”
Reviews.Author: MaryMErangey
Reviews.Content: My sisters, mom and I were all wowed by theWit. It has the friendly, personal air and metropolitan classiness of the best in boutique hotels. Great downtown location, too. Our suite and adjoining room were gorgeously appointed with a sophisticated and welcoming flair. The staff, from valets and desk staff to concierge and restaurant servers were all genuinely friendly and helpful in every regard. Our late night dinner at Cibo Matto was one of the best dining experiences I've had in a long while: the food was excellent, the service even better (knowledgeable, friendly and fun), and the surroundings were both comfortable and very chic. We loved the complimentary cotton candy that came with our check! The Roof lounge is a trendy spot; on weekend nights it's crowded and not easy to get in and find a table, but during the day it's a nice place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel On Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: Foonalicious
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two nights here and we wished we had stayed more. This was the best value hotel we had all trip. From the warm cookie's on arrival, which were needed given the freezing temperature outside. We stayed in a King Spa Suite and it was great value. The room was huge, modern, comfortable and had an amazing view in three directions from Millennium Park, State St and the river. The service we had was spot on as we had to call maintenance once and they were there is a minute. Also we would highly recommend the restaurant given the fact we were provided with a free bottle of wine for each room we had, and given we had four of us was a great night for the family. The food was amazing and though more expensive than most food places it is definitely worth it. Also the rooftop bar is a great place for a quick drink before dinner. The hotel is also really close to everything in central Chicago from shopping, sight seeing, theatres and eating. This is the place to stay and hopefully they stay at the same price as they were in December as it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! If you want something special, this is the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: judiebell
Reviews.Content: Everything about theWit is awesome. The service is INCREDIBLE. They are generous with everything from kindness to portions in the restaurants. No nickle and diming here. We had a fancy suite and it was worth every dollar. The floor to ceiling windows were perfect for viewing the snowy night. It's a hip place to be. The decor, the guests...I felt like theWit is an incredible insiders secret that I discovered. For a special night, don't go anywhere else. Jessica, at the front desk, with her professionalism and killer smile, not to mention the fresh, warm cookies was a great way to start the experience. Followed by Joel, the bellman, who knew our names and that it was our birthdays, before we even met. And the Ruf Club, Gia and Ronnie took great care of us and treated us very kindly even when we didn't feel quite like we fit at such a cool, hot club. We loved it all and can't wait to do it again. You can stay anywhere, but if you want to feel like you're staying somewhere special, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: kmc1969
Reviews.Content: Everything was just exquisite. Our room was amazing and we were able to upgrade it which made everything more wonderful. We were able to walk to our destination.... The Chicago Theatre.... and return for evening cocktails. This was our first stay in a Doubletree/Hilton hotel. We have visited 45 states and this was the best stay in any hotel ever. I can't express in words how much we loved our visit to theWit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, questionable service”
Reviews.Author: katbraves
Reviews.Content: This Saturday I checked in with a friend to the Wit Chicago. First impression is great because of the convinient location of the hotel, the overall image it portrays and the fact that this was a great way to start off a weekend of exploring Chicago. The front desk staff that checked us in was helpful and friendly. We went to the Roof before going to the room and dropping our belongings. The 27th floor had a great view, was obviously quiet since it was lunch and the staff again was friendly. From there, we just dropped things off and went out sight-seeing. We came back around 6:30 pm to rest and get ready for the evening. We put on the T.V. and an hour later got a noise complaint. This was surprising because nor was there any disturbing noises nor was the T.V. on too loud. This was in a "connecting" room. The beds, the bathroom and the overall ambiance of the room was great. Around 10:30 we went to the Roof. Obviously the party had started, people seemed in a good mood and the music was good. We ordered drinks from Johnny the bartender who was very upbeat and attentive. Security was nice but seemed to be all over the place. We met Jim Meyers who was a pleasure to talk to and very insightful. Javier, one of the food runners, was beyond hospitable and extremely friendly to us which is very much appreciated. When the evening ended, we went back to the room. Obviously, being late, we were careful not to make noise or talk loud. However, about 10 mins after going back to the room and started to get ready for bed, we got banging on the door from the room next to us. Then 15 mins later, we got a phone call from a rather rude male employee telling us to keep it down and that if necessary, they would come and kick us out of our room in the middle of the night. This to me was very unprofessional and plain rude. I have paid for my room like all the other guests, and expect to be able to talk in it, the whole night if I want to. Nor was there any T.V noise, no banging or screaming, so I do not understand what the problem was (because that's exactly how the gentleman on the phone made it sound like, a big problem). If there are people who need complete silence, then you should not check them in this type of "connected" room. I do not think this was a pleasnt thing to be told in the middle of the night and to have to feel threatened that I might be thrown out and left on the street. The gentleman on the phone made it very clear that we basically needed to shut up completely. Again, I do not recall having read any rules about talking in your own unit. This for me was the downfall to the whole day and night of fun we had. Very unprofessional and not appreciated at all. Check out was at 12 and they started banging on our door at 11:15 am. Again, this was very pressuring and made us feel unwelcomed and rushed to leave. We wanted to have breakfast at the hotel, but all of this pressuring lead us to just want to leave. Downstairs, checking out at the front desk, I asked for a comment card. The woman at the front desk seemed to be disturbed and annoyed by the fact that I needed assistance. Once again we felt were were being pressured to leave. I asked if I needed to sign something or if any other procedure was necessary and her response was "No, you just leave now." After we asked for the comment card, she never inquired if there was a problem, or what was nice about our stay, etc. which would have been a professional thing to do and a recovery for the hotel. Again, the beginning of the stay seemed to start off nicely, but then again, we spent only 5 mins in the hotel before going out to the city and therefore had no real contact with the staff and the service. I felt like the hotel got what they wanted from me and when they got it, they no longer cared about maintaining a good customer service. Point is, I will not come back here and I will not recommed the hotel to anyone of my friends or family. It is a beautiful hotel and at a great location. However, for someone who wants to have a good overall experience that includes friendly staff members and good customer service, it is not the place to go. As a guest I want to feel appreciated and taken care of from start to end, not harassed in the middle of the night because the neighboring door has someone staying that can't sleep or has problems with me talking in my own room. It is the hotel's responsibility to make sure that both I and that person remain happy, not to call and harass me. Again, good location, bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luv it, Luv it....”
Reviews.Author: NoKaOi34
Reviews.Content: A great Christime time getaway for shopping and theatre. First time at the Wit and definitely not the last... Great staff, and great room... ( 2 room suite for 4 days) The rooftop bar is a must see and a trendy place to be seen. Close to shopping. Overall the best!! A Green hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ititravel
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at The Wit on their Witty Stay package. We had a great room and two tickets to the play, Wicked. Great seats for the play. Orchestra, Row L After booking the room online, I received a very friendly phone call from the hotel confirming which night we wanted to go to the play. Our tickets were available at the desk when we checked in as promised. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. From the front desk, to those walking around the hotel, and the bar wait staff. The room had a great view, was VERY clean and decorated very upscale. Great large, clean shower. HD TV (best I have ever seen in a hotel). Bed was comfortable. We stopped in the rooftop bar for a drink and hors d'oeuvres. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. A little pricey, but, the view is spectacular. Our room was on the 17th floor. We could hear the trains going by, but, it did not bother our sleep. I would think the trains would be a little louder if you were below the 10th floor. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: aaatraveler50
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 50th birthday at the Wit with friends and had a wonderful experience! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was super clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable. We were within walking distance to shopping and the theatre. I used the gym every morning and had a wonderful spa experience. The restaurants were outstanding and so was the lounge on the top floor. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Wit was outstanding for our daughter's wedding”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLinda
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for more and the staff was wonderful. Ceremony, photos, cocktails, and reception were all held onsite. ROOF is spectacular for drinks. The banquet food was absolutely wonderful. All of our guests loved their rooms, and one even insisted I come up to see how great it was! Would highly recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy yes, sophisticated no”
Reviews.Author: LastSamurai
Reviews.Content: Trendy but tacky, pretentious but crude and compared to other Chicago hotels a really bad deal. Other negative reviews have already mentioned the problems of the bathroom and the noise. I would add stained floors and sofas, the mismatched colors, and above all the awful sweet smelling aroma dispersion in the lobby which hits you already before you even enter. Definitely not for people with sensitive noses, not for savy and experienced international travellers, neither for the really sophisticated nor the down-to-earth and not for business. Which leaves the rather narrow demographic mix of its clientel, described in other critical reviews.

Reviews.Title: “We're off to see the Wizard!”
Reviews.Author: kreeves2
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Wicked theater ticket package. The tickets were great seats! (only 6 rows from the stage). The hotel room was very nice, clean and modern. The window view was not good, but we weren't in the room much. The staff was excellent. Joel, brought our luggage up to the room and explained the refrigerator, phone and went and got us some ice. (the refrigerator is stocked and if you take something out of it there there is a sensor that will charge it to your room). If you don't mean to purchase it, don't touch it. Joel was also the same person who took our luggage down when we were leaving. We were glad because he was so nice and fun! The front desk was also awesome! We had a drink on the 27th floor that is glassed in with fireplace (also can go outside when it is warm). Expensive drinks, but nice place. We would use this hotel again in the future. It is close to the theaters (the Cadalic Palace Theater only 4 blks). The blocks are short blocks. We walked to "House of Blue" for dinner and to listen to jazz. We walked to Macy's to shop (only two blocks). This hotel is only two block over from Michigan Ave. If we would have had more time we would have walked down Michigan Ave. and shopped more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBear
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and extremely helpful! In fact I went on my Honeymoon and they gave me a room upgrade PLUS on little sleep when I first got there they were cleaning my room and made my husband and me their priority. The beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a fabulous location. Great walking distance to restaurants, shopping, sites, plus a bus tour is right outside the door and it's right next to the L so you have great public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago: The Wit Hotel, Chicago, IL, EXCELLENT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBear
Reviews.Content: You are right down in the heart of Chicago, just off the Chicago River, within walking distance of Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave) and about 4 miles (at most) from Navy Pier. You are surrounded by culture, shopping, restaurants, and views. The hotel has it's own restaurants and even a night club on the top floor. The rooms are very Modern. One of the prettiest hotels I've stayed at in Chicago, and rooms aren't terribly expensive. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lydgee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wit over Christmas, and were very happy with the hotel, its services and staff. We had a Spa Suite on the 24th floor which was immaculately clean, had loads of space (important for a 5 night stay), felt warm and inviting, and had lovely city views. The decor was not my style, but I can appreciate the aesthetic they have gone for and think they did a nice job. The televisions were fabulous (2 huge flatscreens), although I do agree with a previous reviewer that it is a shame they don't have pay per view. We don't have a tv in our bedroom at home, and it is always a treat for us to wake up and watch a movie in a super comfy bed while staying at a hotel. The staff were fantastic - the lady (girl) at the check in counter was incredibly helpful and friendly, and we loved the heated cookies on arrival. The coupon for a free bottle of wine at Cibo Matto was also great, although we didn't use it during our stay. The concierge was wonderful on Christmas Eve in helping us find a good deep pan pizza joint - even going so far as to call all his favorites to make sure they were open given the date (as it turned out only one was open, and it was great). Even the service staff were exceptionally friendly, chatting to us in the lifts and overall making us feel very welcome. The hotel is in a fabulous location as it is right in the theatre district, while still easy walking distance (3 blocks) to Miracle Mile. We didn't use public transport on this occasion, but it was very near by. We used the spa (we each had a massage), which was lovely, but I have had nicer experiences elsewhere for comparable rates. We thought that the services of the spa were very limited - no steam room, sauna, spa etc - considering the pricing. The gym was amazing, although on this occasion we didn't use it. As far as cons go - yes, you can hear the El, but on the 24th floor it isn't loud enough to keep you awake or to wake you up. The basin in the bathroom sucks (poor design by Kohler), but I don't really think this is a deal breaker. On one occasion (out of at least 20) we smelt a somewhat chemical odor in the lifts (nothing in the lobby as noted by previous reviewers), but this is fine with me as I know that the housekeeping are doing a good job keeping the place clean. There were two things that could be improved upon - the mattress had roll-together and wasn't as comfortable as I had hoped, and there was no towel rail in the bathroom which meant we have to hang the towels over the bath or shower door to prevent them being changed every day. Becuase it was FREEZING we didn't get a chance to visit the roof top bar, but we will be back in May and look forward to checking it out then. We will definitely stay at The Wit during any future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & New!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyFoodieGuy
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my wife, the #1 priority for her in a hotel is cleanliness, & the Wit is THE cleanest hotel we have ever stayed at. It does help that the hotel is only about 1 year old. If you love new, ultra modern decor, then this hotel is defnly for you. We booked the Spa room & got a lovely SouthWest facing corner suite, with enormous windows. The bathroom was immaculate & the giant tub & windows in the bathroom were awesome. I do agree with the previous review that you can definitely hear the Lake St train at least from our 15th floor. We are not very light sleepers so it didn't bother us. Also, I agree that the valet does take quite a while to bring your car up. Nonetheless, overall we were extremely pleased with our choice of hotel & its great location...One other nicety about the hotel was the helpful front desk lady. We had originally booked 2 nites @ the Wit & planned to leave on New Year's eve. Upon arrival, we decided we also wanted to stay New Year's eve, but didnt' want to change rooms. Originally, our Spa room was fully booked for that night, but she was able to check during our stay & found a way for us to stay in our same room on New Year's eve.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with plenty to offer.”
Reviews.Author: Denise,Tas,2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with husband, 3 adult children and 2 partners. The hotel offered spacious rooms and excellent value for money especially when you consider how much you pay for a hotel in London. (which we did a couple of weeks ago) We had a drink in the bar on the 27th floor, great views. Last night we had a special family dinner in the excellent restaurant Cibomatto. When we checked in, we were given a complimentary bottle of wine voucher if dining in the restaurant. We used it and got 3 bottles of wine. Excellent offer. The food was stunning and service equally so. This hotel is a short taxi ride from Union Station and not far from Millenium Park. Chicago is a beautiful city and I look forward to returning during the warmer season so I can take advantage of the architectural boat tours which unfortunately don't operate at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Indtraveler44
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Witt for some shopping and meeting friends. We took the train from Indiana, the hotel is about a five minute walk from the station. The location of the hotel is a plus for shopping it is within walking distance to Water Tower Place and Macy's. The hotel is very nicely decorated, the rooms seemed to be a little small but very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at the Witt and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Chicago Getaway”
Reviews.Author: amtrak58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at theWit the Sunday before Christmas to enjoy downtown Chicago before the holiday and finish up some shopping. The location is pretty central to everything... Michigan Ave, Millennium Park, Marshall Field's (I know it's now Macy's but wish it wasn't) on State St., theater district, etc. The corner room was a little narrow between the bed and the dresser / desk, but it was comfortable, quiet and had a nice view of the Chicago River. They have a terrific bar on the top of the hotel with outdoor decks that would be great in warm weather, and good fitness center. Had breakfast in the restaurant off of the lobby - great service and good food! The only downside is the hotel does not have a lot of room out front to handle cars. We have already recommend theWit to several friends, and will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Price”
Reviews.Author: lostinmadrid28
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal online, so my husband and I spent the night at theWit this week. It's ok overall...the location is fantastic, especially if you're looking to be centrally located. The modern feel of the hotel is cute. They pump in bird/cricket sounds in the hallways - odd but interesting! The hotel itself is pretty small and, unfortunately, this carried over to the room as well. I booked their most basic room and found it to be comfortable but very very small. I definitely wouldn't stay in this type of room with more than two people. The bathroom door is very strange and doesn't really open and close; it slides from left to right, leaving an open, gaping gap. Hopefully you are comfortable with your travel companion because some things are not left to the imagination! For the price (we paid under $100/night), I might stay there again. Luckily, we only stayed one night or it would have started to feel a little cramped! As much as people seem to highly rate this place, I expected more than a basic hotel room hiding behind a snazzy color scheme.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps my favorite of all time!”
Reviews.Author: fondej
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an outstanding location! I was upgraded to a King spaSuite as a Hilton Honors member. When I arrived to my room I was taken a back by the fabulous view. To the far left, I could see lake Michigan, straight ahead I looked at the iconic Chicago sign and State and Lake and to the extreme right of the room was a peak at the Chicago River. The location is perfect with all of the action of State street, Michigan avenue and Milleniuim park all withing easy walkng distance. The hotel itself was great too. My room was very modern but comfortable. Colors were bold and the design was very pleasant and interesting. Staff were very accomodating and friendly. I will return for sure the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location!! Attentive service.”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: For Business, the hotel worked well. Location worked for my appointments. Handy for State street. Yes if you leave the window open, I could here the "L' announcements on the 12th floor. Nicely appointed rooms. They actually have HD programming for the Large TV's. So many are still pumping analog on HDTV and end you up watching short and stretched pictures with no option to change the aspect as they lock the menu's for your protection. I had plenty of Hot water on demand , not easy for a larger hotels on sub zero days. Restaurant - breakfast was borderline. Room service burger was good, the fries were dark brown and soggy. they corrected the situation immediately . Easy use of the Red Line.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Wit”
Reviews.Author: mastertravel_10
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have traveled to Chicago a lot. Mostly for business and this time was for Leisure. Wanted a place close to the L so my Husband and I wouldn't have to lug suitcases around. The Wit is right off the orange line.. so convenient. It is also close to shopping and restaurant. The Service there is top notch!!! so nice!!! Thanks had a great trip

Reviews.Title: “READ THIS BEFORE STAYING HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Firekick
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what the others are writing about with such glowing reviews. This was not my experience at all. I am a well traveled person who has stayed at hotels all around the world. The following was my experience of "The Wit Hotel" Train ran all night creating constant PA system announcements and the train noise heard in the room. Neighbors yelled at football game well into the night, call to front desk had them warned but the apparently thin walls were not much help. They also were trying to get into our room through the shared door at 3AM. $47/night car parking ($30 around the corner if parking yourself) BUT...On 3rd night I reset cars hour meter because of something that happened on 2nd night, valet parking took my car asking if I were finished with it for the night (weird question) Next morning I called and went to lobby. Car was there and already warm despite it being 12 degrees outside. Got in, car seat was way back and changed in height, mirrors were changed, XM radio AND FM radio both changed to different channels..okay I thought, maybe he adjusted it to park it but then my wife climbed in and was shocked to find HER seat changed too!!! I then looked at hour meter (which very few cars have) and noticed it had 1 hour 36 minutes tagged onto the car since I used it!~ I called the manager, was put in voice mail. left msg. every time I called back I was forwarded to voice mail. No return reply! CHECK YOUR BILL. When I checked out, the bill was way off! the 35 minute wait for my car on the second day of my stay was said to be on the house because of the wait. I was told "I will remove the charge and it will be "comped off", I'm sorry your car wasn't ready, we really have no excuse for that" but no explanation of why it took that long to get my car (I wish I would of reset the hour meter on that day too!)The charge was not removed. They also charged me for use of a dvd media thing that is in the room which was broke and didn't work to play our DVD despite maintenances best efforts to get it to work. To give them credit, they did not argue any about removal of charge, but I shouldn't of had to "discover" and dispute anything that was told to me was already removed. Kids found skittles, M&M's along with a pill of some sort under the bed, just imagine if some younger child had found it and munched down! The bathroom is a travesty of design! No exhaust fan,a sliding door that people see thru coming in entry door! Sheets not changed just remade whole time there. read tips section TIPS: Don't drink the bottled water unless you like overpaying. Dont pick up anything from the bar under the TV or you will be charged for it even if you dont open it. If you have kids, they will want to look at the bottles and things and will get you quite a tab built up quickly. Dont plan to share a room with someone you are not intimate with as the sliding door to the bathroom, which does not seal, can be seen through the side and anyone walking into the room and looking at the bathroom will be able to see you sitting on your throne in royal glory! They will also be able to smell you as there is no exhaust fan to turn on. If you want fresh sheets, ask for them otherwise they just make your bed with the same sheets. (I tested this). dont hang towels up or they wont change them out nor give you fresh ones, it seemed that we had to leave them in a pile on the floor to get new ones. I asked the spiky haired young man who brought our bags up how much he usually gets tipped, he told me $100 was normal for him. I told him he was about to be disappointed. Front desk was very helpful and bent over backwards to help quickly and efficiently. Bar upstairs was very intimate so it can get crowded fast, if you want to spend time there, get there early. I was not impressed by the decor, it was brown...and more brown. not plush or anything and not imaginative at all so I dont understand why so many call it "trendy". The smells in the elevators at night were gross! " kids described it as "poopy smelling" and I had to agree. The elevators were fast and efficient however and I was glad for them. The sink is mismatched with the faucet and if you wash your hands you cannot rinse them without getting water behind the sink and soaking anything you put on the counter there, even if you try to be careful. Its just not deep enough to allow rinsing properly without doing so from the stream of water that shoots out at the angle it does. Expect to have to pay somewhere around 15 dollars for use of internet ( Come on Wit, at those prices, its time to free up what everyone else already has) I expected a lot from a hotel with this star rating and reviews. I would not recommend this to anyone except a single person traveling who can sleep through a lot of noise. They fell really short on this because of simple things and crooked valets to boot. I am just being honest with this review and not trying to back stab The Wit for the gain of another hotel or business. I wish it had been a different stay! If I can add photos later I will, but don't have them on the computer yet.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy new hotel”
Reviews.Author: business_travel81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very trendy and the decor was great. Being a new hotel it was very nice but the room had a sticky substance on the desk. Also, the bathroom had some hair on the floor. I understand things get missed but what got me the most is that when I informed the front desk they simply apologized and told me they were soldout. I would expect that service at a lower chain, cheaper hotel but didn't expect it at a Hilton product.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Room I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: flyntasticmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went into the city for a friends anniversary party. With my husbands work travel we have diamond status with Hilton Hotels. We normally stay at an Embassy Suites or Palmer House but decided to try The Witt. We got upgraded to a suite, had a room with a east, south, and west view. Yes, this sucker was the huge, room 2301! This room was so posh we should have had the party in the room! It had a living room with a flat screen, full kitchen with island, table for 4, two full baths- one with a deep 2 person tub, a beautiful large bedroom with 2 closets. All with a modern funky decor. They also gave us a voucher for breakfast, which was so delicious, you gotta try their bloody mary bar. We had priority access to the club on top which was hoppin' but a bit to noisy for us after a night at "Howl at the Moon".....another fantastic Chicago hot spot. I don't know what this room costs ( we got it for free) but it was a kick!

Reviews.Title: “Six Nights of Beauty and Bliss”
Reviews.Author: KyanPepper
Reviews.Content: I'll be checking out this morning after a six night stay and am leaving with a smile on my face. This hotel has a very "W" feel to it, one of my favorite hotel brands. The styling from the exterior of the building to the lobby to the well appointed rooms is clever and chic. As someone who works in the hospitality industry myself, I can tell you that finding a staff as attentive, friendly and genuine as theWit's is very rare - from the bellmen to the restaurant staff to the housekeepers and of course the front desk staff (Ann was great!). The location is perfect, with the State/Lake stop of the L directly beside of the hotel and everything downtown within a few minutes walk. The views from the rooftop are wonderful; definitely check it out if you're here (or even if you're not staying here). My only negative experiences are pretty minimal but I did have some issues on my final day with my heating controls getting out of whack (although guests services was very quick to offer help when I needed it).... and I ordered room service once and didn't find it up to par with the rest of the hotel. Also, the doors could really use some sound-proofing! I could hear everything that went on in the hallway, especially the housekeeping staff in the mornings (if you're like me and sleep in until 10am, this could be an issue). Other than these bits, it's a wonderful hotel and I will definitely stay here again when I come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place.”
Reviews.Author: 73Stingray
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed rooms, great staff, superb location. I booked this hotel online and got me a great deal, it has a very trendy, upscale feel and really on the pricey end if you do not get you a deal. Valet is $46 a night, and overnight parking around is in that range (paid $30 in a lot around the corner), if you do not need a car it is even better, the "Lake" station on the Red Line is right next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. I can't think of any way to improve this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HHSteve
Reviews.Content: Of the dozens of hotels I stay in each year, this is one of the nicest ever. We highly recommend it. Our twenty-fifth floor suite has an incredible view, is very spacious, and is magnificently appointed. The hotelâ€™s location, staff, atmosphere, are perfect for whatever type of business or pleasure you are in Chicago for. The suite has a very comfortable king bed, pull out couch, three large closets, two 46 inch flat screen televisions with connections to attach any type of digital device via a multitude of protocols. The kitchen is spacious and functional. The bathroom is larger than some guestrooms in some hotels that Iâ€™ve stayed in, and has both a very large shower and a giant, two person, tub. There is plenty of furniture in the room and itâ€™s all very stylish and comfortable. The desk, breakfast table, chairs and couches were all very functional and attractive. In addition two three large closets there was plenty of other storage space in dressers and cabinets. There is adequate storage and amenities to make this room appropriate for a very long term stay. The hotel is located at State and Lake, just a few blocks from all of Chicagoâ€™s attractions. In some ways it is an attraction to itself. The Roof Bar an its top floor is popular enough that the hotel has a policy of providing priority entry to lodging guests. There is no pool, but instead a very nice gym, yoga studio, and spa. We ate breakfast at â€œState Lakeâ€� which is one of three restaurants in the hotel. It was very good. The wireless internet is very fast. Hilton Diamond members get it for free, but if you have to pay, it is about $15 per night. I canâ€™t think of a single bad thing about this hotel. It is brand new, cutting edge, and trying very hard to please their guests. The employees are as great as the building and room. Housekeeping, concierge, front desk, dining, and all the random employees we bumped into throughout our stay were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A great shopping and farewell trip with UChicago daughter”
Reviews.Author: 81ucla
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at theWit hotel in Chicago to shop and get my daughter settled into her freshman suite at the University of Chicago. The hotel is centrally located close to great shopping and eating but the hotel itself is such a nice, comfortable, modern facility that I will definitely stay there again. It appears to be a very happening kind of place if you are into that kind of thing, the rooftop bar/restaraunt is great (we stayed clear of it on the weekend, all the hipsters seemed to be there!) Quiet and hip all rolled into one - our housekeeper Amalia was fabulous, our room was impeccable every day and the accomodations themselves were great - love the beds, slept really well (shopping was great - tiring but great.) Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel-highly recommend a visit!”
Reviews.Author: northernlights40
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The service was excellent and the rooms were spotless. I travel frequently for business so am super picky and felt this was a great boutique hotel. In fact, I can't remember the last time I stayed at hotel that I felt immediately as good about. Nice touches include: personalized letter at check in from the Manager, great overall service, the sound of the chirping birds in the hallway (really!) and it switches at nighttime to evening nature sounds. Small criticisms...parking is expensive, no store in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: drinktomeonly
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler for both business and leisure. To give frame of reference, my favorite hotels are The Library in NYC, and Hotel Royal in Gothenburg, Sweden. I favor luxury boutique hotels. I live very near Chicago, and get to the city frequently. I was looking forward to trying TheWit based on the fantastic reviews. After having done so...I'm a little perplexed. I just don't get the raves. The lobby really DOES have an awfully weird scent being pumped in or sprayed...it's migraine inducing, truthfully. There are some cool accents as far as decor, but I just don't get how this place wound up on any list of trendiest hotels. I didn't see anything particularly trendy. Staff was huddled in a group chatting behind the front desk until we actually walked over and made them aware that we were there. That's a pet peeve of mind. Concierge was not very knowledgeable, and seemed bored and disengaged. Our room, with two queen beds, was on the 16th floor and had nice views. It was also SPOTLESSLY clean, and I had checked to make sure in advance that this hotel was NOT listed on the dreaded b.bug report. Our room was completely clean. Linens were spotless. Beds were really cozy, no complaints about that at ALL. 1. touch screen Phone system in our room didn't work properly...touch screen only worked part of the time. Had to cover it with a towel at night because the screen lit up the room. 2. no movies on demand. At all. Zip. Zero. 3. 400.00 a night for this room with breakfast included. Lack of amenities for that price and location...amenities found elsewhere. I know that I'm used to the best of the best, but they could at least throw in a bottle of water gratis. I just did not see any reason to spend this much for a "Meh" experience. 4. EXPENSIVE INTERNET. At 400.00 a night? Please. I have high standards, but hey, after reading the reviews, I HAD high expectations for this hotel. Staff just seemed inexperienced, everything was just very average. I was not blown away with any aspect of this facility. Based on the price vs. value received, I'd have to recommend other Chicago hotels over this one. I could have paid only very slightly more and stayed at any of the luxury hotels, or paid much less and gotten the same or better service and experience at a mid-priced boutique.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, be careful of room choice”
Reviews.Author: familyfromthemidwest
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location and is truly beautiful. The restaurants are very good and the service is impeccable - we ate in two of them and the service staff was among the best I've experienced. The room was large, clean and very nice. The hotel feels very modern and trendy. There is nothing negative to say about anything in the hotel. BUT, our room was very high in the hotel and on the side where the El comes in and out all night long. It was too loud to sleep. On top of that, the heating/cooling system did not seem to have a function to allow the fan to run all night creating white noise. Despite the wonderful trappings, I had the worst night's sleep I've had in a while. They need some ability to make white noise and you should try to get a room that is not right above the EL (even though we were on a floor in the teens).

Reviews.Title: “Fun, trendy hotel in great Chicago location.”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wit for a business conference and really enjoyed the hotel. The staff in particular were very helpful and friendly. Of course the warm chocolate chip cookie at check in on a blustery day helped set the right tone at the start. It is hard to beat the downtown location, with everything within close walking proximity. The hotel is welcoming and a good size. Not a mamouth convention style hotel so it felt more comfortable. The room was very clean and modern, with perhaps the bathroom sink more designed for style over function. If you have time, be sure to check out the roof top lounge and restaurant. Terrific spot and with the open fire pits it is even comfortable outside. One note of caution, the CTA runs literaly right beside the hotel and while convenient to get around can be a little noisy. Ask for a room away from the line and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! wonderful fun hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamarasmh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far one of our favorites in Chicago. Then again how couldn't it be...every time you walk in the door they offer you hot cookies! It is fun, hip and luxurious without any pretense. The view from the rooftop bar is wonderful! Plus it's location right on state street is amazing! Don't think twice...stay there!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah144
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wit Hotel for two nights. I thought the room looked nice. It had great views. There was a fun crowd at the hotel. The only thing I did not like was they charged too many fees. The manager was nice. The people at the front desk were nice. Don't go to The Roof at night unless you like really loud music. There was too much go through for the hotel guests to go to The Roof also. I would stay here again because I like the location and the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed luxury room, great location”
Reviews.Author: MidwestPhotog
Reviews.Content: Even though it's been a few months, I keep thinking about this hotel. In terms of design and decorating, corner room at the Wit is the most fab place I've ever stayed. I'm talking about contemporary style design/decor that is tasteful from ceiling to floor and wraps around you with subtle details in a way that makes you feel abundance and comfort. I'm talking about heavy chrome handles and knobs and faucet that scream "quality" the moment you walk into the room; I'm talking about walls and doors that are heavy enough to create a quiet sanctuary feel. Amazing built-ins in the closet that are functional--wish I had them in my own home, omg. Dark smooth wood, chrome, stone tile, tactile fabrics and upholstery, pops of color, oh my. I'd never go back to Miracle Mile to stay (mostly tourists in white sneakers and convention goers which is fine if that's your scene). State St is cool location to get a feel of real Chicago and so close to Millennium Park. One caveat! Watch your credit card bill tho! They billed me for that infamous $4 bottle of water that I did not drink. Out of principle, I continued to pursue this until they finally removed it. Apparently, I'm not the first. Hotel management really has to get this under control. Also, the rooftop bar is over hyped. It is much smaller than portrayed, very loud, very crowded. For this reason and the H20, the Wit loses a point in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Underwhelmed by the Service”
Reviews.Author: imarj
Reviews.Content: I had booked a one night stay in the two room King Spa suite at this hotel as a birthday surprise. We also invited a few friends to join us for drinks and dessert in the room that evening as part of the celebration. Service: Because it was a special event, I had specially ordered dessert from an out of town bakery for the evening, and had it delivered via mail to the hotel. I called ahead to the hotel to let them know this was a special occasion and made sure it was possible to receive my package this way; I was promised the package would be accepted since I would not arrive until 4pm at check in. Unfortunately, my package was never accepted and my dessert never came. According to the tracking number, they had attempted to deliver it. I spoke with multiple people at the front desk to no avail. Offered no alternative suggestions for dessert, finally, in house dining called and offered a very mini cupcake display (at a premium of $33).
