I had no choice but to take it or go without any dessert. Cleanliness: The room was nice and clean, but the windows were hazy from fingerprints. Not entirely what I expected to see out of a $389/night room. Spa quality: There was a big tub and comfortable robes. You have to pay for anything additional. Value: With all the chaos of dessert, we ended up putting down over $500 on the one night. This included the two room suite, overnight parking, the replacement dessert, and a spa item (bath soap?). While we really did have fun in the suite and at the hotel, it was definitely a bit pricey. I think my overall experience was tainted because of my missing dessert with no consolation. Maybe it will work out better for you.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: I have always had good service at this hotel, but this stay was exceptional. I brought my mom down for a birthday celebration. We were able to check in to one room at 10 am and the other by 3 pm. We were surprised with a corner room, which was a little larger than a normal king room. It was really clean & had INCREDIBLE views of both Millenium park and the lake beyond. It even had a window in the bathroom! The room was on the 15th floor on the Lake St. side of the hotel. I did not hear traffic noise nor noise from the el train. Even my parents (in their 60's) were impressed by the rooftop bar. Service was always prompt and friendly and the drinks were good. The concierge was very good about a lunch & dinner reservation and printed out a few different restaurant menus for us. Also, we had coffee brought up to the room by room service. It was delivered promptly, with the requested 5 cups & five glasses of ice water. After staying here a few times, I am still impressed with the rooms and service. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great room, great bar”
Reviews.Author: rachel16
Reviews.Content: We loved The Wit. It was hip, but not too hip to feel snobby. The room was great. I was a little disappointed in the bathroom, not in itself but that it didn't have a bathtub... but that was my fault for booking a standard room. The rooftop bar was fun and it was a beautiful day, unfortunately there was a wedding reception going on when we tried to go back. But, what are you gonna do? It would be great place to have a reception! I would definitely go back, but upgrade to a spa room!

Reviews.Title: “Very hip;eclectric..food and service just ok”
Reviews.Author: poppyseed15
Reviews.Content: the food and room service was not very good, go somewhere else to eat.. the service at Breakfast was extremely slow on a Sat. morning. .Also very loud obnoxious music playing early in the morning. There was a strange chemical smell in our room upon arriving. Housekeeping checked it, couldn't come up with a solution and told us to open a window. i actually liked being able to open a window in my room, you seldom can any more. Thought it would be very loud next to the train and having the #1 night club there but it wasn't. We were on the 26th floor. Not a serene, quiet hotel, it's very hip and good for the younger crowd. But my teenager,16, said she really didn't want to stay there again.I liked the location and even the birds chirping in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel supported by friendly/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Serberus9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Chicago where we stayed at the Wit Hotel and I have to say it was a fantastic experience. What a sight to be greeted to the city by the iconic Chicago sign of the Chicago theater, which sits right next door to the Wit. Our taxi we took from Midway (approx $31) was promptly greeted at the street by helpful staff who assisted my wife out of the taxi and help us with our bags inside. The lobby was very chic, but didn't come off pretentious. The girls at the desk were extremely friendly and got us checked in quickly. They quickly explained some basics of the hotel amenities and informed us that though the roof bar was open to the public and had become a very popular night spot, as guests of the hotel we were entitled to immediate entry (the line for the elevator to the club was around the corner) and if we had any problems getting to the front, to just check at the front and they would escort us there. We asked them if a late checkout would be possible and the girl quickly answered "not a problem" and upped our time until 2pm. We left the lobby to go to our room and the well decorated hallway on our floor was filled with serene outdoor sounds. A nice juxtaposition when compared with the chaos of State street on the other side of the window. Our room was the basic King room but we were so excited with how modern, yet comfortable, the room was. Nice amount of space for a city hotel room and all the amenities were well placed so the room felt full of features but never cluttered. We enjoyed our room for a while and decided to go and check out the roof bar. We got up there around 10pm and it was definitely a popular place. There was plenty of room to walk around, but seating was obviously a scarce commodity. We decided to each have a drink and take in the ambiance before roaming the streets. Drink prices were about average (glass of wine + Jack and coke = $20) but the bartenders were friendly even with the daunting crowd. The hotel is located a block from the river and for non-city types, we never felt security was a big issue when walking around the immediate area. There are quite a few homeless people that roam these tourist areas, however, unlike experiences in other cities, we never felt anyone was overly aggressive when asking for a handout. Though you can't help everyone, the ones you do seem thankful and the ones you don't never made a big deal out of it. We returned to the hotel around 1am and there was still a huge line in the lobby to get up to the roof bar. They rope off a single elevator for that line and hotel guests have the other three to use (need your room key to get elevator to work). We had a very comfortable sleep in our room and enjoyed the hotel throughout our stay and since we had a late check out we even got to enjoy some early morning shopping before heading out. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city. It was a great experience and I will definitely return as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: DCinIndy
Reviews.Content: We just returned 10/11/10 from a 3-night stay at TheWit in Chicago. We were in the city to watch the Chicago Marathon. It was a great location for the race - within walking distance to the host hotel and the start/finish lines. The room was clean, the bed was very nice, and the food at the State & Lake was good with reasonable prices considering it's a 4-star hotel. Check-in was smooth except pulling up in the car to exit with the bags was frustrating since there's no designated area for arrivals. The bellman was helpful and once inside, I forgot about the hassle. The maid service was good but housekeeping usually occurred late in the day. The hotel arranged dinner reservations for us at 6pm on Saturday (sort of at the last minute) which was a blesssing. We ate at the Rosebud Trattoria on N. Dearborn St. The food was excellent but the place was noisy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: shelly871
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theWit over the weekend to celebrate my husband's 40th and our anniversary. I emailed in advance and connected with Hayli, one of the front office supervisors, who was very helpful in answering my questions about different rooms. We ended up a luxury spa one bedroom corner suite facing the river - Hayli made sure this room was saved for us. The view was amazing! The manager, Mark Shouger, sent complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room along with a hand written note. We ate breakfast at State and Lake and had great service both mornings. Our room was clean and housekeeping was generous with the towels when we asked for extra. I would definitely stay here again as would my husband, who travels frequently for business. Top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: This has become my favorite hotel in Chicago over my multiple stays. It is a very nice hotel that does not take itself too seriously, which is a great combination! The staff is all very friendly and welcoming, the rooms are decorated nicely and have everything you would need and more! Rates are expensive, but you get what you pay for. Roof, the bar up top, is still overpriced...I really have no reason to go there anymore. I tried it one more time and got an overpriced, under-alcoholed mojito with wilted mint and poor service...no thanks. Other than Roof, the hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 30th”
Reviews.Author: herbicide
Reviews.Content: From the first step we took out of our car till the very last step back into our car the Wit experience was fantastic....David Martell made sure our stay at The Wit was A+....It was our 30th Wedding Anniversary and we had a fantastic time on the Roof....we will tell our business associates and friends of our experience.... thank you Mr Herb Magda aka Herbicide

Reviews.Title: “The Wit - just not funny”
Reviews.Author: amckOxford
Reviews.Content: I looked up The Wit before I travelled as it had been booked for me by my company and first impressions were not good. Their website irritatingly puts "The" infront of everything (THE reservations, THE Contacts, THE photos...) and this wears thin very quickly. Arriving at the hotel, with loud music blaring at the door, I was immediately hit by an overpowering smell of air freshener in the lobby, the same kind as a car air freshener. Those things give me a blinding headache and make me feel sick. Not a great start. Upstairs the corridors have continous animal sounds (frogs, birds, cockerals...) and running water sounds 24 hours a day. Not amusing after the first half hour (you can hear it in your room). Also the hotel is right next to an elevated railway so you get train noise all night as well. I was also horrified to discover that internet is $15 per 24 hours, on top of Â£209 per night plus taxes for a room. Appalling. After a long day at work we arrived in the bar at 10.25pm for a nightcap. We were told that the bar was about to close by a very grumpy barman, Turns out the bar closes at 11pm, he just wanted to go early because he had to be up at 5.30am. How hospitable. On the plus side, the room was large and clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom facilites were good. However I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel, but not the best pick for young kids”
Reviews.Author: Clarkthehorse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theWit for two nights with two young children (ages 5 & 6). Pros: phenomenal staff -- everyone from the restaurant staff to the bellhops was very friendly and went out of their way to help. Great location -- quick walk to Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue. Very nice rooms, with great views of the park and State Street. Good on-site restaurants. Cons: the hotel had let the folks who were staying in our reserved suite extend their reservation into our time, thus kicking us out of the suite. They did offer us adjoining rooms on our 1st night and a suite upgrade on our 2nd. Very nice accommodations, but they did involve a room change, which was a bit of a hassle. The other con is not at all the hotel's fault, just a statement on who they are. This is a hip spot ideal for couples' getaways, mancations, and girls' getaways -- that definitely seemed like the population that was there at the same time as us. The downside of this, for us, was that our hallway was loud at night. There was a fair amount of traffic throughout our 1st night, and then the folks in the 2 rooms across from us returned from partying at 3:30 a.m. and camped out in the hallway, waking all of us up. I probably wouldn't have minded as much if I were off on a carefree weekend as well, but it was tough to have kids up in the middle of the night. In summary, very nice property with exceptional staff. If you're on an adults-only break, great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Care and Attention to Guest Safety”
Reviews.Author: Fordham70
Reviews.Content: I am writing to commend The Wit Hotel and the associates that are in its employ. I am certain that you read this quite often, that the hotel is special (it is) and is distinctive in its approach to making the guests feel at home (it does). There was an incident that occurred outside of the hotel that had nothing to do with the facility, but not surprisingly, its employees to a person interceded to assist us and make sure the bad taste of what occurred was eased out of our minds as quickly as possible. My wife, my associate and I were exiting a cab in front of The Wit. My wife and I got out and were chatting in outside the cab waiting for my colleague to exit. After an unusually longer time than usual for a fare to be paid, my wife and I both took a look inside the cab, and the alert staff did the same thing. The cabbie was abusing our colleague for a simple question she had asked concerning the meter. The cabbie jumped out of the cab and wanted to start a fight with her after the fare was paid! She is one of the gentlest, kindest people youâ€™d ever want to meet, and a genuine lady. The entire front door staff acted as one, including Matt Thompson, They put themselves in harms way, separating us from the cabbie, forcing him to leave, and made sure of our safety. Matt went out of his way not only to call the room later to check up on us â€“ he remembered me from my previous visits to Chicago â€“ but also later sent a beautiful note to the room with a lovely snack tray. It in, he apologized for the poor service of the taxi and wanted to make our evening more enjoyable. He also alertly called the Taxi Complaint Bureau to report the driver. Kudos to The Wit and her staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: trainerstone
Reviews.Content: The best part was the rooftop bar although the service was horrible every night we went. The view was spectacular. The drinks were fine- food delicious. The rooms were very comfortable. Love the bathroom toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: danalynch
Reviews.Content: We loved the Wit! Even though the pricing was , my husband and I decided to splurge on this vacation. We were glad we did! We both had colds the entire vacation, and we agreed that if you had to be sick on vacation, the Wit was the place to do it! The room was beautifully decorated. And the bed was so comfortable we considered trying to fit it into our suitcases! The room was kept immaculate, and when we needed anything it was there in minutes. The concierges and front desk staff were over the top friendly and helpful. It was seriously some of the best and friendliest service I've ever said. All of this said, the hotel is uber cool! It's a great location, too. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: tom6847
Reviews.Content: The Wit is a great choice in hotels! The location is perfect- the trains are literally right outside the door, and it is just one short block from the river, so we felt like we were in the middle of everything. It's an easy, fun walk to experience all of this city. Our corner room was beautiful and spacious, with spectacular views of Lake Michigan, Millenium Park, the river, the much of downtown. It was immaculate everyday. The concierge service knowledgeable and helpful, front desk, bellhops and everyone we encountered pleasant, smiling and always welcoming. the Roof was also incredible. We went up in the afternoon soon after we arrived and loved the experience - the view of the city is amazing. At night, a line formed outside of people waiting to get in. Clearly this is The Place to go for a trendy night out! However, as hotel guests, we were always welcome to go up. All in all, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “People Skills”
Reviews.Author: stixgrl101
Reviews.Content: I saw the pictures of this hotel and heard about the roof top bar. I was very excited to be able to stay there for a night after the wedding. I attempted to add another night to my stay, but the group rate was not available and the woman on the phone made that very clear, I understood that so i reserved a room for the normal price. Then i decided to cancel just one night where i would pay the original fee. Later when the reservation email was checked it said i would get the group rate both nights, but in a note it said that i would get the room for the original price. I was confused and called the wit. When he asked how my call should be directed I said Billing, when i finished tell my story to the woman from billing she told me that she did not know who connected me to her but she was not the person to talk to. She told me that with a very harsh tone and i did not appreciate it. As i told her to connect me to someone who could help she was saying "hello? hello?" and i said "hi?" and in a more nasty and harsh tone she said "I am trying to ask you a question here" I was so offended by this. Then she connected me to someone else and i told her my story and all i wanted to do was figure out why this difference of charges on the "bill" was showing up. I admit, I am 18 and i was handling this like an adult and anyone i talked to spoke to me like i was a child and didn't understand that I couldn't get the group rate. I understood that, all i wanted to know was why it showed up different. The woman i talked to said that since I cancel my stay for one of the nights i could not get the rate that showed on my bill. So that made me think. If i was to have kept my reservation, would I have been charged for the group rate both nights?? which is unfair to tell me I couldn't get it and then now i could. Another problem was my mom tried calling to talk to them about adding a night and they connected her to a manager so she could talk to her, but she had to leave a message. A second time she called about the differences in charge on the reservation confirmation and was connected to the same manager to speak with her, she had to leave another message. It has been a week and there has been no call back. I am not impressed at all by this, i am actually very upset that they did not have the courtesy to call her back. The only people i was impressed with were the bell hops, the cleaning ladies, and the maintenance men.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Guyana1234
Reviews.Content: HH Honors member heard about Roof hype and guest priority so decided to stay there rather than Allegro with colleagues. They told me this is a much better hotel. No way! NO priority for the Roof club for guests paying 350 a night..my key cards did not even work. Valet svc suck. I had wait 15 mins for car as they claim an altercation with a club guest tied up all their employees and had drunk lady folllow me to my room. so much for security. Not worth the price and poor services. last time I stay here or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HGILynchburg
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I visited Chicago for a week - this hotel has everything you could ever want or need, not to mention the fact that it is within a couple steps of Red, Orange & Brown Lines, all major bus route stops, and tons of restaurants/shopping. The rooms and public areas are spotless, beautiful, and the staff is phenomenal. They went above and beyond, made wonderful recommendations, and assisted our every need - they really made our trip extra special. I can't say enough nice things about this property, and will definitely make a point to stay there again. Thank you to theWit staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Wit”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over July 16-18. I should note that we were using his Hilton points and I don't know if we would have paid the full price otherwise. The lobby, hallways, and rooms were beautiful. We were given a corner room and there was a window in our bathroom with an absolutely spectacular view of downtown Chicago, overlooking south over the Chicago Theatre. The bed was comfortable although I will say that it was hard to sleep during an afternoon nap because were across from the laundry room. The location of the Wit cannot be beat - the El is ride outside the front door. Getting to and from Midway was a snap. Lots of restaurants and bars within a short walk away. Since we were using Hilton points, upon check-in we were given the option of free breakfast, internet, or Hilton points and we chose the free breakfast. We were given vouchers to use at the hotel restaurant, State & Lake. We only had breakfast one of the mornings but it was great! We also had lunch at the restaurant on one of the days, and it was very good and reasonably priced. Unfortunately, we did not make it up to the Roof (even though literally everyone we told we were staying at the Wit told us how beautiful it was). We were in town for a music festival and hadn't brought clothes nice enough to pass the dresscode. We're not fancy people but I really would have liked to see the view from up there. Oh well. Maybe next time. All in all, we were thrilled with our stay, but the best part was that it was free! We'd definitely go back if the price was right....but more likely, we'll wait for another Hilton promotion!

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ftron
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Member with the Hilton (I stay at the Hilton properties a lot..... in and outside the US), and I have to say that this is definitely one of the top places that I have stayed at. Magnificent views, great locations, and amazing rooms.... definitely recommend this place. If you can get a corner room, they are much better. If you stay there, check out the rooftop, it is very nice and perfect for a date.

Reviews.Title: “The Wit Hotel Chicago - Fun & trendy but bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: 113KD
Reviews.Content: I was at The Wit for a business conference and loved the location, food & room. However, the housekeeping was terrible. Every day I was missing random toiletries from my room (toilet paper, bath mat, coffee, etc.) When I called to have the items replaced, I didn't even get an apology. It's such an easy fix from a management perspective but no one seemed to care! It's unfortunate... However, I definitely recommend visiting The ROOF bar/club on the top floor...great ambience...def hot spot!

Reviews.Title: “First Class, Vegas Style Property in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ohioumpire
Reviews.Content: I've seen some negative reviews of this place and was tempted to change my reservations for a 3 night stay in Chicago. I considered the Westin, but as a Hilton die-hard, I let it ride and hoped for the best. This place is immaculate. I was upgraded to a corner spa room. It had a separate glass-enclosed shower and a deep soaking tub. Others had commented it was to "chic" for their taste, but I can't see how anyone would think that unless their accustomed to Motel 6. The multimedia was fantastic. The desk was connected to the entertainment center and they had connections which allowed you to hook up anything with S-Video and play it on the TV. The room was spacious, ultra-clean, and highly comfortable bed. People complained about the noise, and granted, you do get "some" street noise such as sirens, etc, but this is a downtown hotel, so in my opinion that is to be expected. The bottom line is I did not find the noise level to be distracting. Others complained about the birds, owls, soundtrack they play lightly in the hallways. I absolutely could not hear this at all from inside the room. It was very light and subtle even when in the hallways. The hallways were spotless. The lobby was busy, but I never had to wait much for anything. I arrived at 1pm, 2 hours before check-in time, and that was not an issue. They had a room available and it was the upgraded room as well. The loop train is literally on the same corner as the hotel. You can go from the lobby to the platform in probably 30 seconds (less if your're skinny and make it an issue to maximize time.) I only had breakfast at their restaurant, State and Main, but it was one of the best experiences in a DoubleTree I have ever had. You can tell it is operated by real chef's, not just a line cook. As a diamond member, I received breakfast coupons which was worth $17 at the restaurant. This more then easily covered breakfast. The room air-conditioning was perfect, the maids were extremely nice and proficient. Very close to anything you want to do. Had hot dogs at a number of places, deep dish at Lou Manati's (Geno's is fairly close - 20 min walk.) Harry Carry's is just 2 blocks away behind the Westin. If I come back to Chicago, this is easily the place I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be classy, but nickel and diming you”
Reviews.Author: Jothe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a pleasure trip to Chicago. We found the hotel appearance to be very hip and chic and upper class, but the little things throughout made it feel much less classy. These things have been noted by others, but the charge of $10/day for internet was harped on by my husband EVERY single time he turned on the laptop. If it had been baked into the room rate, I'm sure I would not have heard about it, but the fact that he had to agree to the charges when he logged on served to irritate him anew each time. Although the furnishings were very modern, the throw at the end of the bed was stained, The hair dryer was falling apart. The sink (as has been the topic of others' reviews) is, indeed, entirely impractical (imagine spitting a mouthful of toothpaste and then having to work to get the water to come 8-10" towards you (with a 1" lip on the edge of the sink) without getting splashed. Also, the shower controls force you to reach across the shower to turn it on, soaking you and getting water into the bathroom each time. The concierge staff could not have been less enthusiastic or helpful. Not even a decent map of the city or suggestions. And, we had significant hallway noise. Now, there is a definite "cool" factor and that made certain parts of the stay fun (piped in nature noises that changed from birds chirping and roosters crowing to crickets depending on the time of day/night). And, the location is right in The Loop and can't be beat. We flew into Midway and the orange line brought us, literally, to the door - so no need for a rental car, just a pass for the L and cabs if need be. Easy walk to the shows, Millenium Park, Chicago Art Institute, etc. Great views of the skyline. Do try for a higher level floor to avoid street/L noise. Roof bar is also phenomenal for people watching. It really is a shame that they don't have a pool (a real benefit for the summer time) and that there screening room doesn't show more movies to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotravelerkb
Reviews.Content: After reading others reviews of The Wit, I was really excited to stay here for our one year wedding anniversary. In the end, the hotel was fine, but I was not really wowed and left feeling a little disappointed with our experience. We stayed in a Riverview Spa Room. The room was nice, but I am not sure what exactly was "Spa" about it. There was a big tub, yes, but if you wanted any Spa amenities for the tub, such as bubbles, etc. you had to pay for them (starting at $25!). I called the morning of our stay to let the hotel know that this was our first anniversary and that it was a special stay. I spoke with the concierge who offered nothing special and only told me that I could buy a bottle of champagne for $35.00. While this seemed sort of lack luster, I went ahead of got the champagne asking that it please be set up in the room when we arrived as a nice surprise for my husband. He agreed and though I did not feel confident that this would happen, I had hoped that it would be a nice arrival for us. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by a very nice associate at the front desk. She checked us in promptly and we went up to our room with cookies in hand. When we got in the room, I noticed the nice decor, and that there was a really nice view...but something was missing. No champagne. Disappointed, I told my husband what I had planned and I decided to call downstairs to see what happened. When I told the concierge (a different person than I spoke to in the morning) she just said she would send it up. I told her that I wanted to cancel the bottle because the point was to be a surprise and something special. She said she'd take it off the bill and that was that. No offer of anything to make up for it, just that they'd take it off my bill. So we walked down to the wine shop down the street and bought our own bottle to toast with. As for the rest of the stay, I wouldn't say it was anything to rave about. It rained at night so we didn't really get to enjoy the roof top portion of the top floor bar. Later in the evening I approached the front desk to ask where we could get desert and the girl at the desk was texting on her phone, which I find a bit of a turn off. If you are going to use your phone, you should probably not be holding it up for everyone to see--especially when approached by a guest. She was nice but wasn't very knowledgeable about where we could go. She didn't have a menu for the rooftop bar but said we should have one in our room--which we didn't. Like I said, she was nice, but just not what I expect from hotel staff at an almost $300 a night hotel stay. We did have desert in the State and Lake restaurant and our waitress was very nice and that was a positive experience. I guess I would just say it was an overall average experience. Not terrible, but nothing great. Other than the decor I wouldn't really say it stands out as a place to stay. I don't think the room is worth the cost you pay for it and I think there are probably better hotels in the area with more experienced staff for the same cost. And I was very disappointed with the lack of care given to the fact that it was a special stay for our wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable, fun and clean hotel right in the mist of it all and we loved our stay. Staff is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: boca36908
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the hotel. The location was perfect. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. The hotel was so clean and down to every detail it was really unique. We loved the Roof top lounge and the Yoga studio/fitness center was really great. It was my husbands birthday and they even surprised us with champagne and chocolate coverered strawberries. We've stayed many times downtown and this is now our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: When entering the lobby area off of State St you're greeted by a modern tasteful lobby area with plenty of pumped in vanilly lavender scent. I agree with a previous reviewer that the scent is quite strong and could be dialed back just a bit. The lobby area is smaller but very tasteful. There is a bar and restaurant located just off the lobby area. I was assigned a room on the 9th floor. The elevators were spotless and quick. A valid keycard was required for guest room floor access. The hallways were very nice. Brand new stylish carpeting, spotlessly clean walls and door and pumped in music at night with cricket and toad sounds included (sounds tacky but was actually very cool). The room was also very nice. A touchscreen phone which gave instant access to things like room service, concierge and wake up calls. The flat screen tv was very nice in size and had actual HD programming. The bathroom was also very updated and stylish with very neat faucets and a bathroom sink like no other one i've ever seen before. The high speed internet access (which i had to purchase due to my VZ Card not being useful from the 9th floor) was very fast but absurdly priced. This HAS to be some kind of record. My high speed internet total for one day was a wallet busting $21. Overall i thoughly enjoyed my stay at the Wit and I definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience.”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: We spend a few weekends in Chicago a year and, upon hearing all of the buzz about theWit, we decided to give it a try. Overall, this was an impressive stay, and the property has a lot going for it. That said, it's not a hotel designed to appeal to every type of guest, so choose carefully. Generic does not describe theWit! The property has great design. It's modern, but NOT in an understated way -- theWit screams its design from every surface: loud prints, bright colors, funky elements, bird sounds in the hallways, showy in-room technology. It wants its design to get noticed. That didn't bother me, as I liked most of the design choices and was able to see humor in those things I didn't love, but it's not for everyone. Overall, the design of this hotel is in itself an experience, and that makes for a fun visit. The name of the hotel is fitting -- there's witty stuff, from choosing which Second City actor you want to make your wake-up call (and setting it on a touch-screen phone in your room) to little "gifts" that are put on your bed every day. We got a Slinky one night; one of those jar-opener pads another night; and, to celebrate July 4th, an American flag on the third night. Upon check-in to our room, we also had a nice handwritten note from the hotel's general manager and some homemade lollipops that were not only fun, but delicious! The room had some spectacular elements. Thanks to my Hilton HHonors status, we were graciously upgraded to a "spa king" on a high floor. It featured a deep-soaking spa tub and separate shower and, most impressively, floor-to-ceiling windows (including in the bathroom!) that offered a corner view that was almost 180 degrees. We could see the lakefront, State Street, and Lake Street. It was gorgeous -- very urban, very chic -- the perfect room for an urban weekend getaway. As impressive as the room was, there were some things I didn't love. Most importantly, the bed. For a hotel that's fantastic in so many ways, the bed was a real disappointment -- we found it uncomfortable. The bedding was very basic and not very soft. I've stayed in other DoubleTrees with much more comfortable beds. While the floor-to-ceiling windows offered incredible views, they made temperature control in the room a challenge, and throughout our stay the room was often too warm for our comfort (admittedly, it unseasonably hot in Chicago, so this would not be an issue during most times of the year). Lastly, the in-room entertainment. Although the system itself is very impressive with its various capabilities, you had to buy the $14.95 package before seeing what movies were available, and the list of movies was less impressive/interesting collection than I've seen at many other hotels with far less showy (and less expensive!) technology. [The good news is that the system includes a DVD player -- so, if you want to relax in your room and watch a movie after a long day of exploring Chicago, bring your own DVD.] While the other elements on the system, such as arcade games, were fun in concept, the controls were hard to use. All in all, though, with the possible exception of the bed, the room's funky design and spectacular views made up for these issues. Service-wise, the hotel was a mixed bag. While at the hotel, service was prompt and very polite; my check-in experience was particularly good. The staff seemed knowledgeable about the local area. Other properties in Chicago have had more nuanced and personalized concierge service, but the concierge staff answered general questions well. The only service misfire was that my partner had contacted the hotel in advance to ask them to work with a florist to place flowers in the room. The concierge was not on duty at the time my partner made the request, but the clerk promised the request would be forwarded to the concierge and taken care of for arrival. No flowers ever got added to the room. While my partner's credit card never got charged, this was a promise unfulfilled, and no follow-up by the hotel staff was ever conducted. The hotel is VERY busy -- bustling lobby and, thanks to the rooftop bar, VERY busy elevators. The sort of elevators where you stop at every floor on the way down to pick up more people and wait for a long time to arrive at your floor. That got old by the 3rd night. The rooftop bar is its own story. It is clearly a very popular destination -- and not just for tourists, but for locals. From a pure design standpoint, the rooftop space is spectacular -- amazing views, cool modern design, a great mix of indoor and outdoor seating. It really does look as good as the website portrays. The scene, however, is quite a different story. While it was (very) clearly for some, it was NOT for us: on Friday and Saturday night, the hotel has velvet ropes out in the lobby, a bouncer, and a long line down the street of people waiting to get in (hotel guests can cut the line, but have to get special passes from the front desk to do so). I just find that velvet rope kind of experience annoying -- I hate places that can't get over themselves...after standing in roped-off lines at the airport, why would you want to do it at a bar? The music was VERY LOUD (as in, had to shout to be heard by the person right next to you loud) hip-hop, the waitstaff was dressed in almost nothing and more interested in making sure you noticed they were wearing almost nothing than actually serving you something, the cocktails were extremely expensive, and the crowd...well, let's just say there were a lot of enhanced body parts, micro-minis, Ed Hardy shirts, etc. I found the vibe of the space disappointing: what could have been a very cool bar with a loungy, low-key, urban-sophisticated feel was in essence turned into a trashy Vegas nightclub. Blech. So, all in all, an experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Wit Is A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: leahtravels1
Reviews.Content: We came for July 4th weekend. I travel often and am very picky-most of my stays are at the Ritz so The Wit was new to me. The staff greeted us with warm chocolate chip cookies and the room was the most modern I have ever seen. The location is superb-right around the corner from the clubs, culture, and some of the best restaurants in chicago. I highly recommend the roof top bar-it is located on the 27th floor which is the top floor-the music, drinks, and staff were all superb. Throughout the weekend, we dined in the hotel's various restaurants-good food and good service. The hotel is also appropriate for all age groups-we happened to be on a girls trip but I saw a lot of families as well. During the weekend, I felt very secure-safety is always a priority when traveling. I will return to The Wit-often.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fivehollins_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed over nite at the Wit on July 4th. Hubby ,2 teen daughters and myself and booked a 2 room king suite with lakeview online for $179 a nite. Which was a great deal. Anyway, checked in at 3pm and our room was ready. Got our free warm chocolate chip cookies. We were on the 24th floor, spectacular views, beautiful artwork, loved the dark wood thru out, but best of all were the bathrooms. ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS!!!! AND CLEAN!!!! I almost forgot about the beds-INCREDIBLE!!! The roof top bar/restaurant was great. This hotel really wasnt a good choice for teens but we did find alot of outside activities to keep them busy. There were alot of shops and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Billing issue resulted in a one star rating.”
Reviews.Author: twillia1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and in a great location. It seemed relatively new and is the exact type of hotel that I like staying in. The room was very comfortable and there was a great view of the other buildings in the city and even a slight view of the Lake Michigan. My biggest concerns with any hotel is the bathroom and the bathroom in my room was excellent. It was clean, spacious, nice and contemporary. However, I would never return after the problem with my bill. When I checked in I told the desk clerk that I would be settling the balance in cash when I checked out. I gave them a debit card for incidentals but made it clear that I would pay the balance in cash when I checked out. Upon checkout, I told the desk clerk that I was paying for the balance in cash. She acknowledge my statement but charged my debit card anyway. She then credited my card and took my cash. The charge went through within a day, but I have yet to see the credit. Both my bank and I have called the accounting department and have basically just been told to wait. This may be minor to others and may have been an isolated incident, but it is inexcusable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline really outdid themselves with this one”
Reviews.Author: Kaosoul05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Location was right next to all the major lines (Red, Brown, Green, etc.) since it was at the corner of State/Lake, right in the middle of downtown. Shopping just south of the hotel on State and head east on Lake, you're right at Michigan Ave. The only bad part was the sheets were a little dirty and since the rooftop is one of the hottest scenes for the city, it was sort of a hassle during the nighttime hours with the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganGuy48906
Reviews.Content: I made reservations to stay at the Wit during NeoCon event in Chicago back in March for the June event. At the time of my reservation I requested a King room and late checkout due to a late day train ride back to Michigan. When I arrived I was told that the hotel was behind in room cleaning and my check in would be delayed well after the 3:00 p.m. stated check in time. I was called about 4:15 and told my room was ready. I was also told I had a two-queen bed room and that no king rooms would be available. The room was modern but dusty in many places-odd for such a new hotel. Beds are comfortable, view was good. I contacted the Careline about my late check out and was told it was not possible due to overbooking of hotel. None of my requests were honored! I will not be returning to this hotel. There are many other hotels in Chicago with more amenities and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie37
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Wit! I can't believe some of the negative reviews from other contributors. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms very trendy and the room-top bar is amazing. I would recommend eating there as well as the restaurant on the ground floor - State Lake I think. Will be recommending this hotel to anyone travelling to Chicago who would like to stay somewhere a bit special :-)

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't blown away, but I was very comfortable and pleased with my stay...”
Reviews.Author: 5StarChic29
Reviews.Content: I went Memorial Day weekend just over a week ago on a girls trip. We chose this hotel after we found out Sofitel didn't have anymore double bed rooms. So, we wanted something we considered equivalent. The Room: Very nice. Chic and contemporary. I was fascinated by the touch screen phone and the TV was a great size. We figured out without even having to read that if we moved anything in the mini bar, we would be charged, so we didn't touch it. The bathroom was not huge, but it wasn't small either. It was a comfortable size. I do wish the tub was bigger though. The sink was different...chic and nice to look at. Some reviews found it to be a major issue but for a stay in a hotel it didn't bother me. The room was very clean. I tend to find any flaw that the average person can't see, and I was fine with this room. It was very clean so I had a comfortable stay. The Location: The hotel was in a reasonable walking distance to most things. Millenium Park was not too far of a walk and neither was Michigan Ave. or even the "Sears" Tower...you would just have to be in the mood to walk. If you weren't, the "L" or the bus were right outside the door so public transportation was very easy. We purchased a 3 day CTA pass for unlimited train and bus rides for $14 and it was a great buy. We even used that to get to and from MDW airport because the train stopped right in front of the hotel for the airport. The Staff: The treatment of the staff was fine. Not the warmest, but I felt respected and was attended to whenever I needed something. There was an issue with our room not getting cleaned the last night...we asked several times via the high-tech phone and even calling in person, but I room was never attended to. When my friend and I went to talk to the front desk, they immediately asked what they could do to make it right without us even having to ask. I was very pleased to see how willing they were to fix the issue. Considering the amount of money we paid to stay there, I was not pleased my room was not attended to. But I will say they were accommodating in making it right. The Roof: we never made it to the roof top bar/club because I never felt I was dressed properly for it and reading in previous reviews, I assumed I would have been turned away even as a guest of the hotel. I would like to experience it one day when in my "club" attire. All in all, I would have nothing against returning to theWit or recommending it to others. I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “An ok stay, nothing extraordinary. But whatever you do DONT eat here!!!”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my boyfriend and i got the spa room and stayed 4 days there. Since we arrived we received an average treatment. Nothing special. They werent rude but they didnt make any difference like in some other 4 or 5 star hotels in which we have stayed at. No smiles, not even when they gave us our doubletree cookie. Our room were very spacious and had a nice view of the city. We could see the Chicago Theatre, the River and even the Bean! Our room had flat tv in the living room and main room, touch screen phones, kitchen (but you cant really cook in there, nice trick to consume their food**) microwave, mini fridge, 2 full bathroom (1st bathroom w/rain shower and tub, 2nd bathroom is fancier w/rain shower and jacuzzi with city view) In my opinion this is the best room spot :) Could sleep pretty well considering this hotel is located in the Loop Area and is not a very tall building. Hotel has also a top roof bar, but couldnt really enjoy it since it seems to be a club and we wanted something more romantic, but is up to you in whether to go up there or not. Is definitely nice though. The location is perfect! Chicago Theater is right around the corner. Walking distance to the Chicago River, Wrigley Building and Michigan Ave. **Cons Im wondering if theWit have food quality standards because believe me, it doesnt look like it. We had breakfast there every single day and i can tell their food is really greasy and when i mean really, is REEEALLY greasy. So greasy that you can even see the oil drops all over your plate. Every single day i expected my food to be better but i always got the same, a greasy meal. So there was no mistake on how they cook. People with high cholesterol be aware or they might kill you!. But the worst part is yet to come. I found a black hair in my food which of course made me lost my appetite. So why would you pay for this when they dont even have variety of meals. I'd strongly recomend you to go eat somewhere else. There are a bunch of restaurants around the corner for less. Also be aware to not grab anything thats in your mini bar or they will automatically charge it to your credit card, even if your intention was never to consume it. The same with the spa amenities. They charged everything we put out of their place. They have a tiny little message wich advises you but if you dont read it you might get caught by surprise like us. I think if you follow these advises i give you, your stay at theWit will be pleasant. Also note this is an adult and couples oriented hotel, not really a family oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give WIT a zero rating, I would.”
Reviews.Author: avanoelle
Reviews.Content: Immature, unprofessional staff at every level. Decor is tacky. Small rooms even for two people. Extremely small, ridiculous size bathroom. The width of the bathroom counter is approximately three feet, with a 30 inch wide flat sink which has a 1 inch depth. You have to stretch to reach the water spicket if you're washing your face, and when I did so my top dipped in the flat watery 1 inch deep sink. The mirror above this wide counter in the bathroom is too far away to stretch over so applying makeup has to be done elsewhere in the room, awkwardly, with your own mirror, because there are no other mirrors in the small room. Weak water pressure in the shower. The "door" to the bathroom is very heavy and attached only at the top, so sliding it shut, to the extent it shuts, is cumbersome. In a busy city with a lot to do, I don't want to waste time dealing with these absurd inconveniences. As guests of WIT, we had priority for the ROOF bar. That didn't happen. When we arrived back after dinner elsewhere a wristband was attached and we were herded into a roped off line leading to an elevator by the most immature, unprofessional individuals I've ever encountered serving as hotel staff. The elevator went up and down several times with people leaving the Roof. After 45 minutes in that line, we were told the outdoor space of the Roof was closing, and later, after more waiting, we could get to the indoor space of the Roof. We should have been told before we were ever strapped with wristbands and herded behind a rope that the bar was at capacity and it would close before we ever got up there. I think this place needs to start over from scratch. Would never recommend it and will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again no question”
Reviews.Author: d_p_richards
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel - the rooms (spacious, nice sized washroom), service, and fitness centre (well equipped, has a yoga room with ipod wall plugin) are great. The location is great in downtown Chicago - right at a loop station, lots of good restaurants and entertainment nearby, and a 5 minute walk from Millenium Park, 10 minutes at most to the Magnificent Mile. If you're staying on a lower floor and don't like noise, the noise from the Loop might be a problem. Rooftop patio bar is very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hilton property and favorite loop hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I heard lots of good things about the Wit on the Hilton Flyer Talk program and it looked like a great place from the outside. In March the hotel I like to stay at in Lakeview was full and found a decent rate for the hotel and decided to give it a try. I was so impressed I booked my April stay there as soon as I got home. The staff on all levels are extremely friendly and go out of their way to please. The rooms I had both times were dcorner spa rooms and very nice and well furnished. I love how there are plenty of electrical outlets in the room. The stand alone shower is very nice and if you enjoy baths the soaking tub is huge. The fitness center is open 24/7 and is free to all guests. The elevators require a room key in order to access guest floors at all times. The sounds of the birds in the hallway is very sothing and I really like the lighting they use in the hallways on the fifth floor. The breakfast was amazing. For gold and diamond members they give you a voucher which is good for up to $17 off anything you want on the menu which I think covers any menu item. The thing I really ;like is on weekends it is good until 2 or 3 p.m. which is nice for a late riser or a person that wants to order lunch items off the brunch menu. They also have 2 bottles of complimentary bottled water for their gold and diamond members in the room. The only drawback of the hotel I didn't like is there is no gift shop but there is a walgreens and 7-11 close by for misc items.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Nojemet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in November, 2009. Something might have been changed, so it is just my impression from that period. Location. Yes, nice view form the roof top, walking distance from the shopping centres, Lake Michigan, metro station is just a few meters from the hotel. But sleeping to a sound of moving metro train... Internet was not free but it was very slow. Breakfast in the cafe on the ground floor... Just two types of cheese, poor quality coffee and one day there was no bread , another day there was no croissant. It was not open buffet, one should make choice from the menu, and coffee, cheese and bread/croissant is my typical breakfast , but there I was disappointed with the poor choice. But the most annoying 'item' is concentrated scent of cleaning agents, that it is everywhere -at the lobby and in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: I must stay that I stayed in 2009, August or so (don't quite remember), so if things have changed I apologize: Stayed here for a week (yes, a week), not long after it opened, on business and loved almost every minute. My room had a river view at the end of a hallway, so foot traffic outside was at a minimum. Must say I've never heard the sound of birds chirping in the hallway, but I loved it! Don't worry, they aren't real birds. Check-in was done with great service. The lobby is small and is not for lounging around in, but it serves its purpose. Location is fine, and you can be on the Mag Mile within a 10 minute walk. Food options were all tasty with good service. Rooms, the most important part, were very comfortable with good beds, TVs, and very nicely appointed bathrooms. One thing that was hit or miss was the bar on the roof...as usual, it was filled with people who have more money than brains, as a single glass of Scotch was more than i have ever paid in my life. On top of that, the first time I went was at 5:30pm, so it was packed to the gills with people. During the day or late at night, it was much quieter. Much has been said about the line for the elevators...simply flash your card to your room and it's not an issue whatsoever. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: mitmit0401
Reviews.Content: already a really cool hotel and in good location, i want to praise their excellent customer service. we stayed in the room till late afternoon one day and they forgot to clean the room up (presumably their rota was finished for the day - it's the new year's eve). hoping to do the countdown in our room we were obviously a little annoyed that the room is still untidy. we were impressed they came up immediately to sort the room out and gave us a separate room to stay in for the night so we will not be disturbed, this was much welcomed. they also gave us coupons to use at their rooftop bar, we would not go to the bar anyway but that was a nice touch. regardless of the gesture of goodwill we were impressed how quickly and how keen they tried to resolve the issues. another thumbs up when they assisted us to rebook our flights when our inbound flight back to the UK was cancelled. will definitely be back and will highly recommend friends to stay with them. amazing value for money for the good room and the good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: in2xtc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful; great location and very convenient. We had a Spa King room with a big soaking tub which overlooked the city with floor to ceiling windows. The room was very large and comfortable. We went to both ROOF and State and Lake for food and drinks and both were great. The valet service took a REALLY long time the first evening but after bringing it to the hotel's attention, they comped both of our night's valet charge. Obviously the hotel wants to make their client's stay as enjoyable as possible and that is very refreshing. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't normally do reviews but this one deserves it.”
Reviews.Author: Zwolman
Reviews.Content: Being constantly on the road I only don't really have/take the time to write reviews, even though often relying on them for picking hotels. This time I make an exception because I really liked my stay in the Chicago theWit. Being part of a sub-franchise of the Hilton-empire, I normally would not have picked this hotel but luckily I let myself be convinced by the very positive reviews. To sum it up: optimal location, very helpful and friendly staff, good room (design but not form-over-function), spacious bathroom with separate shower cabin (water pressure could be a bit better), good food, nice spa and gym (too much geared toward cardio though and no pool) and, above all, ueber-cool roof-top bar. And when the volcanic ash almost prevented me from returning to Europa, staff was were very supportive. All in all, very recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “WOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW Love theWit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roxanne621
Reviews.Content: theWit Hotel was an amazing experience. I stay for a quick weekend and really had a chance to expierence all that theWit has to offer and let me tell you there is so much under one ROOF, literally the ROOF! My stay began with dinner on a busy Friday night in State & Lake Restaurant, despite the amount of people, the service was perfect. Our server did a tremendous job decribing the food, she made our mouths water just with the way she spoke to us. Sure enough the special (lamb) was delicious! Loved the mac n' cheese and the pesto spin on the mozarella salad. The ambiance was a great feel, so rustic, loved the old fashion water jugs! Later on I spotted by ROOF and I was so surprised, its the coolest ROOF top bar I have ever seen! Plus a cool pizza oven and amazing cocktails! It rained but I didn't feel it under the umbrella and the nice heater! April in Chicago and I am on the 27th floor overlooking Chitown!!! Loved it!!! The guest rooms are so hip! My room was so clean! I couldn't find one thing I would change. I ordered Room Service twice and the servers were so friendily. The food was awesome, not your typical room service! I ended my stay with the steel cut oatmeal from State & Lake, nice touch with the 3 sides. Overall, I loved theWit and can't wait to come back. The staff was so happy and nice, I know it's their job but they were real. They really cared about me and I didn't feel like "just another guest." theWit is unique, modern, great location, and truely the hottest spot in Chicago. I can't wait to see where theWit will go next! I thank you for a great weekend!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just shy of a Fifth Star - Bring your extra wallet”
Reviews.Author: SwissMr
Reviews.Content: Hotel was charming and exciting. The location is incredible and buzzes with that gritty city vibe! Like I was in Gotham City (I guess I was:^) ) The staff was truly wonderful, door men exceptional. The Spa personnel were very pleasant and professional. I was thinking 5 star for a while. Alas, there are 6 things that bothered me enough to prevent the coveted 5th Star. Mind you, all are correctable 1.) I ate the same thing for breakfast every day, yet my bill varied by $1.10 to $2.35 over the course of 7 days. 2.) Only one waiter / cook got my omelet order correct. One or two ingredients missing each time. Food quality was very good otherwise. 3.) for a beautiful hotel, I was surprised that the room doors were dirty, or wiped down with a dirty towel leaving visible streaks. Easy to correct, but it looked awful. 5.) I paid daily for internet service which was very expensive for basic service, and if I needed to print documents, I had to go to the business center and use a credit card to access a computer, pay an additional $25 for 32 minutes and 6 printed pages. That was a little insulting after I was spending nearly $15 per day for internet service. 6.) The last kick in the tummy was $46 per night for parking. I know it is Chicago, I know I had in / out access, and fantastic doormen, but really...$46 / night! I walked everywhere because the location is so awesome. That seemed about $14 too much. Being on the corner of Lake and State, near the river, near Trump, the EL, the theaters, Michigan Ave, was fabulous. You are a nice walk to Millenium and many other must see sights. If you use lake street, beware that there is a city college behind the Hotel. Unfortunate since those students looked more like hoods than college students, and their manners were awful., so take Randolph to walk east instead of Lake :^) avoid the "gaggles" and "F" bombs.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with theWit”
Reviews.Author: sayersfan
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! There's nothing not to love about theWit and we really put them through their paces. My entire extended family stayed there - grandparents, families with little kids, prosperous business travellers accustomed to staying at the Four Seasons - we couldn't have been more pleased. TheWit is a relatively new hotel in the W/boutiquey/modern mode but unlike some others it doesn't compromise comfort to pull off this aesthetic. The rooms are surprisingly spacious, spotlessly clean and the location can't be beat. But what really sets theWit apart is the incredible competence and genuine helpgulness of the staff. From the doormen to the guy from housekeeping who delivered hypoallergenic pillows in the middle of the night the level of service was impressive. They were also amazingly welcoming to kids. Loved it loved it loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel....”
Reviews.Author: gwasshoppah
Reviews.Content: theWit was classy, but not what I would consider a business hotel. The decor was very up scale and the rooftop bar had a great ambiance. But for business travellers the comfort & bargain was unfortunately compromised when we got hit up for $15 for Wi-Fi, $45 for parking as well as $10 for a breakfast coffee & muffin. Are hotels migrating to the low-cost model where business guests will have to pay for soap and clean towels?

Reviews.Title: “Work, Relax, or Both - Any Choice comes with Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Because-I-Fly-Fish
Reviews.Content: I was simply amazed at the high level of service I received during my stay at theWit! It began with the prompt check-in process, where I was recognized as a return guest even before the staff member looked at his computer. Then dinner at the State & Lake bar, where the bartender was sociable, attentive, and even recommended the great meal that I enjoyed. Occasionally, while the bartender's attention was on other guests, if my drink was finished a hostess/manager would step in and get me a new one before my empty glass even hit the bar. Wow! I received that same level of service on the Roof the next night, and from room service on the 3rd night. And a "hello" and a smile from concierge, bell, and door staff each time I passed through the lobby. The room was top-notch! I had plenty of room in my suite to spread out, work (one all-night session included), then relax. I enjoyed the HDTV. I enjoyed listening to my iPod on the room's clock radio. I enjoyed the large bathroom and had no problems containing my water to the sink and shower. The bed was extremely large and comfortable. The rooms and views were perfect for relaxing after a hard day of work. The combination of the royal treatment and the great room will keep me returning again and again. I've even requested their Kool-Aid recipe, assuming that the staff is taking something to be so consistently upbeat, polite, and attentive. Thanks to theWit for making me feel like an important guest - that's becoming such a rare experience in business travel these days.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Style Were Central”
Reviews.Author: brbalcer
Reviews.Content: I spent a wonderful winter weekend in Chicago sightseeing and visiting a friend. Every day, I was bustling around town and it was nice to head back to the hotel from time to time to relax. I loved coming back to such a modern building and room. The lobby was so chic and cool, the hallways were filled with nature sounds, and the rooms were so posh. I would grab some Wolfgang Puck tea and coffee (in the room cabinet), open the windows (they actually open) and just listen to the rustle of the city 17 floors below. The bed was a cloud. The shower was enourmous. The three restaurants were just fabulous. (Even if you aren't going to eat or drink, visit the Roof restaurant for a quick city view) On my last day in Chicago, I wanted to shop for the whole day. The concierge showed my how to get to Michigan Avenue (a VERY quick walk) and where a few other popular shops were located. I would never have found those other stores if it weren't for him. Also, they held my luggage for the whole day after I checked out - a huge plus when your flight doesn't leave until later in the evening. My only critic of the whole experience was the television. The digital cable that the hotel subscribes to requires me to hit six numbers just to watch HBO, but oh well. Book your room early for a discounted rate and enjoy this hotel, its location, and the beautiful city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loz1976
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Excellent rooms with lots of attention to detail. The bed was also really huge and very comfortable. The hotel has fun restaurants and the staff are very friendly. I liked the boutique hotel feel, lots of charm too. Great business facilities makes this a recommended hotel for Chicago ( for business or pleasure).

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: LCG7
Reviews.Content: I cannot even express how happy I was with my stay here. The rooms were extremely clean, the location great and the staff was fantastic. I have found through my travels most of the time staff at hotels are pretty good but there is usually one person I deal with per trip who is rude, lazy, etc. Everyone at the Wit was awesome! The room service people were particularly friendly. My food came within 15 minutes on a busy Saturday night, the delivery person was extremely polite and they told me when I was done to call them and let them know how it was and that they would pick up my plates immediately (which they did). The bellmen outside were also extremely helpful. There is nothing like good service and I couldn't be more happy with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhmazing”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation booked at the Residence Inn on Dearborn. As I was browsing online, I saw a link to The Wit. I was hooked once I visited their website! I'm attracted to new hotels with a cool vibe....not to mentioned designed well. The Wit fits the bill! We found a special online so we snagged a pretty good rate. The overall service was great throughout our stay. The front desk staff was able to offer us an early check in (by 4 hrs). Plus they offered us warm cookies upon arrival. During my last night I noticed that my shampoo/conditioner weren't restocked. I called housekeeping and 5 minutes later they delivered me a basket LOADED with goodies.....deodorant, lotion, hair products, sewing kit, etc. Totally exceeded my expectations. We also got a chance to check out the Roof. I've heard a lot of good things. Apparently it gets pretty hoppin in the summertime! The views, layout and vibe were fabulous. Drinks prices were what you'd expect for a hotel bar (albeit much less than crazy NY prices). Having lived in Chicago for a while, the Roof is a much needed sleek downtown bar with great cocktails. It takes it up a notch without being pretentious. If I still worked down the block, I would totally go there for an afterwork cocktail. The other great thing was the yoga room in the gym! I was actually in town for a fitness event, so it was a given that I'd have a mini practice at some point. The room had a bunch of mats, a few props, light switch dimmer, good mirrors and a wall jack for your iPod. Again...just taking it to the next level. State & Lake is a great downtown location. It's near ALL of the trains, plus a ton of buses. Also, State St. is becoming more a shopping destination so The Wit is really well positioned. Argo Tea, one of my fav coffee/tea shops, is nearby along with a bunch of other places to go grab a quick bite. And finally, the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The cable service rocked....not to mention the radio/docking station. It seems like they all offer a good view. They really make it easy for you to enjoy your time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Breber17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wit, and it was really a lovely expereience. Check-in was a snap, and David at the front desk was very pleasant. A big plus with me. Upon our arrival at our room, we found a carmel apple with chocolate shavings which unbelievably delish! The decor was modern, very clean, shockingly enough, actually had a window that opened on the 20th floor. The room was a bit small, but not surprising given it's a down-town hotel. Beds and bedding were cozy and comfortable. Of course the room had the usual incidentals, fridge with overpriced goodies. Again, not surprising. We had breakfast in the restaurant both mornings, and the service and food were very good. The rooftop bar definitely is trendy and has is very much geared towards the younger crowd. The Wit is in a great location -- 10 minute walk to shopping along the Mile. Cabs can easily be grabbed outside the hotel. As far as value - we wanted something special for our friend's birthday. We did indeed get that at the Wit. I think you do have to be prepared to pay a little bit more than usual. Many costly incidentials, but the customer service is downright superior to any hotel I have stayed. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Decor”
Reviews.Author: Tredpositive
Reviews.Content: Thank you Li of Concierge for treating us well as Diamond HHonors members, we appreciated being upgraded to a 1 bdrm suite on upper floor for our special occasion. The decor is very sleak and elegant, although the bathroom's 1" deep large square sink with little counter space were a poor choice by theWit's designer, very unfuntional. We needed some coffee packets and cream, they were brought up very quickly after calling. Later at night, we were uncomfortable with the single's somewhat pickup feeling of groups of people waiting in the lobby and elevator area to go up to the Roof bar. Upon returning from our evening out to play and dinner, it was a bit of weaving our way through these groups, even having to ask if we could get into our elevator. Maybe we are just not hip enough for this scene, LOL, but don't think a hotel should have a nightclub feeling (unless you are in Les Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: PorterE
Reviews.Content: my friends and i stayed at thishotel for an event. We hada great time. Service was great. The roof top bar was great. Just didnt appreciate putting down 100 a night for incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Steph000
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the hotel. We were greeted by friendly staff and were surprised our room was ready considering we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am. We had called ahead to let them know we would arrive early and were happy they could accommodate us. The bed was wonderful. Great to fall into after spending all day and evening in Chicago. We also took advantage of the huge tub which had a menu. If you wanted someone to draw your bath or get you special bathing products all you had to do was ask. The shower was also great, with good pressure, adjustable shower head, and warm. I believe someone mentioned the noise of the trains, we did not hear any noise from the trains. However, our room was on the corner, facing the river so we were as far away as you could get from the trains. We were only on the 16th floor (there are 27) On another note, our room rate, booked through their website, came with free breakfast which we were more than happy to use. In fact, we had scrumptious meals at State and Lake. Each voucher was equal to $14pp which was more than adequate for the pricing on the menu. I would highly recommend the custard laced french toast with a mimosa! My spouse recommends the eggs Benedict with a flight of beer (we were eating breakfast at ~12) My husband would also like to note that this hotel serves great beer! Oh and while we didn't order room service, it look reasonable. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend the hotel for a getaway. **tip, if you are renting a car, there is a parking lot that is MUCH cheaper right next to the hotel, and if you are taking the train in, the blue line is only about 2.5 blocks to the hotel, easy to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVON2
Reviews.Content: We would come back to this hotel in a second! Very nice and comfortable. It's a bit more modern in style. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Food was excellent. Next time we come back, we will be staying here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at The Wit Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AUFan01
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two day stay at The Wit Chicago and it was perfect! The wife and I were celebrating our two year anniversary and Hillary (the amazing concierge) and crew made it special. He had the King Jr Spa Suite which was enormous! Complete with two 42 inch LCD HDTV's, kitchen, huge jacuzzi tub, comfortable bed, and a very nice view. A special touch was the champagne + chocolate strawberries waiting for us in the room after we got home from dinner the first night, complete with a hand written note. The main restaurant, State and Lake, was also very good. Enjoyed Brunch on Sunday and some great beers later in the afternoon. In addition, The Roof Bar on the top floor was one of a kind. Innovative drink menu and breathtaking views. Just try and avoid it late on Fri/Sat night because it gets kinda packed. I would recommend trying to enjoy a pre-dinner cocktail earlier in the afternoon to better enjoy the view and avoid some of the crowds. We also enjoyed terrific massages at the The Spa @ The Wit. Elie and Angelyn come highly recommended! This property is in a great location as well! Right next door to the Chicago Theater, only a few blocks from Millennium Park and a short cab ride to Miracle Mile. Couldn't have asked for anything more from The Wit! This is my place in Chicago from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LisaT18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a night out in town for his birthday and we were not disappointed. When we first arrived it was about 4:20pm (check in time starts at 4pm) and we were told our room was not quite ready yet and that it may be a little bit of a wait. We were given a couple of warm cookies and sat down for maybe 5-10 mins. When they came to let us know the room was ready we were offered a complimentary bottle of wine for our wait! We didn't even think the wait had been that bad, although found it very generous and needless to say left us with a positive view of the staff. The room itself was very beautiful and big! We stayed in the junior suite, which had a kitchen area (with dishes/glasses/utensils), a couch with a pull out sofa, two large TVs, a super comfy bed, and really nice bathroom (two person soaker tub and a separate glass shower). The location of the hotel is great too. It's right next to the el, and not even a block away from the Chicago Theater (where we were heading). Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more....”
Reviews.Author: flowrida
Reviews.Content: When reading these reviews there's always a doubt whether it's as good (or as bad) as previous travellers have said but let me assure you theWit is 100% as good as you've read. We stayed here for 6 nights beginning of January and were absolutely delighted. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful - and cookies were gratefully received as we checked in. Our room was very large (and clean which is most important to me) and as we found out very quiet. When you alight from the lifts there is birdsong softly playing in the hallways which we thought very sweetâ€¦ and then I think in the evening crickets can be heard! Each morning we had breakfast in State and Lake (the restaurant on ground floor), excellent food and great staff. If we wanted something that wasn't on the menu they were more than happy to get it fixed for us. Each evening they did turn-down service and left a little Wit gift in the room - nice touch. Location is excellent - we came into O'Hare so all we had to do was get the Blue Line all the way to Clarke & Lake station - out the station and two blocks to your left and you're at the hotel. All in all a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “4th Trip to the WIT-Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Doverdude
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the WIT on 4 different occasions since it's opening last summer. A bit for business and some for pleasure including our most recent 4 night stay over Christmas. The combination of well designed rooms, comfortable beds, great electronics, etc, make the rooms/suites a great value. The restaurants had something for everyone-including the mother-in-law, and having access to the health club and Spa (for the wife) made for a great stay during what could be a tough time to be in Chicago. Young or old, if you are looking for a hotel that provides that intimate feeling with all the touches and services of a large hotel but with great service, the WIT is the place. One last item about our recent stay, with two days notice the concierge was able to secure 5 seats in the first 10 rows to the Addams Family play playing down the street at the Ford Theater. Face value!

Reviews.Title: “The Wit has wit! and is a gorgeous NEW hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: greychops
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to go to Chicago last weekend and ended up having a g-r-e-a-t time! First of all, we used Hotwire to pick our location and 4star hotel... and got a great deal on The Wit. Come to find out this hotel is in a fantastic location and is only a few months old. So everything was beautiful and new. The rooms were large with firm but plush beds, beautiful bathrooms with modern fixtures, the whole hotel had modern funky decor. And a few fun details like in the morning they piped in the sound of birds tweeting in the hallway (almost inaudible, but very quirky and memorable.) And at night if you listen carefully you can hear them piping in the sound of crickets. I'm not joking! The Wit has wit! The hotel itself has two restaurants and a rooftop bar, Spa, fitness center, and more. The only downside was you had to pay $10/day to hook up to their internet.
